loans.name: Bonifrida

texts.en: Bonifrida is 26 years old. She has 2 children who are 6 and 4 years old. Bonifrida owns a general store where she sells cooking oil, Vaseline, salt, soap, etc.. She works together with her husband. They have been running this business for the past 7 years. She is requesting a loan to buy more cooking oil, Vaseline, salt etc. She plans to save all her profits and use them to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items for her general store

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.en: Juvenal is 54 years old. He has 5 children; one is already married while another is 10 years old. Juvenal sells food items such as beans and sorghum. His wife is a farmer. He has been selling food stuffs for the past 20 years and this business has enabled him meet the needs of his family. He is requesting a loan to buy more food items to sell.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs such as beans, sorghum, etc.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Chin K., 28, is a resident of Siem Reap province. She is a vendor who sells items such as pork and beef in the busy local market, earning an average of $5 a day. She is married to Mr. Chhorm Krouch, 36, a butcher, and they have three school-aged children. Chin K. would like to request a loan from Kiva to rebuild a new hedge which has broken. She hopes to use the remainder to purchase more meat to sell. This will provide her with additional profit, which she will use to better meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: to rebuild a broken hedge and to purchase more meat to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a married woman with 2 children. The oldest child is 23. Her husband works as a farmer. 

Corazon is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been farming for 25 years. She earns 12,000 PHP per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds. In the future, she hopes to improve and make her farming successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is 29 years old and married. He and his wife do not yet have children. For the past two years, Elias has owned a general store where he sells sugar, cassava flour, and peanuts. His wife runs the business with him and the store allows them to easily meet their needs. 

Elias is requesting a loan to buy more food items such as cassava flour and peanuts to sell. With the profit he hopes to make, Elias would like to finalize the construction of his house.

loans.use: to buy food items such as cassava flour and peanuts to sell

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say P. is a 52-year-old local rice farmer who lives in Kompong Cham province. She and her husband work together in the farming business. The couple has five children, all of whom are single. To help with the family's daily expenses, one of their children is employed as a building construction worker and earns an average daily income of $3. Because their farm is not near a watering system, Say P. would like a loan to buy a pumping machine for irrigation.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine for irrigation.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is 55 and married with two children. Her oldest child is 22. She and her husband work as farmers and Fortunata has been farming for ten years. She farms in San Francisco, Agusan del sur and earns 12,000 PHP a month.

Fortunata is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Josephin

texts.en:
Josephine is 31 and married with three children. Her eldest child is 13. Josephine’s husband works as a farmer. She is also a farmer and for the past five years has been working in San Francisco, Agusan del sur. Josephine earns 13,000 PHP a month. 

Josephine is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. In the future, she hopes to make her livelihood successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is 24 years old and single. He owns a shop where he sells many items such as soap,Omo,shoes and traditional fabric known as bitenge. Eugene is very hard working and has been having this business for the past year.Since starting his business he has been able to buy a piece of land. 

Eugene is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes and increase his profits. In the future, he plans to open up a bar in addition to his business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Luisita

texts.en:
Luisita is 43 and married with five children. Her eldest child is 13. Luisita’s husband works as a farmer. She is also a farmer and for the past five years has been farming in San Francisco, Agusan del sur. Luisita earns 10,000 PHP a month.

Luisita is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. In the future, she hopes to make her livelihood successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Khean

texts.en: Khean K. is a 48-year-old married woman and mother. She lives with other family members in her own small home in Kompong Cham province. She owns a piece of land, inherited from her grandmother, which she and her husband use to plant rice crops annually. The couple has five children; three are single and two are married. Two of their children work in the garment industry. Khean K. plans to use her loan to buy a cow to help her in the farm field.

loans.use: to buy a cow to help her in the farm field.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 40. She is a married woman with seven children. The oldest child is 14. Her husband works as a farmer. 

She is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been farming for two years. She earns 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds. In the future, she hopes to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 33. She is a married woman with two children. The oldest child is 12. Her husband works as a farmer. 

She is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been farming for 10 years. She earns 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds. In the future, she hopes to succeed in her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro M. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. He is 54 years old. Pedro is married and has ten school-age children. Pedro owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Pedro joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedro has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Pedro is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional groceries to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Pedro from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with five children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a retail shop, selling from home to her neighbors. In addition, she also does some farming, which contributes to her other source of income. A major challenge Mwanaisha faces is that of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she is requesting, she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, dry fish, tomatoes, sugar, and kerosene. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, dry fish, tomatoes, sugar, and kerosene

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 50. She is a married woman with six children. The oldest child is 25. Her husband works as a farmer. 

She is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been farming for 7 years. She earns 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds. In the future, she hopes to live an abundant life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Monique

texts.en: Monique is 22 years old.  She has two children, ages 4 and 2 years; they are not yet in school. She owns a store in which she sells cooking oil, Irish potatoes, and kerosene. She has been running this business for 2 years. This helps her provide all the requirements of her family easily.  She is requesting a loan to buy more cooking oil and Irish potatoes in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Abunzubumwe Rsz Group

texts.fr: Theogene Sibomana est agriculteur de riz, chef du groupe Abunzubumwe, et client d’ACB depuis 2011.  Il est marie, et il a 10 enfants entre 7 ans et 22 ans, et une personne en charge.  Quatre de ses enfants vont a l’ecole.  Il est ne au Rwanda, et il a fini 4 ans d’ecole primaire.  Ce credit est son premier cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’oeuvre pour son activite d’agriculture de riz.  Il voudrait devenir un agriculteur moderne dans le secteur de Rusizi, et bien eduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Theogene Sibomana is a rice farmer and the leader of the group Abunzubumwe. He has been a client of ACB since 2011. He is married and has ten children, aged 7 to 22, plus he has another person in his care. Four of his children attend school. Theogene was born in Rwanda. He has completed four years of primary schooling. 

This loan cycle is his first one with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor for his rice-growing business. He would like to become a modern farmer in the Rusizi district and to educate his children well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khoudor

texts.ar: خضر في عمر 54 سنة متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في بيع اللوحات والبراويز له في عمله 37 سنة يحب عمله ويبتكر فيه يريد دائما التطور والتحسن في العمل كان للقرض السابق من المجموعة الاثر الجيد في تحسين الوضع المادي للمحل وتطوير المهنة يتميز بالبضاعة المميزة والاسعار الرخيصة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة للمحل ومساعدة الاخت في دفع مصاريف الزواج وذلك من خلال ما يميزه في ربط العلاقة العائلية ومساعدة الغير فهو يريد دائما ان يطور نفسه وعائلته وكل من حوله يحلم دائما بان يمتلك مكان اكبر حتى يستطيع تطوير العمل
texts.en: Khoudor is 54 years old and married with two children. He works selling paintings and frames. He has 37 years of experience in this field. He likes his work and is innovative in it. He is always looking for ways to develop his business. His last loan from al-Majmoua had a positive impact on the financial aspect of his store similarly as it helped him to progress in his profession. He stands out in his field due to his unique inventory and low prices. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy new inventory for his store, as well as help his sister pay her marriage expenses. He wants to help his sister because he has a strong relationship with his family, as well as because he believes strongly in helping others. He always strives to develop himself, his family and those around him. His dream is to own a bigger store so that he can develop his business even further.

loans.use: buy new inventory for his art store as well as assist his sister in paying expenses for her marriage.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 38 years old and married with two children.  He earns a living from his rental units; he is also employed.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and his living standards.  He has learned how to manage his finances by saving his money.  He hopes to grow his business even further in the future.  He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to help him construct more units to rent.

loans.use: To build rental units.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is 34 years old and married with two children.  He does printing and photocopying to earn a living.  Nicholas has been in this business for ten years and has one employee.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, his business has improved and, hence, so has his living standard.  He hopes to have a stable business in the future.  He has requested a loan of 80,000 KES to buy printing papers.

loans.use: To buy printing papers.

loans.name: Barack

texts.en:
Barack O. O. is thirty-two years old and married. His wife helps him run his business, and they have five children between the ages of eleven and one year old.  They hope to provide their children with a good education to the University level.

Barack's business is located at the busy Juakali Market in Nairobi. He makes and sells items such as steel doors, metal boxes, and cookers. He serves the local people. He has been in this business for fifteen years and has four employees. He says that his business is profitable, but a major challenge is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He will use the loan of KES 85,000 to buy scrap metal to grow his business. He hopes to expand the business until it becomes a company that can provide employment to many people. Barack describes himself as dedicated, obedient, and God-fearing.

loans.use: purchase scrap metal for his business.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachel is 32 years old and married with three children who are in school.  To earn a living, she runs a retail shop.  She also practices dairy farming for extra income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to grow her business and begin saving money.  She hopes to expand her business further in the future by opening other outlets.  She has requested 40,000 KES to buy cooking fat, sugar, maize flour, and salt for her business.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, sugar, maize flour, and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Wanjiku

texts.en: Wanjiku is a 70-year-old member of Faulu Kenya. She is married and has seven children.  She does farming to earn a living.  She has been farming for 10 years. She was previously growing vegetables to earn a living.  She previously took a loan, which she used to buy pigs.  She has requested another loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings, which she will use to buy a dairy cow.  She hopes to find other markets so as to sell her farm produce.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cattle.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is 36 years old and is married with three children. She does farming to earn a living. She has been farming for the past ten years. Through Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, she has been able to buy dairy cows. She hopes to own a pick-up for transporting farm produce in the future. She is requesting 17,000 KES to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase young cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cattle.

loans.name: Annelyn

texts.en:
Annelyn is 29 years old and is married. She has two children aged five and three. Her husband works as a farmer.
Annelyn is engaged in farming. She has been assisting her husband in growing rice and corn for five years. They earn 5,000 PHP from farming. Annelyn also manages a sari-sari store. She sells items such as canned goods and noodles. She plans to use her loan to purchase rice and corn seeds, fertilizers and additional items to sell at her store. In the future, Annelyn hopes to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn seeds, fertilizers and additional items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Balyejusa Ttikkalu Farmers Group

texts.en: Andrew, 43 years old, has been engaged in a pig sales business for the past eight years in Kampala. Andrew, who is happily married with four kids and is also a teacher, says he started this business with savings from his agro sales business. Pork is a delicacy liked by many people in and around Kampala. As a result, Andrew has many buyers for his pigs. Andrew says he has been able to consolidate on his profit base with sales from this business. The business generates 100,000 shillings profit monthly. Andrew says he will use this loan to purchase more pigs to resell.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to resell.

loans.name: Selfa

texts.en:
Selfa, age 55, has been in the business of raising pigs for five years. She also helps her husband grow rice crops on their farm. They have a 20-year-old child. 
 
Selfa plans to use her loan to purchase pig feed and vitamins. In the future, Selfa hopes for her piggery to expand.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Aynur

texts.en:
Aynur Q., age 45, carries out her daily work herding her grazing cattle in an area near the city of Bilasuvar, where she is from. She and her husband have been dedicated to this occupation for the last six years. This is the only financial income for the family. Aynur is the dedicated mother of three children.

Aynur wishes to buy calves for breeding and so that she can increase monthly turnover. She is therefore asking for a loan of 1,000 AZN. She promises to repay on time.

loans.use: to purchase two calves for breeding

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia B. is a married woman with three children. She is a farmer working in Bunawan Agusan Del Sur.  Cecelia has been growing rice for 15 years.  She earns PHP 20,000 per month from her farming. 

Cecilia plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies. She hopes to fund her children's education through the income this provides.  In the future, Cecelia hopes to buy a bigger farm to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm materials.

loans.name: Leonilo

texts.en:
Leonilo S. is a 41-year-old married man living in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur.

Leonilo has run a sari-sari store for 21 years. He also tills land where he grows rice crops. He earns about 30,000 PHP per month from the farm and store.

This loan will be used to purchase dry goods and additional merchandise for his store. Through this, he will be able to offer his customers a greater variety of products. 
 
In the future, Leonilo hopes to have a bigger store and earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase dry goods and additional merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 10 lambs and 5 sheep.

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii is a divorced woman with nine children, one of whom still attends school; the others have graduated. She lives in a house that they own, which has no electricity or running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, Mealii has operated a vegetable-selling business.  She sells from a stall at her home to her neighbors and passersby. Mealii faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season, most people have enough food from their own farms, and the demand for her products is lower. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan she is requesting, Mealii intends to purchase bundles of dry fish, sacks of vegetables, and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of dry fish, sacks of vegetables, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia M.  is a 65-year-old married woman living in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur.  Letecia has run a rice farming business for 30 years. This business earns 10,000 PHP per month.

Letecia will use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies. 

In the future, Letecia hopes to improve her business and earn a larger income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Najwa

texts.ar: نجوى في عمر 46 سنة متزوجة تعمل في بيع ماكنات الطباعة و حبال اكياس لها في عملها 14 سنة تحب عملها وتسعى دائما الى دعمه وتطويره فهي مثابرة ونشيطة وتسعى الى تحسين وضع عائلتها ووضعها المادي والاجتماعي تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة وتطوير المصلحة حتى تزيد من مدخولها الشهري فهي تعتمد على نفسها وتعيل افراد عائلتها تعمل بكد ولا تكل عن طلب التقدم وتطوير الذات لها زبائن من محيطها وجيرانها وقد واجهت صعوبات مادية من خلال المنافسة في المحيط تتميز بالمعاملة الجيدة والتعامل مع الاخرين
texts.en: Najwa is 46 years old and married. She works selling printers and straps for bags. She has 14 years of experience in her work. She likes her work, and she is always trying to improve it, as she is diligent and active, and trying to improve her family's material situation and social status. With a loan from al-Majmoua, she would like to buy goods for her business in order to improve it as well as in order to increase her monthly income. This is all the more important as she relies on herself in providing for her family. She works hard, and she never tires of seeking ways to progress in life and develop herself. She has customers from her community and from among her neighbors; however, she is facing material difficulties because of the competition in her community. She stands out in her field due to her good dealings with others and her overall good conduct.

loans.use: buy goods for her store where she sells printers and straps for bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cattle.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.en:
Akbar U. is a 37-year-old farmer who is married and has three sons. He has been breeding cattle since 1998, starting with initial capital of 20,000 KGS. Today he has milk cows, sheep and horses at his farm and also cultivates a plot of land where he grows corn, wheat and vegetables. 

Akbar wants to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to buy more milk cows in order to increase milk sales and acquire new customers. With the revenues from this loan, he plans to build a barn for his cattle to provide good conditions of cattle maintenance. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two baby calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase six sheep and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase one cow and fodder.

loans.name: Salam

texts.ar: سلام عمرها 43 سنة وهي عزباء تعمل في محل ميني ماركت لها تاريخ من العمل جيد 10 سنوات تعتمد على نفسها وتريد ان تؤمن مستقبل جيد تسعى الى تطوير العمل وزيادة المدخول وخاصة انها تعاني من منافسة في محيطها تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة للمحل وتقوية المحل لها زبائن من جيرانها والسواح تسعى الى تطور عملها هي امراة محبة للحياة تعمل منذ صغرها وهي تساعد اهلها في تحسين وضعهم الامادي وتأمين الادوية اللازمة تسعى الى ضم العائلة والالتزام بهم ومساعدتهم
texts.en: Salam is 43 years old and unmarried. She works in a mini-mart, has done so for ten years, and has a good history in her work. She is self-reliant and wants to secure a good future for herself. She is trying to develop her business and increase her income, especially in light of the fact that she is having difficulties with the competition in her community. With a loan from al-Majmoua, she would like to buy goods to improve her store. She has customers from among her neighbors as well as from among tourists, and she strives to improve her business. She is a woman who loves life and who has worked ever since she was young, and she is currently helping her family improve their material situation as well as obtain their needed medicines. She strives to help support her family and bring them together as she is very committed to her family.

loans.use: buy new goods for her mini-mart.

loans.name: Izzat

texts.en: Izzat S. is a 38-year-old cattle breeder who has owned his business for the last 5 years. He is married and has three children. His wife actively helps him feed and look after the animals. Izzar usually buys baby calves for a low price, fattens them and then sells them for a profitable price in two months. He takes his cattle to a livestock bazaar or sells them to local people. Izzar has applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase more cattle and increase his income, which will help improve his family's living conditions. We believe his clear goals and experience will bring him success.

loans.use: to purchase two cattle.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine N. lives in the Kisaasi neighbourhood of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 2 children, neither of whom is in school. Justine has a business of a retail shop.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days each week. She also generates additional income through  selling piped water.  Justine has requested for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of rice, sugar, cooking oil, and baking flour. The main business challenges for Justine include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to own a fully stocked supermarket.  Justine lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include utility bills and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and baking flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more food items for his store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay the cost of manual labor for rice farming

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school; the other is still too young. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Her greatest business challenge is the high cost of transportation and the seasonality of products. She dreams of expanding her business to improve her living standards. 

With the 20,000 KES loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Gelaida

texts.en: Gelaida  lives  in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has four children, none of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her grandchildren).Gelaida has a business of cereals. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Gelaida sells her products on a wholesale basis in a shop. Gelaida has requested  for a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of rice. She also generates additional income through piped water.The main business challenges for Gelaida include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van.   Gelaida lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills and for food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.ar: سوسن امرأة متزوجة وام لأربعة اولاد تعمل في بيع الزهور والشتل الأصطناعية والطبيعية عملها مستمر من اربع سنوات تتميز به كثيرا في محيطها حيث انها تشتهر في منطقتها بجمال الزهور ونظافة المحل وتنوع البضاعة ولكنها تمر الان ببعض المصاعب المادية في تطوير عملها حيث انها تعاني من المنافسة لها حب كبير لعملها وتميز تريد من خلال طلبها قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة لتقوية وضع محلها وتنوع البضاعة فيه تحب اولادها وهي تساعد على اكمال تعليمهم وتريد لهم دائما العيش الرغيد من خلال تأمين كل ما يلزم لعائلتها هي نشيطة محبة للعمل وتعطي ازهارها الحنان
texts.en: Sawsan is a married woman and a mother of four. She works selling real and artificial flowers and plants. Her business has been going for four years now, and it stands out in the area due to its reputation for beautiful flowers, diverse goods, and cleanliness. On the other hand, Sawsan is having some material difficulties right now as a result of the competition in her field, preventing her from developing her business. She has a great love for her work. With a loan from al-Majmoua, she would like to buy goods for her store in order to diversify her inventory. She loves her children and is helping to put them through school, and she wants to provide a comfortable life for them by ensuring her family has everything it needs. She is active and likes to work, and she tends to her flowers with care.

loans.use: buy new flowers and plants for her flower store.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida K. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members.    

Aida has a business of a retail shop. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. 

Aida has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap.      

She also generates additional income through rental rooms. Her goal and aspiration is to own a wholesale shop. Aida lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is currently in the business of selling bread. She is 37 years old and has four children, two of whom go to school. 

Angelina is requesting a loan in order to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to build a concrete house in the future using the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bread to offer for sale

loans.name: Ludevile

texts.en:
Ludevile S. is a married woman with three children. She plans to fund their education through the income that her loan provides.

Ludevile is a farmer working in Bunawan,  Agusan Del Sur. Ludevile has been growing rice for 22 years.  Ludevile earns 15,000 Philippines pesos per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, Ludevile hopes to buy a bigger farm to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic P., age 24, has been engaged in rice farming for 20 years. This business earns 15,000 PHP per month. Marivic is married and lives with her family in Bunawan, Agusan del Sur. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. 

In the future, Marivic hopes to improve her business and to earn a bigger income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel Barios, age 30, has been operating a rice farming business for 30 years. This business earns 10,000 PHP per month. He is married and lives with his family in Bunawan, Agusan del Sur. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. 

In the future, Roel hopes to improve hid business and to earn a bigger income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline N. is a poultry farmer.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. She is a widow living in the Kisaasi neighbourhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She supports two children.

Caroline sells her chicken products in a shop by means of wholesale. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of chicken feed. She also generates additional income through offering piped water. The main business challenges for Caroline include transportation and seasonality. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and eventually to own and operate a fully stocked supermarket. Caroline lives in a home that she owns; she has access to both electricity and and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of chicken feed

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is a 33-year-old married man living in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. He has 2 children aged 4 and 2. 

Ruel runs a rice farming business. He tills his land and prepares it well for cropping. Ruel sells his harvest to rice traders. He works hard to provide for his family and sustain his children's education.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. In the future, Ruel hopes to improve his business and earn a larger income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more seeds, fertilizer and tools

loans.name: Jessika

texts.en: Jessika is currently in the business of selling charcoal. She is 41 years old and married with one child who does not go to school. Jessika requested a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando P. is 41 years old, married and living in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. Rolando has run a rice farming business for 30 years. 

His loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future Rolando hopes to improve his business, buy a bigger farm and earn a bigger income to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en: Bella R. is 53 years old and single with a 9-year-old son. Bella is a farmer working in Trento, Agusan del Sur. She has been growing rice for five years. Bella earns 8,000 Philippine pesos per month from this business. Another source of income for her is basket weaving. This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers for her farm and raw materials for her other business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her farm and raw materials for her other business.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: 56-year-old Carmelita A. is married with five children. Her eldest is 40 years old and the youngest is 26. Carmelita has been a rice farmer in Trento, Agusan del Sur for 30 years now. Aside from farming, she is also into a basket making business. She earns 10,000 Philippine pesos per month from this venture. Her loan will be used to buy rattan and pay for labor. She only hopes to be more successful in business.

loans.use: to buy rattan and pay for labor for the farm.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 44 years old and married with six children. To earn an income for her family, she works as a farmer in Trento, Agusan del Sur. She has been farming for 11 years now. In addition to this, she also makes baskets for an income. Her loan will be used to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and also raw materials for making baskets. Her main goals are to increase her profit and consistently improve her product and rice yield.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers and also raw materials for making baskets.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is 37 years old. She makes baskets for a living, while her husband works on their rice farm. She has three children and they lived in Trento, Agusan del Sur. For six years, this has been her family’s source of income with earnings of 5,000 Philippine pesos per month. Her loan will be used to buy raw materials for making baskets and fertilizer for their farm. Her dream is to see her children graduate from college and for her to be more successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making baskets and fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter A. O. is 38 years old and married. His wife is a business lady and they have two children, ages 16 and 11 years old, whom they hope to give a good education to the university level. 

Peter's business is located in the busy Juakali market in Nairobi. He makes and sells items such as steel doors, metal boxes and cookers. He serves the local people. He has been in this business for 14 years now. He says that his business is profitable, but a major challenge is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He will use his loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy scrap metal to expand his business. He hopes to grow his business and open another one up-country. He describes himself as aggressive and committed to his work.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en: From Trento, Agusan Del Sur, Norberto is a 57-year-old married father of two children aged 18 and 20. To earn an income, he has been planting bananas and making baskets for four years now, earning a monthly income of Php 2,000. Norberto will use his loan to purchase fertilizers for his farm. He is hoping for business stability to better provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Rovie Jean

texts.en: Rovie Jean is from Trento, Agusan del Sur. She is 24 years old, married and has two children, ages 4 and 2 years old. Her husband is a farmer, while she helps generate income by making baskets. This has been her business for four years now, earning her 2,500 Philippine pesos per month. Her loan will be used to buy materials for basket-making, pay for labor, and buy piglets to raise. She hopes that through her profit, she can renovate her house and increase business income.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket-making, pay for labor on the farm, and buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a divorced woman with four children, two of whom have graduated from school while two still attend school. She lives in her own house, which has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
For the past ten years, Stella has operated a vegetable stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passers-by. Stella faces the major challenges of the high cost of products and high transportation costs in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.
With the loan of 40,000 KES she is requesting, Stella wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables and fruits for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: At 67 years old, Teodora helps her family by making baskets. She is married with six children. Her oldest child is 39 and her youngest is 23. Her husband is a farmer and they live in Trento, Agusan Del Sur. For five years, Teodora's business has earned her family 6,900 PHP per month. Her loan will be used to buy materials such as rattan for her basket-making business.

loans.use: to buy materials such as rattan for her basket-making business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 25 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom go to school. She is currently in the business of selling tomatoes. Rose has taken a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul A. is 30 years old and married. His wife is a farmer and they have a son aged one, to whom they hope to give a good education up to university level.
Paul's business is located at the busy Juakali Market in Nairobi. He makes and sells items such as steel doors, metal boxes and cookers. He serves the local people. He has been in this business for five years now. Paul says that his business is profitable, but a major challenge is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He will use his loan of 30,000 KES to buy scrap metal to expand his business. He hopes to grow his business and eventually open another metal shop. He describes himself as aggressive and committed to his work.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is currently in a business of selling bread. She is 40 years old and married with eight children, all of whom go to school. Anna borrowed a loan to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito P. is a married woman with three children. She is 38 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for fifteen years. 

She sells items like wine, seaweed and dry goods to the people in her community. She earns enough income with her business. 

She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more items to sell in order to provide her customers with a wider variety of products from which to select. 

In the future, Charito hopes to manage a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy more products to provide her customers with a wider variety of selections.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is currently selling fish. She is 25 years old, married, and has four children who all go to school. Rose borrowed a loan to stock more fish to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto E. is 62 years old and lives in Talibon, Bohol, where he has been a fisherman for five years. He is asking for a loan to buy fishnets and bait, which will help him continue his livelihood.

Ernesto works hard to support his family. In the future, he hopes to venture into another business to supplement his income.

loans.use: to buy fishnets and bait.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio G. is a married man with nine children. He is 56 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for five years. 

He sells items like soaps, shampoos and dry goods to the people in his community. He earns enough income with his business. 

He is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more items to sell and provide his customers with a wider variety of product selections. 

In the future, Bonifacio hopes to manage a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell and provide his customers a wider variety of product selections.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace currently sells bread. She is 32 years old, married, and has one child who does not go to school. Grace borrowed a loan to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma N. lives in the Nalukolongo neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has ten children, none of whom are in school.   She has a business of selling bananas.  She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works seven days out of every week. She sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale.   

Fatuma has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas to sell. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenge(s) for Fatuma include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van.  

She lives in a home that she rents/owns, where she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication..

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Jean Louis Robert

texts.fr: Jean Louis Robert M. est travailleur de la construction et elevateur des vaches  dans le secteur de Rubavu.  Il a 31 ans, il est marie, et il a 1 enfant de 2 ans, et aussi une personne en charge.  Il est ne au Rwanda, et il a fini ses « A levels » en école.  Ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter de la toiture, des ciments, planches de rive, et payer la main d’œuvre pour bâtir une maison d’habitation pour sa famille.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de bâtir beaucoup d’autres maisons a louer pour augmenter sa revenu.  Il voudrait bâtir une belle maison pour sa famille alors ils peuvent avoir une meilleure habitation.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait assurer leur bien être.
texts.en: Jean Louis Robert M. is a construction worker and a cattle farmer in the area of Rubavu. He is 31 years old, married, with a 2-year old child and an additional dependent. He was born in Rwanda and has completed his A-levels at school [roughly equivalent to junior college]. This is his first loan cycle with ACB, and he is going to use his loan to buy roofing, cement, and beam planks as well as to pay the costs of labor  in order to have a house built for his family. His business strategy is to build many other houses and rent them out in order to increase his revenues. He would like to build a nice house for his family so that they can have better living conditions. He would like to ensure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy roofing, cement, and beam planks as well as to pay the costs of labor to have a house built for his family

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine currently sells tomatoes. She is 33 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom go to school. Christine borrowed a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and two siblings. She has owned a clothing store since 2010, where she sells clothes designed for all genders and ages. This young woman learned this business by working in a clothing center for a couple of years.  With her business income, she is able to help her father pay the household expenses.  Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her store’s inventory. She says that the loan will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she is hoping to add shoes to sell in her store.

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice currently sells paste. She is 35 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom go to school. Alice borrowed a loan to stock more paste to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more paste to sell.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy N. lives in the Namungoona neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her relatives).  She has a business of selling clothes and has been in this business for six years, working seven days out of every week. She sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.    

Prossy has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of secondhand clothing. The main business challenges for Prossy include defaulters and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand her business. 

She stays in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Antazia

texts.en: Antazia currently sells tomatoes. She is 38 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom go to school. Antazia borrowed a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Vumiriya

texts.en:
Vumiriya lives in the Bulega neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her relatives).  She has a business of selling drinks in a bar. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days out of every week. She sells her products by means of retail.  

Vumiriya has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and sodas, as well as jerrycans of local gin. The main business challenges for Vumiriya include defaulters and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked bar. 

She lives in a home that she owns, where she has no access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more crates of beer and soda and jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals like beans and maize

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora currently sells green vegetables. She is 24 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom go to school. Flora borrowed a loan to stock more green vegetables to sell. She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old married woman from Lebanon living with her husband and one young child. She started her own business in 2004. She bought a big generator to provide electricity to her town. She has chosen this type of business after seeing a need for such services in the region. Over the years, her business operation was exceeding. And she has found an opportunity to expand her business into other areas. This woman works hard in cooperation with her husband who works as an electrician to satisfy the family needs. Today, she is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new tools and supplies in order to fulfill her project and expand her work. This will be her third Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy new tools and supplies

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty currently sells bread. She is 21 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom go to school. Betty borrowed a loan to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy K. lives in the Nsooba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother).  Dorothy has a business of baking. She has been in this business for six years, and she works six days out of every week. She sells her products in shops, by means of wholesale. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baking flour and cooking oil. The main business challenges for Dorothy include defaulters and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand her business. She stays in a home that she owns where she has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and rent.

loans.use: to buy more cartons of baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Protais

texts.fr: Protais T. est agriculteur dans le secteur du Rubavu.  Il a 31 ans, il est marié, et il a un enfant.  Il est ne a Rubavu, au Rwanda, et il a fini 6 ans d’école secondaire.  Ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter des matériels pour son activité d’agriculture des roseaux.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de développer son business, augmenter la capacité tout en sollicitant beaucoup des prêts.  Il voudrait devenir un grand businessman dans le secteur de Rubavu, et construire une maison d’habitation pour sa famille.
texts.en: Protais T. is a farmer in the Rubavu area. He is 31 years old, married, with one child. He was born in Rubavu, in Rwanda, and finished six years of secondary school. This loan is his first experience with ACB. He is going to use the loan to purchase supplies for his agricultural business ( growing reeds). His strategy is to keep developing his business, increasing his volume and taking out many loans. He would like to become a big businessman in Rubavu and build a house for his family to live in.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for growing reeds

loans.name: Ziborah

texts.en: Ziborah N. W., 31, married and a mother of two lovely children, lives with her family in Matisi, on the outskirts of Kitale. For two years she has been selling groceries to the people of Kitale, earning a monthly income of three thousand shillings. This will be Ziborah's first loan from KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock for her business including tomatoes, onions, fruits and vegetables. In the future she wants to expand her business and also educate her children.

loans.use: to add more stock such as tomatoes, fruits, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret currently sells soft drinks. She is 28 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom go to school. Margret borrowed a loan to stock more soft drinks to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school. She  has a business of selling products to restaurants. She has been in this business for one year, and she works seven days out of every week. Prosy sells her products in a market, by means of retail. She has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more food items.  

The main business challenges for Prossy include thieves and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business. She lives in a home that she rents where she has no access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice and chicken.

loans.name: Auma

texts.en:
Auma R. O. is a woman of forty nine years, married and a mother of five, and lives in Tuwan in Kitale. 

For two years now, R. has been operating a shop where she sells cereals like maize, beans etc., she gets a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings from her business. 

This will be R.'s fifth loan from KADET Ltd., she plans to use the entire loan to buy cereals for resale. With the income that she will get she plans to open another shop elsewhere so that she can increase her monthly income. 

In the future she wants to educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: to buy cereals like maize, beans etc. for resale

loans.name: Petronille

texts.en: Petronille is 40 years old and she has four children between the ages of 3 and 19 years old. She sells foodstuffs such as sorghum and beans. She has been selling these foods for six years. This business has enabled her to bring herself out of poverty. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs in order to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her father). Sarah has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days out of every week. She sells her products from home, by means of retail.    

Sarah has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income with her motorcycle. The main business challenges for Sarah include transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her business. She lives in a home that she owns where she has no access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer, and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 54-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two young children. He has been an experienced carpenter for almost 26 years and has owned a carpentry shop since 2002. He works upon the request of the clients and in collaboration with some galleries. He is the main income source of the family. He has taken advantage of a first Kiva loan and was a very good client who made payments on time. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase electrical machinery needed for his work. He reports that this machinery will help him increase his productivity and therefore, his profit, by a large percentage. He hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: to purchase machinery

loans.name: Matet

texts.en:
Matet E. N. is a man of fifty-eight, married, and a father of six lovely children, who lives in Tarakwa on the outskirts of Eldoret town. He buys and sells sheep to the people of Tarakwa and its environs; he has been in this business for four years and gets a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings. 

This will be Matet's first loan from KADET Ltd., he plans to buy sheep for resale. With the income that he gets he wants to repay the loan and buy more sheep for resale. 

In the future he wants to give his children the best education in Kenya.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba T. is a widow taking care of  ten dependents.  She is into multiple businesses, such as selling fish, clothes and making gari for sale. Gari is made from cassava. (In this picture, she is peeling the cassava to make the gari). She has been in this business for some time now and she wants to increase the quantity of gari she sells. She needs a loan to purchase more quantities of cassava to process into gari for sale. The additional income realized from the loan will be invested back into her business so she can take proper care of her dependents.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava to process into gari for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
For the past two years Ama Y. has been selling plastic bowls and saucepans as a peddler at Besease near Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. She is single and has one child. The income she makes from her sales is used to take care of her child and other expenses. A loan from Kiva will enable her to buy plastic bowls in larger quantities for resale. Ama plans to save her new profits to build a shop.
In the photograph, Ama has on her lap some of the plastic bowls she sells.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls in larger quantities for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua S. is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She makes gari (cassava flakes), corn dough, and cassava dough at Elmina, which she has been doing for 10 years. Efua uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Efua will use the loan to buy more cassava to make more gari for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more cassava to make more gari for sale.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis M. O. is a married man and has one child aged one, to whom he hopes to give a good education to university level. Dennis' business is located at the busy Nyalenda market in Kisumu. Kisumu is the region in Kenya that harbors Lake Victoria and is commonly referred to as the lake basin.
Dennis runs a general store in which he sells such items such as beverages, sugar, detergents, flour, cooking oil and so forth to local people. He has been doing this business for two years now. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are other people in the area doing the same business so his customers are not always loyal as they are spoiled for choice. However, Dennis works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 50,000 KES to increase his stock of cooking oil, sugar, flour, rice, detergents and beverages to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to expand his business and become a wholesaler in the future. He describes himself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, detergents, beverages etc.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena E. is a small trader. She sells a variety of items such as slippers, shoes, cassava and plantain at Elmina in Cape Coast. She is married to a farmer and together they live with their six dependents. She has been in this trade for three years and the income she gets is used to supplement the income of her husband to take care of the home. The loan she hopes to receive will serve as an additional income to expand her shoes and slippers business. She anticipates of reinvesting the additional income into building a shop.

loans.use: to expand her shoes and slippers business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua E., a widow who cooks food for sale, is currently taking care of four children at Elmina, near Besease. Ekua has been in food production for 30 years and uses her income for the upkeep of her home. With the loan she will purchase rice, oil, tomatoes, eggs, etc. to cook for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to build a canteen.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, tomatoes, eggs, etc. to cook for resale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua O. trades in secondhand bedsheets and towels in Elmina near Besease in Cape Coast. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in paying for their accommodation and other household expenses. 

Her loan will be used to buy bed sheets and towels to sell to meet the increasing demands of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a kiosk to sell in.

loans.use: to buy bedsheets and towels to sell to meet the increasing demands of her customers.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 26 years old, she has four children who are ages five to seven years; twho of them are adopted. Her husband sells different merchandise.

Odette owns a shop in which she sells soap, flour, rice and salt. She has done this business for 10 years and it has enabled her meet her family's needs. Odette needs a loan to buy more items such as rice, salt, flour etc. in order to make more profits. With the profits she plans to save up.

loans.use: to buy more items such as rice, salt, flour etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is a peddler who supplies her customers with jewelry. She is married and lives together with her husband and two children. She has been in this trade for just three years.  She needs to increase her sales as the demands for other types of jewelry are increasing. A loan will enable her to buy more jewelry to maintain her customers.  Her husband is a farmer. Elizabeth uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth wants to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy a variety of jewelry to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther T. sells porridge and smoked fish at Elmina near Besease. She is divorced and has five dependants.  Esther has been living on the income from her sales of porridge and fish for 10 years after her divorce. She is responsible for the well being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more cartons of fish to process for resale.  She says the income she will be getting as a result of the loan will be reinvested into her fish business.

loans.use: to buy more cartons of fish to process for resale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua N. sells food items such as canned tomatoes, salt, pepper, oil and others. She displays all of these items on a table. She wants to move from tabletop to selling in a shop. To do so, she needs to increase the goods supplied to her customers so she can make more money to build a shop. The loan, when received, will be used to buy food items to sell. She is married and has three children.  Her husband is a farmer. Efua has been selling food items for three years. She helps her husband feed and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy food items to sell.

loans.name: Nyame

texts.en: For the past 25 years, Nyame B. has been making banku for sale at Elmina near Besease.  She is married and together she and her husband take care of their five dependants. Her husband is a farmer. As a responsible parent, she helps her husband to take care of her home.  Her loan will be used to acquire more bags of maize to prepare banku for sale.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to acquire more bags of maize to prepare banku for sale.

loans.name: Selaphine

texts.en: Selaphine is 31 years old. She has five children who range in age from six months to 11 years old. Her husband is a tailor. She sells beans on a wholesale scale. She has been selling beans for six years. This business has enabled her to feed her family and pay her children’s school fees. Selaphine is requesting a loan to purchase more beans and make more profits. She plans to reinvest in her business with the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: To purchase more beans.

loans.name: C4817 Urukundo Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 22 years old and single. He is the president of a group called “Urukundo”. Emmanuel sells bananas. Others in the group have businesses selling beans and sorghum at the local market. Emmanuel employs one person in his business and has one year of experience.  Emmanuel is the first person on the right side. 

Emmanuel and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy a large quantity of bananas to sell. With his profits, Emmanuel and his team would like to use the profits to start saving and to satisfy the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like bananas

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is a married woman with three children. 

She is a farmer in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 40 years now.  This earns her family PHP 4,000 per month. 

Her loan will be used to buy fertilizers, herbicide and seedlings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicide and seedlings

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 30 years old and has two children who are ages 3.5 and 2 years old. They are not yet in school. Her husband is a farmer but also buys and sells different items according to the available market. Vestine owns a shop but also has a milling machine. She has been doing both businesses for 16 years. She is requesting a loan to buy another milling machine in order to make more profits. She plans to save all her profits and make more savings in order to have enough to build her family a house.

loans.use: To buy a milling machine.

loans.name: Naluvule Farmers Group

texts.en: 36-year-old G. Simon has been selling food at the Naluvule food market in Mukono for the past 20 years. This happily married father of four took advantage of the farm that his late dad left for him to start a business, which he credits with extricating him out of hard circumstances. He gets most of the crops he sells from his farming gardens. Over the course of time, he has made significant strides, which in many respects have contributed to his longevity in this highly competitive business. Weekly, he says this business generates 300,000 shillings profit. Simon also ekes out more income from his livestock sales business. With this loan, Simon says he wants to purchase more farm inputs like hoes, gumboots, pangas [machetes], etc., to use on his farm.

loans.use: to purchase more farm inputs like hoes, gumboots, pangas [machetes], etc., to use on his farm.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en: Angelique is 26 years old and has two children who are two years old and one month old. They are not yet in school. Her husband is a farmer. Angelique owns a shop in which she sells sugar, soap, fish, etc. She has done this business for four years and it has helped her develop herself. Angelique is requesting a loan to buy more items such as soap, sugar, etc. to add to her shop and make more profits. She plans to save the profits.

loans.use: To buy items such as soap, sugar etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old Lebanese single woman. She is living on her own. She has been working as a full-time employee in a local company since 2007. But since her income is not enough to cover the high costs of living, she has decided to work in parallel as a private teacher, receiving students at her house. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase required educational tools and perform modifications to the classroom by adding more tables and a bigger wall in order to be able to receive more students. She is hoping to earn a higher income and be able to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase educational tools and update the classroom

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María se dedica al comercio desde hace  doce años, vendiendo plata en distintos estilo y variedades de joyas, lo cual ha sido de mucho beneficio para la familia en donde junto con su esposo han logrado apoyar  a sus cinco hijos.
Inicio con poca joyas, lo que vino a mejorar con los financiamientos que Afodenic, ha otorgado, comprando en mayor cantidad, variedad, lo que sus ventas mejoraron al vender cada día.
Con este nuevo financiamiento comprara prendas de plata y oro laminado, en diferentes estilos. Logrando mejorar las ventas.
Como objetivo a futuro es poder comprar vitrina para poder mostrar con más visión sus joyas.
texts.en:
María has had a business for two years, selling distinctive styles of silver and a variety of jewelry.  This has been very beneficial to her family and together with her husband, she has been able to support her five children.
 
She started with a little bit of jewelry but began to grow with the finance that Afodenic granted.  María began to buy jewelry in larger quanties and varieties and her sales improved each day.

With this new loan, María will buy silver clasps and different styles of laminated gold, hoping to improve sales.  Her future objective is to buy a display case to better showcase her jewelry.

loans.use: purchase more jewelry in different styles to improve sales.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 48-year-old married woman living with her husband. She is from Lebanon.  She has owned a mini market in her village since 2008. She sells dairy products, juices, soft drinks, etc. Her husband has worked as a furniture carpenter since 1985. They cooperate together to reach a reasonable financial level where they can afford the heavy life expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase her shop’s inventory. She is very optimistic and hopes that her shop’s selling rate will increase in the coming years.

loans.use: to increase her shop’s inventory

loans.name: Berlita

texts.en:
Berlita is 58 years old and married with eight grown children. She and her family lives in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur.

To earn an income, she operates a sari-sari store and cultivates their rice fields. Her business started three years ago and provides her family with PHP 4,000 per month. Her loan will be used to buy fertilizers for her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and one sibling. He has been working as a part-time salesman in a library since 2008. In parallel, this young man is pursuing his education at the university. He is studying computer programming and accounting and he is about to finish his third year. This young man knows how to manage his time between his job and his education. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his university education fees. In the future, he is planning to start his career in a computer company to gain experience and be able to help his parents with his income. In the long term, he is planning to open a computer shop in his town.

loans.use: to pay his university education fees.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 24-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband. She's newly married. She has been running a clothing store since 2004. She deals with many tailoring factories. She sells all types of clothes, especially jeans.  Her business income is vital to support her husband in paying the household expenses. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to expand her store’s inventory of new summer collections. She’s certain that she will be able to achieve sustainable growth thanks to the loan. In the future, she is hoping to sell perfumes and cosmetics from her shop.

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory of new summer collections

loans.name: Simeón Dadeo

texts.es: El señor Simeón se dedica al rubro de transporte tiene una moto taxi y un auto, el se dedica a manejar la moto taxi y el auto lo da en alquiler lo maneja el esposo de su hija, la moto taxi la posee por mas de 5 años y el auto tiene menos de 1 año, es casado su esposa trabaja en un fundo por temporadas por la que tiene un ingreso adicional para los gastos familiares, tiene 4 hijos 2 de los cuales ya son independientes y los otros dos se encuentran en colegio, el viene trabajando en esta actividad por mas de 5 años, eligió este tipo de trabajo ya que le pareció rentable vive en casa propia donde tiene cochera y guarda los vehículos ,tiene un ingreso semanal aproximado de s/500 soles su sueño en el futuro es comprarte otra unidad de transporte para darlo en alquiler y ello le genere mas ingresos, el dinero será invertido en darle en mantenimiento a su moto taxi, y a su auto, darle una revisión técnica y revisión eléctrica entre otras cosas para seguir trabajando sin ningún problema y brindarle un mejor servicio a su clientes, Simeón esta muy agradecido con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Simeón is in the transport business.  He drives a mototaxi and rents out a car, which his daughter’s husband drives.  Simeón has had the mototaxi for more than five years and the car for less than one year.  He has been in business for more than five years, beginning when he came up with the idea to rent out a car.

He is married and his wife is a seasonal farm worker, providing additional income to cover family costs.  Simeón has four children, two of them are now independent and the others are in high school.  

He lives in his own house and has a garage where he keeps his cars.  He has a weekly income of about 500 soles.  His dream for the future is to buy another car to rent out to increase his income.

This money will be invested in the maintenance of his mototaxi and car.  Among other things, he wants to give them a tune up and electric inspection  so that they will continue to work without any problems.  This will allow him to give the best service to his clients.  

Simeón is very grateful for the confidence you have in him.

loans.use: give his mototaxi and car a tune up and electrical inspection, among other things.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is 42 years old. She is from Bunawan, Agusan Del Norte. She is married with two children ages 17 and 19. Her source of livelihood is through farming. This has been her business for 10 years now, earning her family PHP 6,000 per month. Her loan will be used to buy fertilizers and seedlings. She hopes to continue her business and improve her yield in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Lubani West Development Group

texts.en: B. Ruth is a 42-year-old happily married mother of nine who runs a shoe sales business in Lubani-Jinja. This business has been in existence for the past three years. Hard work and determination are two factors she credits for her short term success. She carries conviction that if she maintains those attributes and her tenacity, she will last long in this business, which generates her 120,000 shillings as monthly sales revenue. Ruth also does farming. She says with this loan, she is going to purchase more pairs of shoes to resell. In the group photo, one male member's face was not clear so I marked him as not pictured. One woman's face was partly obscured so I marked her as not pictured, too.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 50 years old and married. She is from Bunawan, Agusan Del Norte. She works with her husband on their farm and grows rice. This has been her business for a long time now. The income generated has been her source of livelihood since her children were young. Elena also grows pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to the market.

Elena's loan will be used to buy fertilizer and seedlings. She hopes to continue her business and improve her yield in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es  propia. Hace más de 2 años decidió generarse sus propios ingresos, así que emprendió su negocio de manera independiente, en un inicio ofrecía los servicios de fotografías y filmaciones, sin embargo se le presentó la oportunidad de  vender licores y yogurt, resultándole muy rentable. Desde entonces realiza la venta de estos productos en la calle, en donde logra buenas ventas. Ella trabaja todos lo días, así asegurar acumular más ganancias, ya que su objetivo es tener un local donde pueda vender.
