To be able to increase her merchandize, Santos, wants to buy beverages, dairy products and vegetables with the loan. In the future she would like to expand and stock her store to give her children a better future.

loans.use: buy beverages, rice, dairy and vegetables.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy, de 27 años, es un hombre soltero que cuida de su mamá Ida, de 48 años y de su padre, Marino, de 50 años, con los que vive en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Santa clara.

Humilde como pocos, que adora a su familia la que es el impulso para salir adelante. Fredy cuenta que a pesar de las diversas dificultades que encontró en la actividad agrícola, le gusta mucho el campo.  La siembra de papa, es su principal actividad. Todas las mañanas se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas, donde cuida con esmero sus cultivos. Sobre todo de las constantes enfermedades que sufren; producto del clima de la zona. Hace 8 año que se dedica a ello, tiempo suficiente para conocer las temporadas de sembrío y para coincidirlos con la época de mayor venta, en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de “Tarma”, por ello le molesta mucho, cuando insisten en bajar los precios. Para más adelante tiene pensado, comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas, con ello está seguro que podrá obtener más ingresos. A pesar de que  su principal inconveniente es contar con pocos recursos económicos y mucho más siendo el único que sustenta su familia. Sin embargo trabajará con mucho ahínco para logar su objetivo. 

Él pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos unidos”, y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde se siente contento de poder ahorrar, con su banco comunal, “siempre tenemos que tener dinero, para cualquier imprevisto”, menciona. Aparte de ser un tesorero responsable. 

Fredy, cosechará papa de la variedad “pericholi” en esta semana. Después de ello piensa sembrar papa de la variedad “yungay”, por lo que comprará con el dinero solicitado varios sacos de abono orgánico para poder mantener su siembra sin dificultades.
texts.en:
Fredy is 27 years old; he is a single man that takes care of his mother, Ida who is 48 years old, and his father, Marino who is 50. They live in their own home located in the Santa Clara neighborhood.

Fredy is like very few men he is humble adores his family who give him the drive to get ahead in life. Fredy says that despite various difficulties that he has found in agriculture he enjoys the fields very much. He grows potatoes. Every morning he goes to his fields where he takes very good care of his crops since the potatoes are plagued by constant diseases due to the climate of the area. Fredy has worked in this field for 8 years, enough time to know when the best season is to sow and to coincide it with the best selling period in the wholesaler market of the city of Tarma. This is why he gets annoyed when the buyers insist on him to lower his prices. In the future, Fredy would like to buy his own plots of land and is sure that he will be able to get more income. Despite his biggest obstacles, having small economic resources and being the main financial support of his family, he works with a lot of energy to reach his goals.

Fredy belongs to the “Let’s Work Together” communal bank, this is his ninth loan with MFP and he is happy because he can save with this communal bank, Fredy says, “we always have to have money for any unforeseen expense.” He is also a responsible treasurer.

Fredy will harvest “pericholi” potatoes this week. Later he plans to sow “yungay” potatoes. With the loan, he will buy several sacks of organic manure to be able to maintain his crops without difficulty.

loans.use: buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Bujubuli Agriculture Farmers Group

texts.en: Nathan wants a loan to buy banana stems for planting on his plantation. He is a Ugandan man, age 35, and father to seven children between the ages of 8 and 18 years old. He owns a semipermanent house and dreams of educating his children. He is a farmer and has been in the agricultural sector for six years. He is still reaping tangible benefits. He is a member of Bujubuli Agriculture Farmers Organisation, whose members guarantee each other.

loans.use: to buy banana suckers for planting.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es: Eulalia, natural del distrito de Palmapampa, tiene 33 años, es una mujer sociable y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Félix de 39 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, quienes son el impulso de todos sus esfuerzos. Los verdes campos del poblado de Palmapampa, ubicado en la selva tropical del departamento de Ayacucho, han sido en la vida de Eulalia un lugar muy agradable para trabajar, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio. Hoy cultiva cacao, café y plátano; en total posee 04 hectáreas de terreno. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan la calidad de sus frutos. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos desde su comunidad de Palmapampa  hasta los centros de acopio situado en la ciudad de San Francisco. Con el tiempo espera juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia que pone el orden a todo el grupo. Con el crédito solicitado comprará madera para cercar los flancos de su vivienda ya que las maderas anteriores están deterioradas
texts.en: Eulalia is originally from the district of Palmapampa, she is 33 years old and is a sociable and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, Felix who is 39 years old and their 4 beloved children who provide the drive for all of their efforts. The green fields of the Palmapampa town are located in a tropical jungle of the Ayacucho department; the area has made Eulalia’s work life a very pleasant one. From a very young age her parents taught her to work the fields which she now does on her own land and works with a lot of care and sacrifice. Today she grows cocoa, coffee and plantains; she owns 4 hectares of land. What Eulalia enjoys most about her work is harvesting her fields since she feels that months of hard work give her the quality of her work. She has worked in this field for 15 years and says that the most difficult aspect of her work is hauling her crops from her Palmapampa community to the collecting centers in the city of San Francisco. Eulalia hopes in the future to get enough money to buy new land. This is her third loan with MFP and knows that she has a responsibility in paying all of her quotas on time and is willing to do it. In her communal bank, she is a member that provides order to the group. With the loan she will buy lumber to fence in the sides of her home since the previous wood is deteriorated.

loans.use: buy lumber to fence in her home.

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada San Miguel Soyaltepec esta comunidad tiene una laguna muy grande que da mucha pesca y trabajo cada año, tambien es conocida porque ahi se ubica la presa hidroelectrica Cerro de Oro.En esta comunidad vive el señor Silvestre S., el tiene la edad de 32 años, estudio hasta el tercer grado de secundaria, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos los cuales asiten a la escuela en la cominidad.

Don Silvestre nos dice " yo siempre he trabajado pero la situacion economica cada dia es mas dificil y ningun dinero alcanza y menos cuando se tiene hijos en la escuela, yo platique con mi esposa y decidimos que cuando saliera del trabajo venderia ropa de dama y caballero para ayudarnos un poco mas con los gastos del hogar  y la escuela de mis hijos", Don Silvestre tiene un poco mas de dos años vendiendo ropa y nos platica que la vende en la comunidad con sus amigos y vecinos, nos dice que al principio fue dificil hacer clientes pero ahora ya la gente lo conose y en algunas ocasiones va a su casa a buscar una blusa o un short para regalar en las fiesta. el necesita esta este credito para invertirlo en la compra de blusas, faldas, short,ropa interior,pantalones, playeras, calcetines y vestidos para venderlos posteriormente.

el espera que con esta invesion su negocio cresca y deje buenas ganancias ya que desea que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida y estudien una profesion en un futuro, tambien manda muchos saludos en agradeciemiento a la fundacion por el apoyo que le da al brindarle el prestamo
texts.en:
There is a community in the state of Oaxaca called San Miguel Soyaltepec.   It has a very large lagoon that produces a lot of fish and work every year.  It is also known because the Cerro de Oro Hydroelectric Dam is located there.  Mr. Silvestre Sánchez, 32, lives in this community.  He studied up to 9th grade.  He’s married and has three children who attend the local school in the community.

Silvestre tells us: “I have always worked but the economic situation is more and more difficult every day and money is never enough especially when one has children in school.  I talked to my wife and we decided that I’d sell women’s and men’s clothes when I got off work in order to help ourselves out a bit more with household expenses and my children’s schooling.” 

Silvestre has been selling clothes for a little more than two years and he tells us that he sells them among his friends and neighbors in the community.  He says that it was difficult to acquire customers at first but now people know him and sometimes even come by his house looking for a blouse or a pair of shorts to give as presents at parties.  He needs this loan to invest in the purchase of blouses, skirts, shorts, underwear, pants, 
t-shirts, socks and dresses to sell later.

He hopes that with this investment his business will grow and produce good profits because he wants his children to have a better quality of life and study a profession in the future.  He also sends many greetings and thanks to the Fundación for the support it’s given him in granting the loan.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's clothes.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada San Miguel Soyaltepec esta comunidad tiene una laguna muy grande que da mucha pesca y trabajo cada año, tambien es conocida porque ahi se ubica la presa hidroelectrica Cerro de Oro.En esta comunidad vive la señora Rosalia R. que tiene la edad de 37 años, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria y se encuentra casada con el señor alejandro que trabaja en las linas de alta tencion, ellos tienen 3 hijos los cuales asisten a la escuela en su comunidad. 

Doña Rosalia nos platica que aunque su esposo trabaja el dinero que el gana no alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar ya que cada dia la situacion economica esta mas dificil, asi que decidio iniciar a trabajar para poder contribuir con el gasto y los estudios de sus hijos, ella vende desde hace un poco mas de dos años zapatos por catalago, casa por casa con sus amigos y vecionos de la comunidad, ella nos dice que primero les lleva a mostrar los catalagos, levanta un pedido, lo encarga a sus proveedores y cuando llega el pedido lo entrega a sus clientes y recibe el pago por su producto. Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de Catalogos y zapatos para su posterior venta.

Doña rosalia espera que con este credito su negocio cresca y deje buenas ganancias ya que desea en un futuro tener una pequeña zapateria en su comunidad para ya no tener que andar caminando.

ella se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion por la oportinidad que le esta brindando para que su negocio prospere.
texts.en:
There is a community in the state of Oaxaca called San Miguel Soyaltepec.   It has a very large lagoon that produces a lot of fish and work every year.  It is also known because the Cerro de Oro Hydroelectric Dam is located there.  Mrs. Rosalia R., 37, lives here.  She studied up to 9th grade and she’s married to Alejandro who is a High Voltage Lineman.  They have three children who attend the local community school.

Rosalia tells us that even though her husband works the money he earns isn’t sufficient to cover household expenses because every day the economic situation is more difficult.  She, therefore, decided to start to work to help with expenses and with her children’s schooling costs.  For a little over two years she’s been selling shoes via catalogue sales door to door among her friends and neighbors in the community.  She tells us that first she goes around showing them the catalogue, then she takes orders, delivers them to her suppliers and when the orders arrive she delivers them to her customers and receives payment for the products.  She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of catalogues and shoes for subsequent sale.

Rosalia hopes that her business will grow with this loan and produce good profits because she wants to have a small shoe store in her community in the future so as not to have to go door to door anymore.

She is very grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it’s giving for her business’ prosperity.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
la Sra. Blanca A. A. se dedica a prestar servicios de costurera, Blanca fabrica ropa para cama, cortinas, y cobertores para muebles. su negocio esta ubicado en la colonia Flor de Campo, Blanca trabaja de  lunes a domingo comenzando su actividad desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, Blanca viaja cada semana al Comercial Rodolfo y Almacenes La Confianza para comprar mercadería y así mismo viaja a El Salvador cada 10 días para vender de manera ambulante su producto en los lugares de Santa Rosa, Santa Ana, San Vicente y San Miguel. tambien vende sus productos de manera ambulante en colonias La Kennedy, El Hato y La Quezada de la ciudad capital.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de sus prodcutos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca A. A. is a seamstress. Blanca makes bedding, curtains, and furniture covers. Her business is located in the Flor de Campo suburb and works Monday through Sunday from 9 a.m. until 6 in the evening. Blanca travels each week to the Rodolfo shopping center and La Confianza Stores to buy merchandize and to El Salvador every 10 days to sell products as a roving sales person in Santa Rosa, Santa Ana, San Vicente and San Miguel. She also sells her products in La Kennedy, El Hato and La Quezada neighborhoods in the capital city.

The loan will be used to buy materials to make her products.

loans.use: buy fabrics, threads, cotton, lace, sponges.

loans.name: Floriana

texts.es: Floriana, de 41 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Filomeno de 44 años y su querido hijo Marco Antonio de 04 añitos, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los productos que con tanto voluntad y entrega ha logrado cultivar Floriana y Filomeno, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de cacao, café y frutas cítricas, dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuando los ve grandes y frondosos, lleva10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es llevar lo cosechado hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, lugar donde recibe mejores precios por sus productos. En adelante, espera sembrar más plantas de cacao ya que cuenta con terrenos sin cultivar. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable. Con el crédito solicitado contratará jornaleros para que le brinden el apoyo en el mantenimiento de sus plantas
texts.en: Floriana is 41 years old she is a hardworking woman and lives in a rented home with her husband Filomeno who is 44 and their beloved son Marco Antonio who is 4 years old and is the reason for all of their hard work. The products that they have grown with a lot of affection and hard work have helped them a lot to progress in life. Every morning she works the fields and knows that the care that they give to their cocoa, coffee and citric fruit crops depend on the quality of the products that they get. What she enjoys most about her job is taking care of the crops and is very happy when she sees them big and leafy. Floriana has worked for 10 years in this job and says the most difficult part is taking the crops to the city of San Francisco, a place where she receives the best prices for her products. In the future she hopes to grow more cocoa plants since she has fields that she hasn’t sown. This is her fourth loan with MFP and knows that she has to pay all of her quotas on time and is willing to do so. In her communal bank, Floriana is very friendly and responsible. With the loan she will hire day laborers to help her maintain her plants.

loans.use: hire day laborers to help her maintain her plants.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
Ignacio, de 33 años, es un hombre, trabajador, convive con Maribel, de 28 años, ambos tienen 4 hijos, todos ellos menores de edad, a los que crían y educan en su casa propia, ubicada en zona rural de “Santa Clara”.

Cuando apenas era un niño, sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, por ello, cuando estableció su propia familia, ya tenia experiencia en la agricultura. Y como padre responsable comenzó a cultivar papa, de todas las variedades. Es así que en cada cosecha realizada, comercializaba su producción en el mercado central de la capital del país, donde adquiere buenas ganancias y utilidades. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar y ver como la semilla crece poco a poco. Por ello para el futuro, está pensando ahorrar lo suficiente, para adquirir una camioneta con el que podrá trasladarse con mayor facilidad no solo a la capital, también a otras ciudades del país, ya que Ignacio quiere ser un comerciante mayorista de tubérculos. Ahora él está trabajando duro para su próximo sembrío de papa “pericholi”, que dentro de muy poco cosechará y está seguro podrá obtener buenas ganancias. 

Él pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos unidos”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde agradece los el poyo ofrecido, en los momentos difíciles que pasó.

Ignacio, sembrará después de su cosecha papa de la variedad “yungay”, por ello con el dinero solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico, que esparcirá en su terreno preparado.
texts.en:
Ignacio, 33, is a hard working man.  He lives with Maribel, 28.  They have four children who are all minors that they raise and educate in their own house located in the rural “Santa Clara” zone.

When he was a mere boy his parents taught him to work the land.  Because of this, when he formed his own family, he already had experience in farming.  As a responsible father he started to farm potatoes in all its varieties.  He would sell each of his successful harvests in the central market of the national capital where good profits are to be had.

What he likes about his work is planting and watching how the seed grows little by little.  He’s hoping in the future to save up enough to acquire a pick-up truck so that he can get around more easily not only in the capital but also in other cities in the country because Ignacio wants to be a potato wholesaler.  He is currently working hard on his next “Pericholi” variety potato crop which will be harvested very soon; he’s sure he will obtain good profits.

He is a member of the “Trabajemos Unidos” (Let’s Work Together) communal bank and this is the fifth loan with MFP where he is grateful for the support provided during the difficult times he had.

After the harvest Ignacio will plant “Yungay” variety potatoes so needs the loan to buy several sacks of organic manure to spread among his prepared fields.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 41 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Flora de 40 años y sus 04 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. El trabajo de Jorge es labrar la tierra, oficio que heredó de sus padres desde muy niño. Él viene trabajando 20 años en sus propias tierras donde cultiva plantas de cacao, café y hojas de coca de manera tecnificada. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y  jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo en sus diversos trabajos. Jorge sabe muy bien que el dinero que obtiene es por producir buena calidad de frutos. Sus productos cosechados los comercializa  en la ciudad de San Francisco y Quimbiri, lugares donde mejores precios percibe por la particularidad de sus granos y hojas de coca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es cargar los pesados sacos de sus productos desde la chacra hasta su comunidad. Más adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para aumentar su producción. Es el tercer préstamo de Jorge con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal. El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de abono y fertilizantes que le serán de gran utilidad para mejorar sus producciones.
texts.en: Jorge is 41 years old and is a very hardworking man.  He lives in his own home with his wife Flora, 40, and their 4 beloved children, for whom they wish to provide a better future.  Jorge works as a farmer, an occupation that he learned from his parents when he was very young.  He has been working for 20 years on his own land where he cultivates cocoa plants, coffee and coca leaves in a technical manner.  At harvest times he counts on help from his children and from day workers who provide him with support on various tasks.  Jorge knows very well that the money he gets is related to the good quality of his fruit.  He sells his harvested products in the markets in the cities of San Francisco and Quimbiri, places where he can get the best prices for the special quality of his coffee and cocoa beans and his coca leaves.  What he enjoys most about his work is harvesting the fruit, since that is when he feels that the months of arduous labor pay off in the quality of his fruit.  What he considers most difficult is to transport the heavy sacks of produce from the fields to his community.  In the future, he hopes to buy more land to increase his production.  This is Jorge's 3rd loan with MFP, and he feels capable of making all of his payments.  He is one of the most active members of his communal bank.  The loan that he requests is to buy manure and fertilizers that will be very useful in improving his production.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana, de 35 años, es una mujer trabajadora, está casada con Gregorio, de 35 años, ambos tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales 4 son menores y estudian, como una familia unidad ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Clara.

“Hace 20 años que me dedico, a sembrar; pero pareciera que fue ayer”, afirma. Su vida se centra en el cuidado de sus terrenos, en los que pasa la mayor parte del día, sus principales cultivos son de papa en sus diferentes variedades. Aquella sonrisa que le caracteriza, le ayuda, en la comercialización de sus productos en el mercado central de la ciudad de “Tarma”, sus clientes, le ofrecen buen precio por su producción; gracias a su buena disposición en el momento de la venta. Pero lo que le disgusta de la siembra es cuando, la rancha y gusanera se apodarán de los tubérculos, lo que a veces le ocasiona grandes pérdidas, pero eso no la desanida y para más adelante quiere comparar sus propios terrenos agrícolas y de esa manera minimizar costos de inversión. Su principal preocupación son los gastos de estudio de sus hijos; en donde invierte la mayor parte de sus ganancias. Pero gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal; puede emprender no solo sus proyectos también brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. 

Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos unidos”, y este es el noveno crédito con MFP; donde agradece por todo este tiempo que; gracias al apoyo de su asociación. Pudo sembrar.

Viviana; sembró hace muy poco papa de la variedad “yungay”. Por ello con el dinero del préstamo comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos y de esa manera obtener una buena cosecha en el mes de setiembre.
texts.en:
Viviana, 35, is a hard working woman married to Gregorio, 35.  They have five children four of whom are minors and studying.  They live together as a family in their own house located in Santa Clara.

“I’ve been a farmer for 20 years but it seems as if it was just yesterday,” she affirms.  Her life is centered on caring for her fields where she spends most of the day.  Her main crops are different varieties of potato.  That characteristic smile of hers helps her to sell her products in Tarma’s central market.  Her customers pay a good price for her products thanks to her pleasant disposition at the moment of the sale.

What she dislikes about farming is when the insect and worm plagues attack the tubers which occasionally causes large losses.  However, she doesn’t become discouraged and later on wants to buy her own fields so that she can lessen her investment costs.

Her main worry is her children’s educational expenses which is where she invests most of her profits.  But thanks to support from her communal bank she can undertake not only her businesses but also provide a better quality of life for her children.

She’s a member of the “Trabajemos Unidos” (Let’s Work Together) communal bank and this is the ninth loan with MFP where she is grateful for all this time which, thanks to support from her association, she was able to plant.

Viviana planted “Yungay” variety of potatoes recently so will use the loan to buy several sacks of organic manure to spread among her crops to obtain a good harvest in September.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es:
Gabino, de 53 años, es un hombre soltero. Vive junto a su mamá Julia, de 78 años y su hermano menor Joel, en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Huaylahuichan. 

Desde muy joven tuvo que afrontar los problemas familiares de su hogar, pues desde que falleció su padre se ocupó de los gastos económicos, ya que era el hermano mayor. Es así que desde los 20 años viene dedicándose a la agricultura. Sus principales sembríos constan de alverja, oyuco y papa. Todas las mañanas se dirige a la zona alta de su comunidad para poder cuidarlos y cultivarlos pues eso es lo que más le gusta de su labor. “Depende mucho el buen cuidado, la obtención de un buen producto”, asegura. Por ello en cada cosecha vende sus productos a un buen precio en el mercado mayorista de ciudad de Tarma, donde es conocido por su empeño y dedicación. Asimismo trabaja como albañil, en periodos de contrata; ganando un promedio de mil soles mensuales como mínimo. Pero su prioridad en estos momentos es la cosecha de ayuco y alverja que dentro de 15 días comenzará a extraer de la tierra. Asegurando obtener buenos resultados.  

Él pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde se siente realizado porque aprende cosas muevas. Y como presidente incentiva el ahorro entre los integrantes de su institución.

Gabino, después de su cosecha; comenzará a sembrar alverja en sus terrenos agrícolas aprovechando el clima de la zona. Por ello con el dinero solicitado comprará 2 bolsas de semilla que oscilan entre los S/. 540 nuevos soles cada uno.
texts.en:
Gabino, 53, is single living with his 78-year-old mother, Julia, and a younger brother, Joel, in his own house located in the Hamlet of Huaylahuichan.

He had to face family problems in his home from a very young age because ever since his father died he took over the expenses since he was the older brother.  This is how he’s been farming for the last 20 years.  His main crops are peas, oyuco (an Andean tuber) and potato.  Every morning he heads out to his community’s higher elevations to care for them because this is what he likes best about his work.  “Obtaining a good product depends much on good care,” he assures.  Because of this he sells each of his harvests for a good price at Tarma’s wholesale market where he is well known for his effort and dedication.  He also works as a bricklayer when there's hiring earning an average salary of at least 1000 soles monthly.  But his priority right now is the olluco and pea harvests that will begin in two weeks insuring good results.

He is a member of the “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) communal bank and this is the fifth loan with MFP where he feels fulfilled because he learns new things.  As group President he encourages his members to save.

After the harvest Gabino will start to plant peas in his fields taking advantage of the zone’s climate.  Because of this he will use the requested money to buy two sacks of seeds that cost around 540 new soles each.

loans.use: to buy seed.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 24 años, es una joven madre de familia muy alegre y luchadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Julio de 35 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Ella empezó como comerciante vendiendo ropa de manera ambulatoria por las calles de la ciudad de Palmapampa y Santa Rosa. Su pasión por las ventas y las buenas ganancias que le generaron este negocio fue ahorrándolo, es por ello que ella optó en salir a ofrecer su mercadería a las distintas ferias que se realizan en las zonas rurales, obteniendo buena solvencia económica. Durante este tiempo de trabajo su esposo es quien más la apoyaba, él era su mentor en los negocios, se encarga de buscar clientela. Maribel viene ofreciendo su mercadería desde hace 05 años y hoy es toda una conocedora en sus responsabilidades como comerciante. Considera que los periodos más difíciles son los meses de enero, febrero y marzo por que son épocas de lluvias intermitentes propias de la naturaleza existiendo imperfecciones en las carreteras así imposibilitando el recorrido de los vehículos quienes prestan sus servicios como medio transporte en el traslado de las mercaderías. Los planes que tiene en mente es alquilar un espacio en los centros comerciales y así exponer su mercadería  a la vista del público. Este es tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es un socia responsable. Con el crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de mercaderías por lo cual ella tiene que realizar el viaje a la ciudad de lima y comprar diversidad de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Maribel is 24 years old, and is a happy and determined young mother.  She lives in a rented house with her husband Julio, who is 35 years old, and their two children, who they want to give a better future.  She started selling clothing as a street vendor in the streets of the city of Palmapampa and Santa Rosa.  She began to offer her merchandise at different markets in rural areas because she has a passion for sales and she saved the good income that her business generated, so she had a good financial standing.  During this time, her husband was the one who gave her the most support.  He was her mentor in business and helped her find customers.  

Maribel started offering her merchandise five years ago, and today is she knowledgeable about her responsibilities as a businesswoman.  She thinks the most difficult periods are the months of January, February, and March, because they are times of intermittent rains, which causes problems with the roads, which makes it difficult for vehicles transporting goods to run.      

She is planning to rent a space in the commercial center and expose her merchandise to the public.  This is her third loan with MFP, and she knows that she has to make all of her payments on time if she would like to get another loan in the future, and she is ready to do so.  She is a responsible member of her community bank.  With this loan, she plans to purchase more merchandise.  She will make a trip to the city of Lima and purchase a variety of clothing.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Lucerito De Jose Galvez Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal Lucerito D. José Gálvez con mas D. 5 años participando con el programa prosperidad tiene como integrante fundadora a Isabel, mujer luchadora que a sus 57 años venD. Comida tradicional e infaltable  como Anticuchos y picarones desD. hace siete años según nos manifiesta.  Actualmente es soltera y durante su vida ha apoyado a sus 02 hijos que ahora son independientes. Isabel ha logrado además construir la primera planta D. su vivienda pero su sueño es seguir  mejorando el segundo nivel pues con ello obtendría  otros ingresos. Isabel desea  alquilar algunas habitaciones. El reciente préstamo será utilizado en la compra D. una nueva carreta  D. fierro para la venta D. sus anticuchos. La alcancía Comunal Lucerito D. José Gálvez tiene 10 integrantes y se llaman así por la que se juntaron residentes D. la avenida que tiene el mismo nombre. Los integrantes D. la ALCOM son responsables y puntuales en sus pagos mes a mes
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Lucerito D. José Gálvez” has participated in the Prosperity Program for more than five years. One of the founding members is Isabel, a determined woman who is 57 years old and sells grilled meats and fritters. She says that she has been in this business for seven years. Isabel is currently single and throughout her life she has supported two children who are now independent. She has managed to build the first floor of her home, but her dream is to continue making improvements and add a second floor so that she can earn additional income. Isabel wants to make rooms available for rent. This new loan will be used to buy a metal food cart for selling grilled meats.

The Lucerito D. José Gálvez Communal Bank has ten members and is named after the avenue on which they live. All of them are responsible and prompt with their monthly payments.

loans.use: to purchase a metal food cart for selling grilled meats.

loans.name: Rolin

texts.es: Rolin, de 21 años, es un hombre, que a pesar de los inconvenientes que tiene, lucha por salir adelante. Él, convive con Dora de 25 años, con la que tiene un hijo; Jean Piere de 1 año, al que cuidan con mucho amor en una casa arrendada, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Clara. A su corta, edad tiene en claro sus objetivos, el nacimiento de su hijo le impulsa a trabajar con ahínco. Sus aspiraciones, se centra en la construcción de su casa propia, por ello hace 3 años que se dedica a sembrar sus propios terrenos agrícolas, que heredó de parte de sus padres; pero es de corto tamaño, por ello trabaja también en asociación con otros terrenos agrícolas más amplios donde comparte responsabilidades en los gastos. Su principal  siembra, consta de distintas variedades de papa, los que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado central de su localidad. Pero como las fuerzas que tiene son muchas; cuenta que en sus tiempos libres trabaja en otros sembríos, con las ganancias que obtiene ahorra lo máximo. Con ello planea comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Ahora tiene poca responsabilidad por ello espera obtener todo el capital necesario para poder lograr sus objetivos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos unidos”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde asume la responsabilidad de trabajar en un banco comunal, donde sus miembros son personas responsables y cumplidas. Rolin, tiene sembrado papa de la variedad “yungay”, por ello con el dinero solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico que esparcirá entre sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rolin is a 21-year-old gentleman.  Despite the challenges he has faced, he is determined to move forward.  He lives with Dora, age 25, and their one-year-old son named Jean Piere who they care for with great love.  Rolin lives in a rented house located in the town of Santa Clara.  Even though he is young, Rolin is clear about his objectives since the birth of his son drives him to work hard.  His aspirations focus on building his own house.  For the past three years, he has been farming on his own land that he inherited from his parents, but it is a small piece of property.  For this reason, he also takes part in a larger farming cooperative and shares in the responsibilities of covering the expenses.  His main crop consists of different varieties of potatoes.  After each crop is harvested, he sells the produce at the central market in town.  Even though he puts great effort into producing potatoes, Rolin still has free time to work on other crops so that he can use the income to maximize his savings.  His plans include buying his own farmland.  Now he has few responsibilities while he waits to obtain the operating capital to accomplish his goals.

Rolin is a member of the Communal Bank “Trabajemos Unidos” (We Work Together) and this is his second loan with MFP.  He assumes responsibilities working with his Communal Bank.  The members of this group are responsible and accomplished individuals.  Rolin has planted potatoes of the “yungay” variety, so the money he is requesting will be used to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer to apply on his crops.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Suyapa Edith

texts.es:
la sra. Suyapa Edith R. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en la colonia La Fraternidad de la ciudad capital y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, productos de belleza y adornos para el hogar, sus ventas las realiza en los diferentes mercados, mayoreos y casinos ubicados en el bulevard morazan.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia al por mayor. con las ganancias que obtenga desea terminar la contruccion de la parte frontal de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Suyapa Edith R. is 40 years old and lives in the La Fraternidad neighborhood in the capital city. She sells new clothing, beauty products and decorations for the home. She does her sales in different markets, wholesalers and casinos located in the Morazan Boulevard.

Mrs. Suyapa’s loan will be used to buy merchandize wholesale, with the profits, she hopes to finish building the front of her home.

loans.use: buy pants, socks, blouses, jeans, creams, deodorants, lotions, body oil, shampoos, hair conditioner, home decorations and catalogue products.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa, de 53 años, es una mujer feliz, pues comparte su vida desde hace 30 años con Raymundo, con quien tiene 6 hijos. Pero solo vive con 3 de ellos, en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Santa Clara. El trabajo al que se dedica está trabajadora mujer es la agricultura, desde hace 25 años que comenzó con el cultivo de papa en sus 6 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas que posee, sembrando en grandes cantidades. Actualmente y gracias al apoyo de su esposo e hijos continúa en esta actividad. Además menciona que tiene 5 toros con los que ara la tierra y 13 vacas lecheras que le proporcionan cantidad de leche y con ella elabora quesos que son vendidos los días domingos en la feria que se realiza en la ciudad de Tarma, ganando un promedio de 200 soles. Ahora su motivación son sus 3 últimos hijos que están estudiando en la ciudad, por lo que tiene una casa arrendada, donde invierte la mayor parte de sus ganancias.  Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos unidos”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera hacer realidad todos sus objetivos. Teresa, comprará los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de queso que venderá.
texts.en:
Teresa, age 53, is a happy woman who has shared 30 years of her life with Raymundo. They have six children, but only three live with them in their own home in the rural section of Santa Clara. Teresa is a hardworking woman who has been farming for 25 years. She grows potatoes on six hectares of farmland and plants in large quantities. At the moment, she is grateful to have the support of her husband and children so that she can continue in this activity. In addition, Teresa mentions that she has five bulls to plow her land and thirteen dairy cows that provide milk that she uses for making cheeses. She sells the cheeses on Sundays at the fair in the city of Tarma where she earns an average of 200 PEN. Her three youngest children currently provide her with motivation since they are studying in the city, which is why she also has a rented house. A large part of her income is invested in those expenses.

Teresa is a member of the Communal Bank “Trabajemos Unidos” (We Work Together) and this is her first loan with MFP. She hopes to accomplish all of her goals. Teresa will buy the necessary supplies for making cheese to sell.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making cheese.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Casa Huerta Group

texts.es: Cristina se incorporo en la Alcancía Comunal “EMPRENDEDORAS DE CASA HUERTA” con el afán de ahorrar para el bienestar de su familia y motivada por una amistad es socia en esta oportunidad. Cristina nos cuenta que con la ayuda de su madre trabaja en un mercado de su comunidad vendiendo  frutas, juntamente con ella están alquilando un puesto de venta y están  pagando una renta mensualmente. A sus 33 años  tiene dos jóvenes adolescentes a los cuales ayuda  y les da respaldo uno de ellos ya labora. Con su esfuerzo ha logrado comprar algunos artefactos eléctricos para su hogar. Actualmente reside en la casa de sus padres y por herencia posee un lugar donde desea construir su propia vivienda además si tuviera un capital mas lo invertiría en comprar un puesto de venta propio. El préstamo obtenido será invertido en la compra de frutas como: chirimoyas y paltas. Los  nueve integrantes de la Alcancía Comunal EMPRENDEDORAS DE CASA HUERTA  posan contentos en la reciente reunión de desembolso realizada en nuestras instalaciones. Son personajes emprendedores como se hacen llamar. En la fotografia esta ausente Olga quien llego con retraso a nuestra reunion. Agradecen el apoyo en esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Cristina joined the Communal Bank “Emprendedoras de Casa Huerta” (Entrepreneurs of Casa Huerta) in hopes of saving for her family’s welfare. She was convinced by a friend who is a member to take advantage of this opportunity.

Cristina says that with the help of her mother, she was able to secure work at the community market selling fruit. She and her mother pay monthly rent for their vending post. At the age of 33, she has two teenage children who she supports and they help her in return. One of them already has a job. Through her efforts, Cristina has been able to purchase a few appliances for her home. She currently lives with her parents and there is space on their property on which she wants to build her own house. In addition, she wants mO. capital so that she can invest in the purchase of her own vending stall. The loan being provided to her will be invested in the purchase of fruits such as cherimoyas and avocados.

The nine members of the “Emprendedoras de Casa Huerta” Communal Bank were pleased with the disbursement that was issued to them at their most recent meeting. They are enterprising individuals, just as their name suggests. In the photograph, Olga is absent since she was late arriving to the meeting. They are grateful for the support that was granted on this occasion.

loans.use: to purchase cherimoyas and avocados.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo Díaz E., tiene la edad de 55 años, está casado  y vive con sus 4  hijos y su esposa que son sus mayores prioridades. El con el préstamo comprara los insumos necesarios para el buen mantenimiento de sus cafetales. El cuenta con la experiencia de varios años en el cultivo y también tiene la plantación ya cosechando, lo que pretende es mejorar sus cosechas y aumentar la próxima producción. Otra meta que él quiere lograr es generar las ganancias necesarias para el sustento de su hogar y poder darles el estudio a sus hijos y puedan llegar a ser profesionales en el futuro 
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Eduardo Díaz E. is 55 years old, married, and lives with his wife and four children who are his highest priorities. With this loan, he will buy the necessary supplies so that he can maintain his coffee plants. Eduardo has several years of experience cultivating, planting, and harvesting coffee. He plans to improve his crops and increase production for the next harvest. Another goal he wants to accomplish is to generate the necessary income to maintain his household and provide his children an education so that they can become professionals in the future.

This is the first loan Eduardo has received from FUDECOSUR. He has had no previous loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for maintaining his coffee plants.

loans.name: Deisy Asunción

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Rio De Oro.

En este lugar conocimos la señora Deisy, tiene 39 años de edad es madre soltera de tres hijos de 22, 15 y 9 años, los menores  estudian en colegio y escuela, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa.
 
Ella tiene un negocio en sociedad con su hijo, se dedican a la venta de arroz por saquillos, nos cuenta que ellos se desplazan hasta Charapoto  a una apiladora de arroz en la cual compran a menor precio este producto necesario en la alimentación de los ecuatorianos, luego lo llenan en costales de 10 libras para después salir a recorrer la ciudad vendiendo y entregando este producto por las calles, llevan vendiendo este producto por 4 años y les ha ido muy bien ya que ellos dejan a crédito y con esto han ganado mucha clientela.

Este crédito para comprar más arroz y costales(fundas de tela). Lleva cuatro años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta el compañerismo que hay en el grupo. 

Sus sueños son tener un carro para entregar sus productos y su casa terminada por completo.
texts.en:
Every fifteen days, the members of the Communal Bank “Rio de Oro” (River of Gold) meet in the neighborhood of La California in the city of Portoviejo. This capital city of Manabí has been known for many years for its tamarind trees.

It is in this place where one can meet Sra. Deisy. She is 39 years old and a single mother of three children (ages 22, 15, and 9). The two younger children attend high school and elementary school respectively. All of them live at home.

Deisy has a business that she manages with her son, selling rice in small sacks. She says that she travels to Charapoto to acquire her inventory from a rice dealer who is able to buy at a lower price. Rice is a basic food staple for many Ecuadorians. Deisy transfers the rice into ten-pound sacks and then travels through the streets of the city selling and delivering her product. She has been in business for four years and has done very well. Since she extends credit, Deisy has been able to gain many customers.

This loan will be used to buy more rice and cloth sacks. She has been with the Communal Bank for four years and enjoys the friendship that comes with being part of the group. Her dreams are to own a car for delivering her products and to finish the construction of her house.

loans.use: to purchase rice and cloth sacks.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin W. is a licensed residential and commercial electrician.  Kevin inspects buildings for safety and regulation compliance, installs wiring for new construction, and repairs power outages due to on-site malfunction, in addition to installing and repairing solar panels and generators.  He started his business, Spark Electric, AC heating & Gas, in 2006.

Kevin’s first job as a teenager was in the construction industry, though he later took jobs in other fields.  After overcoming personal struggles, Kevin returned to construction to open his own business.  For Kevin, small business ownership is more than a living.  He says that his success as a small business owner has given him confidence in what he can achieve professionally.  He is proud to be an integral part in his local economy, and feels connected to his community.  Kevin is also the proud father of three daughters.

Kevin wants his business to be more competitive in winning subcontracted commissions from commercial contractors.  Currently, Kevin estimates that 25% of his revenues come from work done on large commercial jobs, a number he hopes to improve upon this year.  Because subcontractors must wait to be compensated until the general contractor is paid, it is essential that they be able to front all of the costs and materials for a job.  This loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana helps Kevin meet upfront business costs, building his credibility with commercial contractors.  In addition, this loan helps Kevin build his business credit so that he can qualify for more financing in the future.

loans.use: to pay for materials and operating expenses and to build credit

loans.name: Silverio

texts.es:
Silverio se dedica a la venta de productos de alimentación lo que es granos básicos como: frijoles, arroz, maíz, con más de veinte años en las ventas, iniciando en la agricultura, pero luego viaja a la capital donde todo cambia, y decide viajar a comprar a los departamento encontrando a mejor precio los frijoles, lo que da a un mejor precio a sus clientes.
Pues en estos últimos meses ha estado caro, ya que con el invierno pasado se inundó mucho las siembras lo que provoco el alza al producir poco.
Su inversión comienza a dar un giro diferente al vender más, ya que es atreves de los préstamo de Afodenic,  incremento su negocio, así como la mejora de vivienda.
Con este préstamo podrá continuar un muro, que ha venido realizando para dar mejor seguridad a su vivienda, en donde comprara: cincuenta piedras, cemento, hierro. Para seguir elevando el muro,
texts.en:
Silverio has been selling basic food products such as beans, rice, and corn for more than 20 years. He started out as a farmer, but he later traveled to the capital and everything changed. Silverio decided to buy dry goods and began looking for the best price for beans so that he could offer them to his customers for a reasonable amount. In recent months, food has become expensive. The winter floods resulted in little production, which caused prices to go up.

By starting to invest, Silverio hopes to make a turn for the better and begin to sell more. With the loans he has received from AFODENIC, he was able to increase his business as well as make improvements to his home.

Silverio will use this loan to continue with the construction of a wall that will provide better security for his home. He plans to buy 50 stones, cement, and iron so that the work can continue.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a security wall.

loans.name: Jauna

texts.es:
Juana A. Fernández, tiene la edad de 37 años, está casado  y vive con su esposo y 2 hijos que son sus prioridades. Ella lo que pretende es comprar una moto para su trasporte al trabajo. Ella tiene un trabajo largo de donde vive y su trasporte es muy difícil por lo cual opto con la compra del vehículo para ser más puntual con la hora de llegada y ser más eficiente. Ella lo0 que quiere es seguir adelante con su trabajo y seguir generando ganancias para el sustento diario.  
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juana A. Fernández is 37 years old, married and lives with her husband and 2 children who are her priorities. She would like to buy a motorcycle to travel to work, Juana’s job is far from where she lives and transportation is difficult which is why she decided it would be best to buy a vehicle to be more punctual and efficient. Juana wants to keep going with her job and to keep earning her wages for her daily expenses.

This is Juana’s first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has not had any other loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her the loan with ease and low interest rates.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es:
Fanny M. vive en el barrio el Prado D. Soledad allí tiene un negocio llamado “Variedades Katherine” ubicado en su vivienda  donD. venD. mercancías, como adornos para la cabeza, útiles D. papelería dulces y  calzado formal e informal.  Este negocio surgió cuando  buscando  mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y reconociendo su vocación D. servicio decidió emprenderlo con el sueño D.  brindarle bienestar a su pequeño hijo D. 3 años D. edad, con el que sueña verlo crecer saludable y muy exitoso.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el  comprará mercancía como  calzado, accesorios femeninos, preparándose para  venderle a sus clientes en el día D. las madres, que es D. gran repunte comercial. Su sueño es tener una casa propia pues vive en arrendamiento y este es quizás su mayor desafío, por eso cada día trabaja con disciplina para poder lograrlo.
texts.en:
Fanny M. lives in the Prado D. Soledad neighborhood and she has a business called “Variedades Katherine” located in her home. She sells merchandize like hair accessories, stationary items, candy and formal and informal shoes. This business began when she decided to improve her quality of life and found her vocation in the service sector. Fanny decided to start her business with the hope of giving her 3 year old son the best and dreams of seeing him grow healthy and successful.

This is Fanny’s first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and with the money she will buy merchandize like shoes and accessories for women. She is ready to sell her items to her customers on Mother’s Day since it is a great time for sales. Fanny’s dream is to have her own home, since she lives in a rented house and this is perhaps her greatest challenge, that is why she works each day with discipline to be able to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: buy merchandize like shoes and accessories for women.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Don Rafael C. A. de 77 años es propietario de un pequeño negocio que inició en el año 1991, cuando dejó de ser empleado en una empresa para dar curso a su espíritu emprendedor y dedicarse a trabajar independiente en la  venta  de cervezas, gaseosas, jugos, confitería y galletería, en el barrio La Magdalena donde vive con su esposa y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 40  a 51 años. 
Don Rafael se esmera por incrementar sus ingresos vendiendo cada día al detalle y necesita hacerlo en mayor volumen, aprovechando la  ubicación geográfica de su vivienda,que se encuentra  alrededor de escenarios deportivos, para lo cual comprará  10 cajas de cervezas y 10 de otros refrescos entre gaseosas y poni Malta,   razón por la  cual  recurre a su credikiva que es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y que proyecta ser una inversiòn éxitosa por su experiencia y porque potencializan la venta.  Su sueño es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio para brindarle  confort a sus clientes y aumentar la seguridad y protección de sus activos en el negocio, pues en la actualidad debe dormir el mismo en su Kiosco para cuidarlo. Mientras esto ocurre continua trabajando con una rentabilidad no menor de un 20% y una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 8 días, porque también ofrece crédito a sus mejores clientes.
texts.en:
Don Rafael C. A. is 77 years old and owns a small business that he started in 1991 when he left his work in a company to give way to his enterprising spirit and work independently. He sell beers, sodas, juices, candy and cookies in the La Magdalena neighborhood where he lives with his wife. Don Rafael has 3 children who are between the ages of 40 and 51 years old.

Don Rafael works hard to increase his earnings by selling each day and needs to do it in large volumes by taking advantage of the geographical location of his home that is near some sporting centers. He wants to buy 10 boxes of beer and 10 boxes of other refreshments among them sodas and Poni Malta (a sweet malt gaseous drink).This would be Don Rafael’s first loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and predicts that it will be a successful investment because of his experience and he is capable of doing the sales. Don Rafael’s biggest dream is to improve the infrastructure of his business to provide comfort to his customers and improve the safety and protection his assets since he has to sleep in his kiosk to protect it. As long as this happens he will continue to work and get profits, he earns no less than 20% and collects fees every 8 days because he also offers credit to his best customers.

loans.use: buy 10 boxes of beer, and 10 boxes of other types of refreshments including sodas.

loans.name: Mayra Concepcion

texts.es: Mayra Concepción tiene 36 años, su actividad es brindar los servicios de sala de belleza. Tiene más de 8 años en este negocio, pues siempre le ha gustado ser una persona muy emprendedora y se siente contenta al tener un medio de ingreso para su hogar. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo siempre le enseña a saberse ganar la vida de la manera más humilde. Ella trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche ya que tiene ciertos clientes que llegan tarde. Este crédito es para la compra de peines, cepillo, aceites, tratamientos, planchas, secadoras, shampoo entre otros productos. ella desea comprar su propia casa ya que alquila.
texts.en: Mayra Concepción is 36 years old; she works in a beauty parlor. She has worked on her business for over 8 years since she has always enjoyed being a very enterprising person and feels very happy having a mode of income for her home. She has 2 underage children under her care and they have taught her to earn a living in a humble way. Mayra works from 7 in the morning until 8 in the evening since she has customers that arrive late. This loan is to buy combs, brushes, oils, treatments, flat irons, dryers, shampoos and other products. Mayra hopes to buy her own home since she rents.

loans.use: buy combs, brushes, oils, treatments, flat irons, dryers, shampoos and other products.

loans.name: Carlos Julio

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Rio De Oro.

En este lugar conocimos a Carlos Julio, tiene 23 años de edad, está soltero, el es de la provincia del Guayas pero por trabajo  hace algunos años se vino a Portoviejo, en la actualidad  vive en la casa de su hermana, allí viven cinco personas con él.

El se  dedica  a trabajar en albañilería y cada dia ha ido mejorando tanto sus conocimientos en esta materia como en las herramientas para realizar un mejor trabajo en menos tiempo, dice que los Ing. Civiles que lo conocen le dan sus obras para que él se las construya ya que además de saber lo que hace es muy responsable, trabaja de lunes a viernes de 8h00 hasta las 18h00 y los sabados hasta las 12h00, con el trabajan cuatro personas a quienes les paga un sueldo.

Este crédito para comprar una concretara para realizar un mejor trabajo. Este es el cuarto  ciclo en el Banco Comunal y está muy agradecido porque gracias a los crédito ha podido ir mejorando su forma de trabajar.
 
Su sueño es tener su propia empresa de construcción.
texts.en:
The “Río de Oro” (River of Gold) communal bank meets every two weeks in the La California neighborhood of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

We met Carlos Julio, 23, here.  He’s single and is from the Guayas Province but came to Portoviejo several years ago for work.  He currently lives in his sister’s house and five other people live there with him.

He works as a bricklayer and every day both his skills and his work tools have been improving in order to do better work in less time.  He says that the civil engineers that know him give him their jobs to do because, besides being knowledgeable, he’s very responsible.  He works from Monday through Friday from 8am until 6pm and on Saturdays until noon.  He has four employees that work with him and that he pays a salary to.

This loan is to buy a cement mixer to do a better job.  This is the fourth cycle in the communal bank and he is very grateful because thanks to the loans he’s been able to improve his way of working.  His dream is to have his own construction firm.

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer.

loans.name: Mercedes Clementina

texts.es: Mercedes Clementina se dedica a la venta de tortillas tiene más de 23 años en su negocio. Es una persona dedicada, abnegada y que le gusta el trabajo, Mercedes tiene una gran fama por este negocio, pues siempre ofrece buena calidad en sus productos y en sus servicios. La mayoría de sus clientes saben que Mercedita como le dicen es bien cariñosa y servicial. Es así que decide realizar este crédito para la compra de leña, maíz, cal, bolsas, servilletas entre otros.
texts.en: Mercedes Clementina has been in the tortilla sales business for over 23 years.  She is a dedicated, selfless person who likes work.  She is quite famous because of the business because she always offers good quality in her products and services.  Most of her customers know that Mercedita, as they call her, is quite affectionate and accommodating.  She has decided to request a loan to buy firewood, corn, lime powder, bags and napkins, among others.

loans.use: to buy firewood, corn, lime powder, bags and napkins, among others.

loans.name: Paz Group

texts.es: Esta ubicado en el estado de México. Este grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. La tesorera se llama Maria de la Paz R. S.. Tiene 46 años, estudio hasta el tercer año de primaria, es divorciada y tiene en total 4 hijos, 2 mujeres y 2 varones, Ella se dedica a la venta de Abarrotes, negocio que inicio hace 2 años. Solicita este prestamo para surtir su negocio. Al momento de  solicitar este prestamo se siente sontenta porque cuenta con mas capital para diversificar los productos que ofrece en su tienda y con esto poder retener y satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. Quiere este prestamo para hacer crecer su negocio, tener un local mas grande y mejor ubicado para poder verder mas y con esto apoyar a su familia con los gastos economicos y seguir brindandoles educación a sus hijos para tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
It’s located in the state of México.  The group has 9 members.  The Treasurer’s name is María de la Paz R. Sánchez.  She is 46 years old and studied up to third grade.  She’s divorced and has a total of four children, two girls and two boys.  She is a Grocer, a business she started two years ago.

She is asking for this loan to stock her store.  At the time of requesting the loan she is happy because she has more capital to diversify stock in her store and this will make it possible for her to retain her customers and meet their needs.  She wants the loan to help her business grow, to have a larger, better situated locale in order to sell more and provide for her family’s expenses and continue providing education for her children so that they’ll have a better future.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Margaritas De Tlatelulco Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “Margaritas de Tlatelulco” este grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes, esta ubicado en Toluca Estado de México. Una de sus integrantes del grupo es   la señora Mónica A. Ríos  de 41 años de edad, ella estudio  la primaria, es comerciante y tiene 7 hijos ella vende desde hace 16 años pan y vaR. productos de temporada. Comenta que debido a que tuvo vaR. hijos se vio en la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo quien también es comerciante y vende tabique. La señora Mónica se dedica principalmente a la venta de pan ya que de ahí obtiene más ganancias, ella solicita el préstamo para invertir en pan que tiene mucha demanda, sus clientes comentan que su pan es muy rico y siempre tiene variedad. Ella quiere incrementar sus ganancias para salir adelante y poder ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos que aun dependen de ella. Observaciones las señoras que no se ven bien se llaman Lilian R. y Yeni C.
texts.en:
This group is called “Margaritas de Tlatelulco” (Tlatelulco Daisies).  It has 11 members and is located in Toluca, state of México. 

One of the group members is Mrs. Mónica A. Ríos, 41.  She finished elementary school, is a merchant and has 7 children.  For the last 16 years she’s sold bread and seasonal products.  She comments that because she had several children she had to help her husband, who is also a merchant selling bricks.

Mónica primarily sells bread because that’s where her profits are best.  She is asking for a loan to buy bread because demand is high; her customers comment that her bread is very delicious and she always has good variety.  She wants to increase her profits to get ahead and provide a better quality of life for her children that still depend on her.

Observations: the women who aren’t clearly visible are Lilian R. and Yeni C..

loans.use: to buy bread.

loans.name: Aydalina

texts.es:
Aydalina pequeña comerciante dedicada al trabajo, para el bienestar común de la familia. Su negocio es la venta de nacatamales, palmea tortilla, ahora también invirtió en ropa y cosmético, logrando obtener mejores  ingresos. 
Con el capital que trabaja ha sido parte de sus ahorros y préstamo con Afodenic, donde, lleva cuatro ciclos de los cuales ha logrado mejores inversión como mejores ventas. Lo que quiere con este nuevo financiamiento es comprar: ropa, variada para dama y caballeros, cosmético y perfume ya que logro la captación de clientes, mediantes estos productos.asi como la venta de tortilla.Lo que esta contenta por poder apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Aydalina is a small businesswoman who dedicates herself to her work so that she can provide for the welfare of her family. Her business involves selling Nicaraguan tamales and handmade tortillas. Now she will also invest in clothing and cosmetics so that she can earn more income.

Aydalina has built up working capital using her savings and the loans from AFODENIC. She has participated in four loan cycles and improved her investment through better sales. With this new loan she will buy various clothes for women and men, cosmetics, and perfumes so that she can attract customers. By offering these products and selling tortillas, Aydalina is pleased that she is able to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, perfumes, and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De Los Ángeles se dedica a la venta de refrescos. Tiene más de 12 años con este negocio, le ha ido muy bien con los pocos ingresos que ha obtenido por medio de la actividad. Fue con su Madre que ella aprendió este tipo de negocio y fue con el paso del tiempo que Maria logro adminístralo para proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos de cada día. Este financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, pan, galletas, refrescos, hielo, bolsitas, enchiladas y tajadas. Sueña con sacar adelante a sus dos hijos que están menores de edad a su cargo.
texts.en:
María De Los Ángeles sells refreshments.  She’s been in this business for over 12 years. She has done well with the little income she earns through this activity.  She learned this type of business from her mother and as time went by María managed to run it to provide her family with daily income.

This loan is to buy snacks, bread, cookies, soft drinks, ice, bags, enchiladas and fried banana chips.  She dreams with successfully raising her two minor children who are in her care.

loans.use: to buy snacks, bread, cookies, soft drinks, ice, bags, enchiladas and fried banana chips.

loans.name: Bobby R.

texts.en:
Bobby R. W.’s restaurant “Just Passing Thru?” is a southern-style restaurant offering customers traditional home cooking and barbecue.  They make delicacies like oxtail (cow’s tail), which they slice into small pieces and prepare with special seasonings.  Though “Just Passing Thru” has been in business nearly ten years, until now it has only served barbecue.  Wanting to expand the menu to include more of the traditional food he grew up with, Bobby temporarily closed his restaurant to prepare for the new product lines.  “Just Passing Thru?” recently celebrated its reopening with a “dry run” that tested the new concept.  “’Dry run’ means that we checked to see how the food looked going out the door.  We were known for our barbecue, but they were not used to the home cooking,” says Bobby.  

With great wit and colorful imagery, Bobby describes his restaurant’s early success since reopening.  After recently taking food to the Humble Police Department, Bobby says that one of the sergeants called to tell him that the food was so good “he would be ashamed to take the bone home to his dog.”  With “Just Passing Thru?” located next to a railroad track, the train conductor calls in his order in advance so that he can pick up his food as he passes through town.  Bobby jokes that “the food is so good, it literally stops trains.”

Bobby knows what it means to put in a full day’s work.  In addition to running his restaurant, which he calls his “extra job,” Bobby is in his 34th year of service as a state trooper.  As if that isn’t enough, he is also a Christian pastor and a family man, with five grown children whom he raised with his wife of 30 years.  Originally from Louisiana, Bobby settled in Texas after graduating from Paul Quinn College in Waco.  “I am from Louisiana… I’m a country boy.  I went to college because no one I knew had graduated from college.”  

Bobby pastors a church that is also on the same property as “Just Passing Thru?”  “Our food is not as good as the spiritual food,” he quips, “but it is good.  We would put our food up against any restaurant.”  Needless to say, between working full-time as a highway patrolman, managing his restaurant, and pastoring his church, Bobby stays busy.  “The Lord is busy right about now in my life... I’m always packing, I’m always loaded.  I’m either carrying a SIG 357 or the 66 books of the Bible.”

With this loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana, Bobby is buying a new refrigerator for the restaurant, which is important because his current fridge is old and fluctuates in temperature.  The remainder of the loan is being set aside to help with general expenses as Bobby navigates the business through its reopening.  Like many of ACCION Texas-Louisiana’s customers, this loan serves the additional purpose of helping Bobby build his business’ credit so that he can qualify for traditional financing in the future.

Currently, “Just Passing Thru?” is open weekdays for lunch and on the weekends.  Being limited by his schedule as a state trooper, Bobby is growing the business slowly to make sure that any progress made is sustainable.  He prioritizes serving lunch because, “There are a lot of hard-working people that need a good meal during the day.”  

One customer and fan of the restaurant surprised Bobby by creating a “Just Passing Thru?” website.  Though not all of the information on the website is correct, Bobby is appreciative of the gesture and sees the website as something to build from in the future.

Check out the webpage that was made for Bobby here: http://www.justpassingthrubbq.com/379489.html

loans.use: to pay for a new refrigerator and build credit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit, bags, straws, sugar, ice and buckets, among others.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Julia es una fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de frescos, leña, frijoles, tortillas etc. Ella inicio con la venta de tortilla y luego con las ganancias y los préstamos fue invirtiendo en otros productos.
Ella con el crédito comprara leña, frijoles, sal, ajo, maíz, frutas etc.
texts.en: Mrs. Ana Julia is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman who sells frozen fruit treats, firewood, beans, tortillas, etc.  She started out selling tortillas and then used profits and loans to gradually invest in other products.  She will use the loan to buy firewood, beans, salt, garlic, corn, fruit, etc.

loans.use: to buy firewood, beans, salt, garlic, corn, fruit, etc.

loans.name: La Finca Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Finca está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras originarias de Masaya. La coordinadora del grupo es Ileana C. quien desde hace cinco años se dedica al comercio de refresco, gaseosa y helados en los cuales invertirá el crédito.
Las otras integrantes son Concepción B. quien vende carne desde hace 30 años y Heydi de los Ángeles G. quien vende ropa interior
texts.en:
The “La Finca” group has three hard working, dedicated, enterprising members from Masaya.  The group Coordinator is Ileana C. who has sold refreshments, soft drinks and ice cream for the last five years and will invest the loan in them.

The other group members are Concepción B. who has sold meat for 30 years and Heydi de los Ángeles Gonzáles who sells underwear.

loans.use: to buy fruit, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Vilma Teresa

texts.es: Vilma Teresa se dedica a la elaboración y venta de refrescos. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, ya que fue por la necesidad de obtener un trabajo que le generara ingresos diariamente para su hogar. Tiene 4 hijos pero solamente 1 está a su cargo, Vilma le enseña a ser personas muy luchadoras y trabajadoras. Este financiamiento es para la compra de jugos, frutas, bolsas, azúcar, hielo y gaseosas. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer que le gusta trabajar y que disfruta de hablar con sus clientes y de proporcionarles lo que les solicitan.
texts.en:
Vilma Teresa makes and sells refreshments.  She’s had this business for over 4 years.  It arose from the need to have work that would produce daily family income.  She has four children but only one still in her care.  Vilma teaches them to be hard working, tenacious people.

This loan is to buy juices, fruit, bags, sugar, ice and soft drinks.  She has always been noted for being a woman who likes to work and enjoys chatting with her customers and providing them with what they ask for.

loans.use: to buy juices, fruit, bags, sugar, ice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Las Palmitas De Mancuernas Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Las Palmitas de Mancuernas, llamado así porque el lugar en donde se reúnen las integrantes hay muchas palmas que son decoración de la casa de una de las integrantes y mancuernas porque así se llama la población donde viven, un lugar pequeño donde la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la ganadería. Este grupo esta integrado por 10 personas y la mayoría lleva más de 10 ciclos en la Fundacion y por el buen servicio que se les proporciona sigue solicitando créditos.
La señora Juana S. es una de las integrantes de este grupo, esta casada con el señor Martín Hernández quien se dedica a la ganadería, tiene 6 hijos que estudian en diferentes niveles escolares. Juana se dedica  a la venta de carnes como son: chorizo y carne enchilada, desde hace muchos años inicio con este negocio debido a la necesidad que tenia; ya que todos sus hijos estudiarían algunos en primaria y otros secundaria y el dinero que ganaba su esposo no le iba alcanzar, es por ello que surgió la idea de vender estos productos y como ella sabia elaborarlos porque su mamá le enseño cuando era adolescente, inicio elaborando poco, y salía a venderlos de casa en casa ahí en su población, pero con el paso del tiempo se fue haciendo de varios clientes y ellos mismos la recomendaban  con otras personas y se fue haciendo de varios clientes, actualmente sale a venderlos a otras poblaciones porque existe mucha competencia aunque ya tiene sus clientes en algunas casi no le compran y por ello que tiene que ir a ofrecer sus productos en localidades vecinas. 
Ella solicitó el préstamo para comprar insumos para la elaboración de su producto ya que lleva varios ingredientes y compra en cantidades grandes de cada uno de ellos como son: chile de árbol, chile guajillo, chile pulla, ajo, cebolla, clavo y pimienta y la carne de cerdo y cada, ella siempre invierte su crédito y le ha dado buenos resultados ya que sus ganancias han sido buenas y con ello ah podido mantener a sus hijos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos.
Su mayor prioridad para ella es su familia y tiene un gran apoyo por parte de ellos ya que sus hijos la ayudan a vender sus productos en sus ratos libres, su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos estudien y lleguen a tener una profesión es por ello que trabaja todos los días para darles lo indispensable, al igual que les enseñan el oficio de trabajar y ganarse su propio dinero para que el día de mañana sean hombres de provecho y no esperen a que todo les caiga del cielo.
Las personas que integran este grupo son personas trabajadoras que se dedican a diferentes negocios: 
Paula O.. Elaboración de tamales
Gloria M.. Elaboración de antojitos
Julia, Juana, Dolores, Cirenia y Jisel. Elaboración de chorizo y carne enchilada.
Yamilet Hernández. Venta de cosméticos.
Sandra V.. Venta de cerdos
Rodolfo T.. Servicio de taxi (compra y venta de aceites y refacciones)
texts.en:
The group “Las Palmitas de Mancuernas” is so named because the home of one of its members, where the meetings are conducted, has many palm trees that adorn the property. Mancuernas is the name of the small town in which they live. Most of its residents engage in livestock breeding. This group consists of ten members, most of whom have participated in ten loan cycles with Fundación Realidad as a result of the good service they have received. For this reason, they continue to seek credit.

Sra. Juana S. is one of the members of this group. She is married to Sr. Martín Hernández, who is a rancher. They have six children who are in different stages of their education. Juana sells meat products such as chorizo and beef enchiladas. She started her business several years ago out of necessity. All of her children are in school, some in elementary school and others in high school. The money her husband earned was not enough, so she came up with the idea of selling these products since she learned how to make them from her mother when she was a teenager. Juana started out small, going into town and selling her goods house to house. Over time, she acquired several customers and they recommended her to other people, which expanded her clientele. She currently sells in other towns because there is plenty of competition. Juana has some customers who almost make purchases but end up not buying, so she must go to neighboring towns to offer her products.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making her products since they require various ingredients. Juana must buy them in large quantities. They include chile de árbol, guajillo chiles, puya chiles, garlic, onions, cloves, pepper, and pork.
