She invests her loans and has always achieved successful results because her earnings have been good. This allows her to support her children and help her husband with the expenses.

Juana’s top priority is her family since they have been a great support to her. Her children help her with selling products in their spare time. Her greatest wish is for her children to study so that they can pursue a profession. For this reason, she works every day to provide them with necessities as well as teach them the value of working and earning money. Juana hopes that her children will be outstanding individuals in the future and not expect everything to fall from the sky.

The members of this group are hardworking individuals who engage in different businesses: • Paula O. produces tamales. • Gloria M. makes snacks. • Julia, Juana, Dolores, Cirenia, and Jisel produce chorizo and beef enchiladas. • Yamilet Hernández sells cosmetics. • Sandra V. sells pigs. • Rodolfo T. buys and sells oil and spare parts for taxis.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making chorizo and beef enchiladas.

loans.name: Enlazando Group

texts.es:
El grupo Enlazando está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras originarios de Nindiri, Masaya. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora María de la Concepción S. quien desde joven se dedica a la agricultura de maíz, frijoles y yuca. Ella con el crédito comprara abono para preparar la tierra para la siembra.
Las otras integrantes son Ana María A. Matus quien tiene un nintendo y una pulpería en los cuales invertirá el crédito y Alejandra Guzmán S. desde hace 4 años tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The “Enlazando” (Linking Together) group has three hard working, dedicated, enterprising women from Nindiri, Masaya.  The group Coordinator is Mrs. María de la Concepción S. who has been a corn, bean and manioc farmer since she was young.  She will use the loan to buy manure to prepare the soil for planting.

The other group members are Ana María A. Matus who has a Nintendo and a grocery store where she will invest the loan and Alejandra Guzmán S. who has had a grocery store for the last 4 years.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: El Renacer De Chacrasana Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “El Renacer de Chacra sana” se caracteriza por estar integrado por ocho mujeres luchadoras y unidas con la finalidad de sacar a sus familias adelante. Miriam es una de ellas a sus 35 años, es conviviente y de ellos dependen 04 menores de edad. Miriam tiene estudios técnicos de alta costura, posee una maquina de costura recta con la que ofrece servicios de compostura y confección de prendas de vestir en su comunidad desde hace 10 años. Ella nos manifiesta que sus amigas la invitaron a participar viendo que es luchadoras como ellas, pues no solo se dedica a la costura además trabaja en la lavandería de un  club privado aledaño a su residencia. Miriam trabaja así para poder terminar de construir su vivienda, ella actualmente apoya en su hogar con los gastos básicos de servicios y en la educación de sus hijos. Su sueño es tener un taller de costura con mayor numero de maquinas, el crédito recibido será invertido en la compra de telas y ayudarse en el pago de la academia de uno de sus hijos. Con la ayuda de su conyugue que trabaja como adiestrador de canes están luchando día a día para que sus hijos sean profesionales. La ALCOM “El renacer de Chacrasana” con sus ocho integrantes posan en la fotografía luego de la reunión de desembolso realizado en su comunidad.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “El Renacer de Chacrasana” is known for its eight female members who are determined and united women. They want to succeed on behalf of their families.

Miriam is one of the members. She is 35 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has four dependent children. Miriam received a technical education in fashion design. She has an upright sewing machine that she uses for mending and creating clothes. Miriam has been offering her services to her community for the past ten years. She says that she was invited by her friends to participate in the Communal Bank because she is just as determined as them. In addition to working alone as a seamstress, Miriam also has a job at a private club near her home where she is in charge of laundry. She works in order to finish the construction of her home.

Miriam currently supports her household by paying expenses such as basic services and her children’s education. Her dream is to have a sewing workshop with more machines. The loan she is receiving will be invested in the purchase of fabrics and the tuition payment for one of her children. With the help of her husband who works as a dog trainer, Miriam presses forward day after day so that her children can become professionals.

The photo of the eight members that make up the Communal Bank “El Renacer de Chacrasana” was taken after the meeting in which they received their disbursements.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and pay for a child's tuition.

loans.name: En El Nombre De Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo en el nombre de Dios está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellas son Miriam, Ana y  Bismar. La coordinadora del grupo es Miriam quien tiene una fritanga desde hace 7 años en la que invertirá el crédito para realizar los típicos platos de este restaurante popular carne  asada, enchiladas, tacos… etc.
Ana se dedica al comercio de cosméticos e invertirá en perfumes y cremas y Bismar vende ropa usada la cual comercializa es su casa y de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
The “En el Nombre de Dios” (In the Name of God) group is made up of three hard working, dedicated, enterprising people: Miriam, Ana and Bismar.  The group Coordinator is Miriam who’s had a fast food business for the last 7 years.  She will use the loan to produce the typical dishes of her restaurant: grilled meat, enchiladas, tacos, etc.

Ana is a cosmetics merchant; she will invest in perfumes and creams and Bismar sells used clothes both at home and as a street vendor.

loans.use: to buy oil, chicken, rice, meat, etc.

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es: Juana Paula se dedica a la venta de refrescos. Tiene más de 9 años en este negocio. Inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso diariamente, ella tiene 2 hijos pero solamente 1 está a su cargo pues se tiene que proporcionarle alimento, vestimenta y estudio. Juana es una mujer muy emprendedora por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mantener a su familia. El financiamiento es para la compra de azúcar, frutas, bolsas entre otros.
texts.en: Juana Paula sells juice drinks. She has had this business for more than 9 years. She began this means of earning a living because of the need to have a daily income. She has two children, but she is responsible for only one, and she has to provide him with food, clothing, and an education. Juana is a very enterprising woman who is always looking for a way to support her family. The loan will be used for the purchase of sugar, fruits, and bags, among other items.

loans.use: to buy sugar, fruit and bags.

loans.name: María Alexandra

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Rio De Oro.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 19 años de edad, está casada y está embarazada de su primer hijo. Su esposo estudia y trabaja en la empresa eléctrica, ella estudia el primer semestre de enfermería en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí.

Ella además de estudiar también se dedica al comercio, vende  productos Saysons Y Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja los fines de semana durante casi todo el dia aunque también vende en la universidad  donde estudia, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Recién el mes pasado empezó con esta actividad y le va muy bien. También realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo que tiene un taller de soldadura en el cual realiza muchas obras con el hierro, elabora puertas, ventanas, estructuras para techos, entre otras cosas.
 
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y materia prima como suelda, hierro, latón, etc. para el negocio del esposo. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Sus sueños son obtener su titulo y conseguir un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
The “Río de Oro” (River of Gold) communal bank meets every two weeks in the La California neighborhood of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, a city known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

We met María, 19, here.  She is married and expecting her first child.  Her husband is a student and employed by the electric company.  She is studying first semester of Nursing at the Manabí Technical University.

Besides studying she’s also a merchant.  She sells Saisons and L'Bel brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works weekends almost the entire day but she also sells at the university where she attends classes.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.   She just started this activity last month and is doing very well.  She is also taking out the loan for her husband’s business.   He has a welding shop where he does all kinds of work with iron.  He makes doors, windows and roofing structures, among others.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and raw materials like solder, iron, brass, etc. for her husband’s business.  This is the second cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make.  Her dreams are to graduate and get a good job.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cosmetics, creams, solder, iron, brass, etc.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza De Corcona Group

texts.es: Félix es el presidente de la Alcancía Comunal” La nueva esperanza de Corcona” es casado y tiene cuatro hijos que se encuentran estudiando, uno en la universidad, dos en academia preparatoria y uno  aun en la escuela. Félix es un buen hombre que junto a su esposa trabajan en el restaurante que se llama RESTAURANTE LIZ., en donde brindan desayuno, almuerzo y cena esta ubicado en plena carretera central por lo que nos manifiesta tiene comensales fijos y viajeros que pasan por su negocio. Félix nos cuenta que empezó hace 15 años vendiendo en una carretilla en forma ambulatoria  y luego de mucho esfuerzo se estableció. Con el préstamo invertirá en menaje y compras de insumos para su restaurante. El desea ampliar su restaurante para apoyar en la educación de sus hijos. Los socios de “La nueva esperanza de Corcona están agradecidos por apoyo incondicional.
texts.en:
Félix is the president of the community bank "La nueva esperanza de Corcona" [The new hope of Corcona].  He is married and has four children who are in school.  One is in college, two are in high school, and one is in lower school.  

Félix is a good man who works with his wife at their restaurant, called Restaurant Liz.  They serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  It is located on the main road, so they serve regular customers and travelers who pass by their business.  Félix started the business 15 years ago selling from a cart as a street vendor, and with a lot of effort, established his restaurant.  

With this loan, he will invest in kitchen items and food supplies for his restaurant.  He wants to expand the restaurant to be able to support his children's education.  

The members of "The new hope of Corcona" are thankful for the wholehearted support.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to expand his restaurant.

loans.name: Juna

texts.es:
La señora Juna L. C. es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora originaria de Pacayita. Ella tiene en el cruce de Ticuantepe una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio hace 10 años con chiverias. 
L. con el crédito comprará granos básicos (arroz, aciete, azúcar, frijoles), gaseosa y pan. La meta principal de ella es que sus cinco hijos tengan un buen futuro que se preparen y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Señora Juna L. C. is a hard-working and enterprising woman who is originally from Pacayita. She has a little grocery store at the Ticuantepe crossroads. She opened it 10 years ago selling snack items.
 
With the loan, she will buy basic staple items (rice, oil, sugar, beans), soft drinks, and bread. Her main goals are that her five children have a good future, that they prepare themselves,  and that her business grows.

loans.use: to buy basic food items (rice, oil, sugar, beans), soft drinks, and bread for her store

loans.name: Gina Aracely

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Rio De Oro.

En este lugar conocimos a  la señora Gina, ella es la secretaria del Banco. Tiene 46 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 16 y 13 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio. Su marido trabaja en una empresa.

Es una muy buena ama de casa que además tiene un local en el cual vende artículos de bazar y  productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00 y sus productos los vende en su local ya que sus clientes siempre llegan allí, deja a crédito y sale a cobrar los días domingos. Lleva con su negocio 12 años y le gusta porque se entretiene en su trabajo.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, bisutería y artículos de bazar. Este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy responsables.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para poder trasladarse más cómodamente.
texts.en:
The “Río de Oro” (River of Gold) communal bank meets every two weeks in the La California neighborhood of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, a city known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

We met Gina, 46, here.  She is the bank’s Secretary.  She is in a common law relationship and has two children who are 16 and 13 years old and in school.  Her husband works at a firm.

She is a very good housewife who also has a locale where she sells kitchenware and Yanbal brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works every day from 8am until 9pm.  She sells her products in her locale since her customers always come by there.  She sells on credit and goes out to collect payments on Sundays.  She’s been in business for 12 years and likes it because she entertains herself at work.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, notions and kitchenware.  This is her fourth cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because her fellow members are very responsible.  Her dream is to own a car to get around more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, cosmetics, notions and kitchenware.

loans.name: Nidia Mercedes

texts.es: Nidia Mercedes tiene 34 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Tiene más de 6 años en este negocio ha logrado obtener una gran experiencia por la gran cantidad de clientes que tiene. Ella tiene un hijo menor de edad, la ayuda a su Mama en lo que puede y sale a ofrecer sus productos con ella. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes para niños y formales.
texts.en: Nidia Mercedes is 34 years old and she sells clothing and cosmetics. She has been in this business for over six years and has been able to gain a great deal of experience due to her large number of customers. She has one young son who helps his mother however he can, going out with her to sell her products. The requested loan is for buying pants, shirts, skirts, suits for children, and formal suits.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits for children, and formal suits

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El señor Luis Heriberto L. es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora quien es maestro de distintos colegios de Masaya. El salario de un profesor en Nicaragua es muy bajo es por ello que él solicita el crédito para poder mejorar su vivienda la cual está en malas condiciones para enfrentar el invierno. 
Con el crédito el comprará materiales de construcción para la vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis Heriberto L. is a hard-working and entrepreneurial person who is a teacher in several schools in Masaya.  The salary for a teacher in Nicaragua is very low and this is why he is requesting the loan to be able to improve his house which is in bad condition to face winter.  
With the loan he will buy construction materials for the house.

loans.use: with materials to improve his home.

loans.name: Martha Ines

texts.es:
Martha con su propio negocio de venta de ropa usada así como el alquiler de un cuarto siendo de muchos beneficios para los gastos que cubre mensual. Sus ventas incrementaron a un ochenta por ciento con financiamiento que la institución ha otorgado en nueve créditos.
Con los que se ha desarrollado mas su capital, obteniendo mejores resultados de ganancia mediantes sus ventas.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo comenzara con la construcción de un cuarto mas, con el objetivo de alquilarlo siendo dinero fijo. Tiene parte de los materiales comprado. Materiales a comprar: piedra, cemento, zinc, perlin, entre otros para  terminar su cuarto.
texts.en:
Through Martha’s own business of second hand clothes and renting of a room she is able to cover her monthly expenses. Her sales have increased 80% thanks to the nine loans given by the organization. The increase in capital has allowed her to increase her sales resulting in higher profits. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to add one more room to rent which will bring steady income. She already purchased some of the materials but still needs stones, cement and zinc among others to finish the room.

loans.use: to buy the materials to build an additional room to rent it out.

loans.name: Alexander Antonio

texts.es: Alexander es un padre de familia de 27 años. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa nueva desde hace mas de 6 años, Alexander desea adquirir inventario para mejorar la calidad de ropa que ofrece, el realiza las ventas de sus productos de manera ambulante ya que así obtiene más clientes. este crédito que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, shorts, entre otros.
texts.en:
Alexander, age 27, is a family man.  He works selling new clothing and has been in the buiness six years.  Alexander wants to the improve the quality of the clothing he sales.  He is a street vendor since he is able to reach more customers this way.

He plans to use the loan to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, shorts, etc.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, skirts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Felix  Pedro

texts.es:
Don Félix , tiene 60 años de edad , es originario de la comunidad La Rica, localizada en el departamento de Jinotega , es padre de 7 hijos , el se dedica a la siembra de café ,lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad. El inicio a la edad de 18 años  sembró sus propios cultivos, en un terreno que su papa le dejo , con el tiempo el vendió esas tierras para comprar mas terrenos para cultivar ,sembró café y con las ganancias obtenidas compro mas terreno , sembró granos básicos y es así que a lo largo de estos años ha venido sobreviviendo el y su familia a pesar de que el solo logro estudiar hasta primer grado de primaria por sus condiciones de pobreza en la que sus padres vivian , no pudo seguir estudiando mas pero si aprendió bien el oficio de agricultor.
Solicito el préstamo para darle mantenimiento a su finca de café, para pago de mano obra directa, compra de insumos. Con esta inversión espera sacar una cosecha de calidad, que le permita vender toda su producción futura a buen precio, pues le gustaría venderlo el directamente sin usar intermediario, también ayudar a sus hijos y comprar unos muebles para su casa. En lo futuro le gustaría aumentar su plantación de café. Su próxima meta es sembrar el maíz y frijol.
texts.en:
Felix, age 60, is from the community of La Rica, located in the Jinotega department. He has seven children and makes his living growing coffee. Felix has been in this business for over 40 years; he started when, at the age of 18, he first sowed his own crops on a plot that his father had left him. 

With time, Felix sold that land in order to purchase additional plots for cultivation. He sowed coffee and with the profits from the harvest acquired additional land where he sowed staple grains. This is how, through the years, Felix and has family survived even though he only finished first year of primary school -- he was not able to study because of the poverty in which his parents lived, but he did learn well the craft of being a good farmer.

Felix is seeking a loan in order to do the necessary maintenance work on his coffee farm, to pay labor costs, and to purchase supplies. With the help of this investment, he expects to able to collect a high-quality harvest which will allow him to sell the entire crop at good prices; he would also like to sell the crop to a direct buyer so that he does not have to use an intermediary. In addition, he wants to help his children to buy a couple of pieces of furniture. In the future, Felix wants to increase the size of his coffee fields. His next goal is to sow corn and beans.

loans.use: to maintain a coffee farm, to pay labor costs, to purchase supplies

loans.name: Darwin Alexis

texts.es: Darwin Alexis se dedica a la venta de refrescos. Tiene más de 14 años en su negocio, sus 3 hijos están bajo su cargo siempre busca la forma de sacarlos adelante y proporcionarles lo necesario. La mayoría de sus clientes saben los buenos productos que el ofrece y disfrutan de además hablar con Darwin ya que tiene un gran carisma. El crédito es para la compra de frutas, gaseosas, hielo, bolsas, pajillas y otra materia prima. A pesar no ser un negocio muy grande el siempre está pensando en ampliarse para obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Darwin Alexis sells soft-drinks.  He has been in business for 14 years and has three children under his care.  He has always found a way to provide for them and give them all they need.  Most of his customers are familiar with his good products and enjoy talking to Darwin because he is very charismatic.

He plans to use the loan to buy fruit, sodas, ice, bags, straws and other raw materials.  Even though his business is not very big he is always thinking about expanding to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy fruit, sodas, ice, bags, straws and other raw materials

loans.name: Ermitania

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La California de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Rio De Oro.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ermitania, tiene 42 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tuvo tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y una chica de 15 años de edad, con ella  viven los menores que estudian en universidad y colegio. Lleva doce años en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del banco y le gusta porque en el banco ha recibido mucha ayuda para ella y sus compañeras.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes y más productos de primera necesidad. También vende ropa por catalogo, bisutería y productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados, los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría los recibe en su local. Tiene doce  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco, por lo cual está muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir por la ayuda que le han brindado.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar productos de primera necesidad, ropa y pruductos Avon.
 Sus metas son que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the communal bank "Rio de Oro" meet In the neighborhood,  "La California", in Portoviejo, the Manabí capital.  For many years it has been known as the city of the royal tamarinds.

Here we meet Mrs. Ermitania, age 42, who is separated but has three children, two adults and a 15-year-old daughter.  The youngest ones, who are in college and school, live with her.  She has been in the communal bank for 12 years and is the president.  She enjoys it because of the support she receives for herself and her friends.

She has a grocery store in her home and sells all kinds of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent and other basic needs products.  She also sells, by catalogue, clothing, costume jewelry and Avon products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfume and ladies' accessories).  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., some times even later.  Her children help her when they are not busy and business is going well.

She began business with her first loan from the bank for which she is very grateful to the Espoir Foundation.  She plans to use the loan to buy basic needs products for her store, clothing and Avon products.  Her goal is that her children become good professionals.

loans.use: To buy basic needs products, clothing and Avon products

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es: Maria Del Transito tiene un negocio de ferretería. Inicio hace 11 años, en donde ofrece una gran variedad de productos como tubos, llaves, candados, clavos, martillos, aerosoles, machetes, cerámica entre otros. Sus clientes llegan a comprar a su negocio ya que ella ofrece buenos precios y además Maria es muy atenta y cariñosa. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para ampliar en su inventario y poder comprar en los productos que sus clientes le encargan.
texts.en:
María Del Transito has a hardware store that she began 11 years ago.  She offers a wide range of products, such as pipes, keys, locks, nails, hammers, aerosols, knives, ceramic, etc.  Many customers prefer her store because she has good prices and is attentive and kind to them.

She is requesting a loan to expand her inventory and purchase the products her customers order.

loans.use: To buy pipes, keys, locks, nails, hammers, aerosols, knives, ceramics, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase footwear

loans.name: Martha Esperanza

texts.es: Martha Esperanza tiene 51 años, Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de costura. Tiene más de 19 años en este negocio. Sus inicios se dan por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar. Ella siempre ha sido una excelente costurera, por lo que sus clientes llegan a solicitarle una gran variedad de prendas de vestir. El financiamiento es para la compra de hilos, tela, aguja, tijera y otros insumos que son necesarios para la elaboración de sus prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Martha Esperanza, age 51, runs a tailoring business that she has been in for 19 years.  She began her activity in order to help cover household expenses.  She has always been an excellent seamstress and therefore has many customers who go to her for a wide variety of garments.

The loan is to buy thread, fabric, needles, scissors and other supplies necessary for making the clothing she sells.

loans.use: To buy thread, fabric, needles, scissors and other supplies

loans.name: Lady Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora. Lady S. es socia del banco comunal María Reina de la Paz, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica y muchos lugares para visitar, cuenta con una variada gastronomía la misma que cautiva los paladares de quienes la visitan, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora Lady tiene 42 años, es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 16 años de edad y estudian en el colegio. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Lady labora en su negocio hace 4 años, ella da el servicio de viandas (almuerzos), trabaja de lunes a viernes solo el medio día. Hace 2 meses ha iniciado con el negocio de un Spa, prestando su servicio por las tardes.

Nuestra socia se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de maquinas para su Spa.

Su meta es agrandar mucho mas sus negocios.
texts.en:
Lady Salazer is a member of the communal bank “Maria Reina de la Paz” (Mary Queen of Peace) and lives in the center of the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate, great architectural beauty, and many places to visit.  It has a varied cuisine that captivates the palates of those who visit and the people maintain their culture and traditions.  

Lady is 42-years-old, she is divorced and has two children of 17 and 16 years of age who study in school.  She does not have her own house as she lives as a renter. 

Lady has worked in her business for four years.  She gives food service (lunches) and works from Monday to Friday only until midday.  Two months ago she began with the business of a spa helping in the afternoons.

Our member is on her second loan that she has made in the communal bank she was invited into by a friend.  The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of machines for her spa.

Her goal is to make her businesses much larger.

loans.use: to buy machines for a spa.

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Melania se dedica a la venta y destace de cerdo, siempre ha sido una persona muy luchadora por lo que disfruta de su actividad. Ella tiene a sus hijos que mantener por lo que siempre está pendiente de proporcionarles lo necesario.  Este financiamiento es para la compra de cerdos ya que tiene ciertas ofertas muy favorables. Melania sabe que sus clientes llegan a buscar los productos que ofrece pues son de muy buena calidad.
texts.en: Melania makes her living buying and selling pigs, and is a hardworking person who enjoys her business. She cares for her children and makes sure that her family has all they need.  This credit will be used to buy more pigs, and she already has several very profitable options. Melania knows her client base and offers them the best quality service possible.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Fabiola De Los Angeles

texts.es: Fabiola  es una mujer emprendedora, que disfruta de su medio de vida que es la venta de mercadería en general. A pesar que no ha sido fácil mantener su negocio, los deseos de salir y la experiencia en su trabajo ha realizado es lo que motiva a Fabiola continuar adelante. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de prendas, calzado, perfumes, camisas, trajes de baño para la temporada de verano. Las metas que tiene son de seguir mejorar cada día más su actividad y al mismo tiempo incrementar su inventario.
texts.en: Fabiola is an entrepreneurial woman who enjoys her work, which is selling general merchandise. Despite the fact it hasn't been easy to maintain her business, the desire to get out and enjoy her business has motivated Fabiola to keep working. This loan is to buy garments, shoes, perfumes, shirts, and swimsuits for the summer season. Her goals are to keep improving her business every day while also growing her inventory.

loans.use: to buy shoes, perfumes, shirts, and swimsuits for the summer season.

loans.name: María Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora. María S. es socia del banco comunal María Reina de la Paz, vive en el sector de Monay en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica y muchos lugares  para visitar, cuenta con una variada gastronomía la misma que cautiva los paladares de quienes la visitan, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora María tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 32, 30, 25 y 11 años de edad, su primera hija es casada e independiente, su segundo y tercer hijo trabajan y le ayudan  economícamente. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora en una empresa privada, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María tiene un su negocio propio, es un bazar en el que trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Hay veces que realiza trabajos de costura ya que también sabe sobre este arte y realiza todo tipo de arreglo a prendas de vestir.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 4 años y  su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su bazar.
 
Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Señora María S. is a member of the communal bank María Reina de la Paz.  She lives in the Monay sector in the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate, beautiful architecture and many places to visit.  It has a diverse cuisine that captivates the palettes of those who visit.  The people maintain its culture and traditions.

Señora María is 48 years old, married and has 4 children ages 32, 30, 25 and 11.  Her oldest daughter is married and living independently.  Her second and third children are working and help her financially.  Her husband is a driver and works for a private company.  As a result of their joint work efforts they were able to build their own home.  

Doña María has her own store where she works seven days a week from 6:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night.  There are times when she takes seamstress jobs as she also knows the art of the sewing and can fix all types of clothing.  
 
She has been a member of the communal bank for 4 years.  She is going to use this new loan to purchase merchandise for her store.
 
Her dream is to be debt-free.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Valeria Adrian

texts.es:
La Señorita Valeria V. es socia del banco comunal María Reina de la Paz, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica y muchos lugares para visitar, cuenta con variada gastronomía la misma que cautiva los paladares de quienes la visitan, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Valeria tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su abuelita en una casa  que es de su propiedad.
Nuestra socia se dedica a estudiar la carrera de Derecho en la universidad.

Se encuentra en su tercer cerdito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga de su mamá quien es socia activa del banco. Su crédito lo va a invertir en sus estudios.
 
Su meta es culminar sus estudios y llegar a ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Miss Valeria V. is a member of the village bank Maria Reina de la Paz. She lives in the center of the city of Cuenca, which has a cold climate and beautiful architecture and many places to visit. It also has a varied cuisine that captivates the palates of those who visit. The people there maintain their culture and traditions.

Valeria is 22 years old, single and lives with her grandmother in a house that she owns. She is studying law at the university.

This is her third loan with the village bank, which she was invited to join by a friend of her mother who is an active member. Her loan will be invested in her studies. 

Her goal is to finish her studies and become a great professional.

loans.use: to pay for her studies.

loans.name: Rosa Teolinda

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Pérez es socia del banco comunal Narancay Bajo, vive por la parroquia de Tarqui esta parroquia es de clima frió, cuenta con grandes llanuras en donde su población se dedica a la cría de ganado, agricultura, muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad de Cuenca a ejercer varios empleos, son gente muy cordial y amables.

La Señora. Rosa tiene 49 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 18 y 15 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su segunda hija estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Rosa se dedica a negociar  leche en su parroquia y la vende en la ciudad, esta actividad la realiza hace un año. En su casa se dedica a realizar toda clase de arreglo a las prendas de vestir, aprendió esta labor en una academia de costura.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela para seguir en su trabajo de la costura.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Pérez is a member of the village bank Narancay Bajo. She lives in the parish of Tarqui, which has a cold climate and vast plains where the people raise cattle and practice agriculture. Many commute daily to the city of Cuenca to work in various jobs. The people there are very polite and friendly.

Rosa is 49 and a single mother of 2 children, 18 and 15 years old. Her oldest son works and helps with the household expenses. The younger daughter studies in a high school in the city. She does not have her own home, so she rents.

Rosa bargains for milk in her parish and she sells it in the city. She has been doing this for one year. In her home she mends all kinds of clothing, a trade that she learned in sewing school.

This is her second loan with the village bank and she will invest the money in the purchase of fabric to continue with her sewing work. 

Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
La Señora Ana L. es socia del banco comunal Narancay Bajo, vive por la comunidad de Narancay Bajo en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad en 1999 fue nombrada patrimonio cultural de la humanidad por la belleza colonial de su centro histórico, Cuenca es cuna de grandes atletas, pintores, escritores y artesanos, tiene una variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es muy amable y cordial. 

Doña Ana tiene 27 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 7 y 6 años de edad que  estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá de manera independiente.
 
La Señora. Ana se dedica a la venta de frutas en un mercado de la ciudad, esta actividad la realiza hace 10 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal.

Es socia del banco comunal hace dos años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal.

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana L. is a member of the village bank Narancay Bajo and lives in the community of Narancay Bajo in the city of Cuenca. In 1999 this city was named a UNESCO World Heritage Site for the colonial beauty of the historic center. Cuenca is the cradle of great athletes, painters, writers and artisans. It has a varied cuisine and the people are very friendly and polite.

Ana is 27 years old and is a single mother to two children, 7 and 6, who study in a school in the city. She does not own a home, so she lives independently in her mother's house. 

Ana sells fruit in a market in the city. She has been doing this for 10 years. She works from Sunday to Sunday, from 6:00am until 6:00pm. In her free time she sells cosmetics from the Yanbal brand.

She has been a member of the bank for 2 years and will invest her credit in buying Yanbal brand cosmetics.

Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy Yanbal products.

loans.name: María Bertha

texts.es:
La Señora. María O. es socia del banco comunal Narancay Bajo, vive por el sector del Vergel en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad en 1999 fue nombrada patrimonio cultural de la humanidad por la belleza colonia de su centro histórico, Cuenca es cuna de grandes atletas, pintores, escritores y artesanos, tiene una variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es muy amable y cordial.
 
Doña María tiene 30 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 10 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su hermana la misma que es prestada.
 
La Señora. María se dedica al comercio, vende frutas y esta actividad la desempeña hace 10 años, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunas y lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para seguir creciendo en su negocio.

Su sueño es tener  casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. María is a member of the Narancay Bajo Community Bank. She lives in the Vergel neighborhood in Cuenca City. This city was named a World Heritage Cultural Site in 1999 because of its beautiful colonial architecture in its historical center. Cuenca is the birthplace of athletes, painters, and artisans. It has a great variety of restaurants. Its people are friendly and polite.
Mrs. María is 30 years old. She is a single mother of two children, ages 10 and 2. Her first child attends a little school in the city. She doesn’t have her own house. She lives with her sister in a house that is on loan to her.
Mrs. María sells fruit. She has been doing this business for ten years. She works from Monday until Friday from six in the morning until five in the evening.
This is her second loan with the community bank. She is going to use the money to buy more fruit in order to continue expanding her business.
Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Batkhuyag

texts.en:
Mr.Batkhuyag is 53 years old. He lives with his wife and three of his children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has 5 children, but the two eldest ones are married and live separately. Bathuyag has a job contract with a tourist company. He owns a minivan, which he uses to transport tourists to the countryside.

Batkhuyag owns a plot of land and recently he completed the building of a family house. Now he is working on his garden. He likes growing different plants and fruits in his garden. He is applying for a loan to buy sea buck thorn trees to plant in his garden. These trees give yellow berries that are rich in vitamin C and they can stand the very cold winter. A lots of people grow and harvest sea buck thorn berries and sell them to pharmaceutical companies for money. For 1 kilo of raw berries, on the vegetable market, the cost is around 6000 Mongolian tugriks (around 5USD).

loans.use: To buy sea buckthorn trees and to plant them on his land to harvest the berries.

loans.name: Anania

texts.en: Anania is 38 years old. She lives in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She is married with three children, ages 6, 10 and 12. Anania works with her husband on their farm and grows rice. She also owns a sari-sari store in her place. This has been her business for six years now. It earns her family 5,500 Philippine pesos per month. Her loan will be used to buy fertilizers and seedlings. She hopes to continue her business and improve her yield in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Corsina

texts.en:
Corsina is 45 years old. She lives in San Francisco, Agusan Del Norte. She is married  with three children aged 12, 18 and 20.

Corsina is a farmer and grows rice at her place. Presently, she is the only one working in her family. Her business started 15 years ago. An average income of 8,500 Philippines pesos per month has helped her family. 

Her loan will be used to buy fertilizers and seedlings. She hopes to continue her business and improve her yield in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 35 years old. She lives in San Francisco, Agusan Del Norte. She is married  and her husband works as a carpenter and a farmer.

Lanie is a farmer and grows rice at her place. Her business started three years ago. Her loan will be used to buy fertilizers and seedlings. She hopes to continue her business and improve her yield in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras De La Q Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Sofía Victoria, es madre soltera con cuatro hijos a cuestas, uno D. ellos ya convive con su pareja, los otros tres aún dependen D. ella. Sofía Victoria es una señora alegre y a la vez responsable, por lo que el grupo comunal “Las Emprendedoras D. la Q” la eligió como presidenta. Eligieron el nombre D. “Emprendedoras” porque todas ellas se identifican como personas que impulsan el desarrollo D. su zona con su esfuerzo y trabajo; y “D. la Q” por que todas son vecinas D. manzana “Q”.
Sofía Victoria, se dedica a la venta D. dulces y bebidas gaseosas, en ocasiones venD. frente a su casa, a veces se transporta a los campos D. futbol a ofrecer gaseosa a los sedientos jugadores. En cuento pueD. aprovecha en hacer algunos trabajos extras, como participar D. actividades impulsadas por el gobierno que le generan un ingreso extra.
El sueño D. Sofía Victoria, es ver a sus hijos logrados como universitarios y que puedan sustentar sus gastos y los D. su futura familia, el prestamo lo usara para adquirir mercaderias para su negocio (bebidas, dulces)
texts.en:
Sofia is a single mother with 4 children in her charge, one of whom now lives with his wife and the other three still depend on her. Sofia is a happy woman and also a responsible one, for which reason the village bank "Las Emprendedoras D. la Q" elected her as president. They chose the name "Emprendedoras" [Entrepreneurs] because they all identify as people that push development in their zone with their hard work and efforts; and "D. la Q" [of the Q] because they are all neighbors on the Q block. 

Sofia sells sweets and sodas; sometimes she sells them in front of her house, other times she goes to the soccer fields to offer sodas to the seated players. When she is able, she takes advantage of other changes to make money, like participating in activities driven by the government that give her some extra income.

Sofia's dream is to see her children achieve college educations and be able to sustain their costs and those of their future families.

loans.use: to purchase drinks and candy for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Ntamugabumwe Group

texts.fr: Théophile M. est petit commerçant de Sake, chef du groupe Ntamugabumwe, et client d’ACB depuis 2010.  Il est marié, il a 2 enfants entre 3 ans et  1 an.  Nul de ses enfants ne va à l’école.  Théophile est né au Rwanda, et il a fini 6 ans d’école primaire.  Ce crédit est son deuxième cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter les aliments (haricots, maïs, maniocs,…)  à revendre sur un prix raisonnable.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est augmenter la quantité vendu pour augmenter le profit, et il voudrait devenir un grand commerçant de sake et avoir un dépôt.  Sa vision pour l’avenir est d’éduquer ses enfants, et avoir la bonne santé pour sa famille.
texts.en: Théophile M. is a small merchant from Sake, head of the Ntamugabumwe group, and has been a client of ACB since 2010. He is married and has two children ranging in age from 1 to 3. None of his children go to school. Théophile was born in Rwanda and he has completed 6 years of primary school. This is his second loan with ACB and he is going to use this loan to buy food products (beans, corn, cassava) to sell at a reasonable price. His strategy for business growth is to increase how much he sells to increase his profits, and he would like to become a renowned retailer in Sake and have a store. His vision for the future is to send his children to school and make sure his family is in good health.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, and cassava to sell at the Sake market.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 31 years old and is a married woman with six children. The oldest child is 9. Adela’s husband works as a farmer.

Adela is a farmer working in San  Francisco Agusan Del Sur. Adela has been growing rice  for 10 years. Adela earns 2,500 Philippines pesos per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Adela hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and payment for manual labor for tomato farming

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 40 years old and is a married woman with five children. The oldest child is 18. Anita’s husband works as a farmer.

Anita is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. Anita has been growing rice for 10 years. Anita earns 4,500 Philippines pesos per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Anita hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Chrisa

texts.en:
Chrisa G. is 24 years old and is a married woman with four children. Chrisa’s husband works as a driver and farmer.

Chrisa is a farmer working in San  Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. Chrisa has been growing rice and pigs for seven years. Chrisa earns enough income doing farming and having a piggery. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, feeds and fertilizers. In the future, Chrisa hopes to own a bigger farm and a bigger piggery.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, feeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with five children. The oldest child is 20. Cristina’s husband works as a farmer.

Cristina is also a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 10 years. She earns enough income doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. In the future, she hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase soap, sugar, salt, orange soda, beans (and more) for retail in his shop

loans.name: Monique

texts.en: Monique is 48 years old. She has three children who are between the ages of 18 and 26 years old. She adopted one and the other two are her own and they are both in school. Her husband sells foodstuffs. Monique works with her husband; she sells foodstuffs and they rear a cow. They grow green bananas and, as you can see in the photo, there are banana trees. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs and a cow to make more profits because in the future, she plans to open up a shop of her own.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Liberere

texts.en: Liberere is 31 years old. She has three children who are between the ages of 3 and 1 year old. She is married to businessman. She owns a shop in which she sells different kinds of items including rice, sugar, flour, biscuits, water, etc. This business has helped Liberere to feed her family, and she has done this business for four years. She is requesting a loan to buy more sugar, flour, rice, etc., in order to make more profits. With the profits, she plans to make some savings.

loans.use: to buy items such as sugar and flour.

loans.name: Jean Du Dieu

texts.en:
Jean du Dieu is 30 years old and single. He owns a shop in which he sells several items. He sells cows, shoes and the traditional cloth called Kitenge at different locations. He has been selling these items for four years and this business has brought a big difference to his life. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more cows because they give him more profits. This will allow him to make as much savings as possible in order to build a house in which he wants to do business.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: Epiphanie is 39 years old. She has six children who are between the ages of 3 and 16 years old. They are all in school. Epiphanie sells sorghum on a wholesale scale. This business has enabled her to pay school fees for her family and feed her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum and make more profits in order to reach her goals.

loans.use: To buy sorghum.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en: Jean Claude is 28 years old. He is single. He owns a general store in which he sells different items such as cooking oil, soap, hoes, water, etc., and some foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, beans, maize flour, etc. He has done this business for five years and he is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs and make more profits. He wants to save all his profits.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four cartons of soaps, 40 liters of cooking oil, two sacks of sugar, wheat flour, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with three school-going children. They live at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. Florence faces a major challenge in the change in market prices of products, which at times leads to losses. She dreams of expanding her cereals business and opening a big shop in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings she is requesting, she wants to purchase four sacks of beans, five sacks of rice, three sacks of green grams (mung beans) and two sacks of maize. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase four sacks of beans, five sacks of rice, three sacks of green grams (mung beans) and two sacks of maize.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is the mother of four children who are between the ages of 5 and 15 years old. She is 44 years old. She owns a shop in which she sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as maize flour, rice, beans, etc. She runs the shop together with her husband. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as flour, rice, beans, etc., in order to make more profits. She has done this business for the past 10 years and it has enabled her to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs such as flour, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man with three school-going children. He lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Hamisi has operated a poultry business for the past three years, selling door-to-door and from home to hotel (mini-restaurant) operators and neighbors. Hamisi faces a major challenge of market price fluctuation. He dreams of expanding his business and building premises in the future.

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase 100 chicks and chicken feeds. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase 100 chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 10 bundles of firewood for sale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 42 years old. She has six children who are between the ages of 2 months and 20 years. She owns a shop in which she sells sugar, rice, coffee and some scholastic materials. She has done this business for 10 years and this business has enabled her meet her needs and the needs of her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs for sale to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a family house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a firewood business for the past one year, selling from door-to-door, in a shop and from home. Her potential customers are her neighbors. She also operates a food-selling business, cooking chapati (flat bread) and beans. Her major challenge in the business is seasonality. During the rainy season it becomes difficult to get firewood for sale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase 10 bundles of firewood for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bundles of firewood for sale.

loans.name: Jelmer

texts.en:
Jelmer is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 23. Jelmer’s husband works as a farmer.

Jelmer is also a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice  for 10 years. She earns just enough for her family. Jelmer works hard to improve her earnings and save for her family's future.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, she hopes to own a bigger farm someday.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase charcoal and bundles of sarongs called Lesos (Kikois)

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 41 years old and married with four kids. She is a farmer and tills land in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for six years. Each month, Mely earns 3,500 PHP from farming.

Mely’s loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to have a stable business and successful children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a pump and pipes for her water vending business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with no children. She lives in her own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her young siblings. For the past four years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from a shop and also from her home to her neighbours. 

Juliet faces a major challenge in competition from other boutique operators in her area. She dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase cloth and thread. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and thread.

loans.name: Pheny

texts.en:
Pheny is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Her husband is a room steward and he contributes to his family's basic needs.

For the past year, she has operated a greengrocer business, selling in a shop and from her home to her neighbours. Pheny faces a major challenge in competition from other greengrocers. She dreams of opening a wholesale greengrocery in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase 2 crates of tomatoes, 4 crates of bananas, 2 crates of onions and carrots. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 2 crates of tomatoes, 4 crates of bananas, 2 crates of onions and carrots.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman with three children who go to school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a greengrocer business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. Naomi faces the major challenges of competition and seasonality. During the rainy season the availability of vegetables to sell is low. She dreams of opening a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase two crates of potatoes, onions, 2 sacks of cabbages and 3 crates of bananas. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase two crates of potatoes, onions, 2 sacks of cabbages and 3 crates of bananas.

loans.name: Milagrosa

texts.en:
Milagrosa earns a living through farming. She grows rice crops to sell. She earns 3,000 PHP per month from her business. She has requested a loan and plans to use it to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs.

Milagrosa is 45 years old and is a married woman. She has 3 children, the oldest of whom is 28 years old.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 42 years old and married. She has three children ages 24, 20 and 18. She and her husband are both farmers. They till land in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. Rice is the primary crop that they grow to sell. According to Nenita, she has been engaged in farming for 19 years. 

Nenita has requested a loan and plans to use it to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. She is hoping to have an increased harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of cucumber, onions and chili sauce.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a father to three kids. He is 59 years old and married. His oldest child is 16 years old.

Reynaldo has been a farmer for 30 years. He grows rice crops that he sells to the market. Reynaldo earns about 4,000 PHP per month from his farm. He wants to improve his earnings for his children’s future.

This loan will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. Reynaldo hopes to have an increased harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with three children aged 24, 20 and 7. She lives in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur.

Salome has been in the business of raising hogs for 10 years. Her income from her business differs each month but the highest she earned was 6.000 PHP. Salome also put up a sari-sari store to help augment her family’s income. The loan that she requested will be used to buy pig feed, vitamins and other supplies she needs for her piggery. Salome hopes for her businesses to be stable.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bananas and pay for transportation costs.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
51-year-old Sherlita is a married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 22 years old and the youngest is only 8.

Sherlita is a farmer and primarily grows rice. She has been engaged in farming for 10 years. Sherlita also raises goats. Sherlita works hard to improve her income of 3,000 PHP per month. She requested a loan and plans to use it to buy farm fertilizers, vitamins and medicines for the goats she raises.

loans.use: to buy farm fertilizers, vitamins and medicines for her goats

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 38 years old and married. She is a farmer who tills land in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. Yolanda started her farming business three years ago. She and her husband help to keep the farm productive. Her husband also works as a carpenter.

Yolanda’s loan will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Yolanda hopes to have their own furniture shop.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials and cement to repair her restaurant.

loans.name: Mwari

texts.en:
Mwari is a single woman with four children, two boys and two girls, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, clothing and food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwari faces a major challenge of competition from other tailors in her area. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase a sewing machine and cloth. Mwari decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and cloth.

loans.name: Bitres

texts.en:
Bitres is a single woman who lives with her brother's three children. They live at a rental house that has electricity but lacks piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a second-hand clothes-selling business. She sells at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Bitres faces a major challenge of competition from other second-hand clothes merchants in the market. She dreams of establishing her own retail shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bales of second-hand clothes and to pay transportation costs. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand clothes and pay transportation costs.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with six children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a water-vending business.  She also sells in a shop and from home. Margaret faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the hot dry season, the availability of water for selling is lower. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan,  she wants to purchase 10 plastic containers for the distribution of water and ground nuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase 10 plastic containers for distribution of water and ground nuts for sale.

loans.name: Pierre Seyni

texts.fr:
MONSIEUR PIERRE SEYNI EST COMMERÇANTE SPÉCIALISÉ DANS LE DOMAINE DE LA COUTURE(ACHAT ET LA PRODUCTION).
il a eu a capitaliser une expérience de 8 ans dans le domaine. Face a une demande forte de ses clients il sollicite un prêt.
texts.en: Mr. Pierre Seyni T. is a businessman specialized in sewing (purchase and production). He is capitalizing on an eight-year experience in this domain. Faced with a strong demand from his clients, he is requesting a 200,000 CFA francs loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing material to respond to strong demand for his clothes

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia, a married woman without children, lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and food. For the past four years, she has operated a business selling clothes from her shop to neighbours and passersby. She also sells natural fruit juice.

Sophia faces the major challenge of seasonality, as during the hot dry season less fruits are available for making juice. With this Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits for making both natural juice and bundles of clothes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and dreams of expanding it and establishing another one in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits to make natural juice and bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda, a married woman with six children, all of whom graduated from school, lives with her family in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills. Mwenda operates a food-vending business, selling at the market and from door to door. The major challenge she faces is theft due to a lack of security in her area of operation.

Mwenda decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With this Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to build her business structure and purchase timber and iron sheets. She dreams of owning a well-furnished cafe in the future.

loans.use: to build her business structure, and purchase timber and iron sheets.

loans.name: Agbogan Dela Akossiwa

texts.fr:
madame kossi agbogan dela akossiwa est une commerçante spécialisée dans la vente de chaussures, tissus et de bijoux.
elle capitalise une expérience de 4 ans dans le domaine.elle s'approvisionne pour la plupart du temps au Togo.ainsi elle sollicite ce montant pour augmenter son fonds de roulement
texts.en:
Mrs. Kossi Agbogan dela Akossiwa is a retailer specialized in the trade of shoes, fabrics and jewelry.
She is capitalizing on four years of experience in this domain. Most of the time, she gets her supplies from Togo. Therefore she is requesting this loan to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase more stock (shoes, material, jewellery) from Togo for resale

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze, a married woman with five children, all of whom graduated from school, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, Kanze has operated a coconut business, selling both wholesale and retail at the market. Another source of income is farming. Kanze faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. With the loan of Kshs 40,000, she wants to hire a tractor to cultivate her farm, pay labor costs, and purchase three sacks of coconuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to hire tractor to cultivate her farm, pay labor  and buy three sacks of coconuts.

loans.name: Kavumbi

texts.en:
Kavumbi K. is a married woman with four children, three of whom are adults while one still attends school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a coconut-selling business for the past seven years, selling in a shop, as wholesale, as retail and from door to door. In addition, Kavumbi sells fruits as another source of  income. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. She dreams of becoming a dairy farmer in the future.

Kavumbi's first Kiva loan enabled her to improve her living standards, and she is now taking a second Kiva loan after repaying the first one. 

With the KES 15,000, she wants to lease coconut trees and purchase sacks of coconuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To lease coconut trees and purchase sacks of coconuts.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma M. is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend college. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and food for the family. 

For the past 10 years, she has operated a coconut-selling business, selling as retail and at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of owning a poultry farm in the future. 

With the KES 35,000, she wants to build a poultry farm. She will purchase timber, wire mesh and iron sheets. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase timber, wire mesh and iron sheets in order to build a poultry farm.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia K. is a married woman with two school-going children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her husband owns a retail shop and he contributes to the well being of his family. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past two years, selling as retail and from home to her neighbors. Rukia faces major challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop to sell charcoal in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 15,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase one bundle of charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase one bundle of charcoal.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu Z. is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. They live in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a crisp-making business. (Crisps are like chips and can be made of potatoes, cassava, etc.) She sells crisps from home and door to door to her neighbors and passersby. In addition Zainabu also operates a restaurant business which contributes another source of income. 

She faces a major challenge of competition from other chip business operators in the area. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cassavas and mangoes.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cassavas and mangoes.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi K. is a single mother of five school-going children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a restaurant business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a grocery shop in the future.

Mwanahamisi also has another source of living from her farming business. Her major challenge in that business is during the hot dry season when plantations get dry. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, onions, tomatoes and cooking oil for her restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, onions, tomatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nakyesa Widows Group

texts.en:
M. Moses, 35, operates a butcher shop in Nakyesa-Kayunga. The happily married father of 10 says his business has been in existence for eight years now. 

He was previously a farmer. After his savings had accumulated from the crop sales he made, he decided to try out some other business venture in the form of this butcher shop. 

Weekly, he says, he can make profits to the tune of 150,000 UGX. With this loan, he is going to buy more cow meat  to resell at his butcher shop.

loans.use: to purchase more beef to resell.

loans.name: Jackton

texts.en:
Jackton B. is a married woman with eight children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past 15 years, she has operated a vegetable-selling business. She sells in a shop to her neighbors. In addition, she also operates a firewood-selling business, which contributes another source of income. 

Jackton faces a major challenge of seasonality. During rainy season, the availability of green vegetables is higher and demand is lower, while during hot summer season, availability of green vegetables is lower and demand is higher. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business. With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Nduga

texts.en:
Nduga H.  is a married woman with three school-going children. Her husband is a mason and he contributes to the family income. They live in a house that they own. It has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six years, she has operated a food-vending business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Nduga faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the Kes 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase cereals, sacks of maize, beans and peas.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, sacks of maize, beans and peas.

loans.name: Mourine

texts.en:
Mourine K. is a single mother of three children who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the hot summer season, the availability of ground nuts for sale is lower and demand is higher. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 10,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of ground nuts for sale.

She dreams of accessing bigger loans and expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of ground nuts for sale.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama K. is a married woman with five children. Four of the children attend school, while one is still young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Salama faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase five sacks of beans for her food stall business. 

She dreams of accessing loans to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of beans for her food stall business.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi, a married mother of two boys and two girls, all of whom attend school, owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, Mwanamisi has operated a retail shop business, selling inventory goods such as maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and tea leaves. She also operates a farming business and sells fish as her other sources of livelihood. Her potential customers are villagers and tourists visiting the area. Mwanamisi faces the major challenge of seasonality in her area of operation.

With the Kshs 80,000 loan she is requesting, she will purchase inventory, bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking fat oil, maize flour and detergents. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase inventory, bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking fat oil, maize flour and detergents.

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a married woman with six children, five boys and one girl, five of whom attend school. They own a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past eight years, she has operated a business selling makuti (palm leaves). She also sells mangrove trees to her local villagers. Mesalimu faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season when transportation becomes difficult. She dreams of becoming a leading mangrove supplier in the area. 

With the Kshs 80,000 loan, she wants to purchase palm leaves for house roofing and mangrove trees for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves for house roofing and mangrove trees for sale

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a business selling lesos, a traditional rectangular cloth used for clothing. She sells from door to door to her neighbors and passers-by. In addition, she also sells handbags to bring in more income. Zainabu faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for sale

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.
