For the past two years, she has operated a business selling maandazi (dumplings). She sells from home to her neighbors and schoolchildren. Mejumaa faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to satisfy her customers needs in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, beans, salt and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, beans, salt and cooking oil

loans.name: Kashi

texts.en:
Kashi is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Kashi has operated a soap-making business for the past five years. She sells them from door to door to her neighbors and passers-by.

Her greatest challenges are the high cost of transportation and seasonality. Kashi dreams of being a wholesale soap supplier in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase soap-making chemicals, wax and potassium manganese.

loans.use: to purchase soap-making chemicals, wax, potassium manganese

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a food vending business, cooking chapati and maandazi (flat bread and dumplings) for sale. Her customers are neighbors and schoolchildren. Mejumaa faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and beans

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha B. is a married and has four children, all of whom attend school.  She has operated a vegetable selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanasha faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of becoming the best supplier of vegetables in the market.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Mwanasha is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to purchase sacks of vegetables, cabbages, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, such as cabbages, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 13 years, she has operated a business selling charcoal and kikois. She sells these items as retail from her home to neighbors and passersby. A major challenge Mwanahamisi faces in her business is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the 80,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she is requesting, she wants to purchase five sacks of charcoal and bundles of kikois to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase five sacks of charcoal and bundles of kikois to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. They own a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a restaurant business, selling to her neighbors, school-going children, and passersby. Her greatest challenge in the business is competition from other restaurant operators. She dreams of becoming self-reliant and satisfying her customers' needs in the future.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she is requesting, she wants to stock wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to stock wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, and beans

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is married and has one child. For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She sells lesos (kangas), the Kenyan women's attire wrapped around the waist. Najma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent bills. She dreams of prospering in her business and building her own house. 

Najma is requesting a loans for 40,000 KES, which she will use to purchase bundles of lesos (kangas), cloth materials, and curtains. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of lesos (kangas), cloth materials, and curtains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sor Dionicia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Sor Dionisia esta integrado por tres mujeres que tienen negocios propios, este grupo esta ubicado en la colonia Sor Dionicia de la ciudad de NAcaome, las integrantes tienen varios años de conocerse y son muy amigas, decidieron formarse en grupo para salir adelante con sus negocios y sus familias.
a continuacion detallamos las actividades que ellas realizan:
La señora Cruz del Carmen A., se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
La señora Alcida A. se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras y la joven Yennifer C. se dedica a la venta de ropa.
el credito lo utilizaran para la compra de abarroteria, frutas, verduras y ropa.
Estas mujeres tienen muchos deseos de superacion, sus metas es crecer con sus negocios para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The group Sor Dionisia is made up of three women who have their own businesses. The group is located in the suburb of Sor Dionicia in the city of Nacaome. The members have known each other for some years and are very good friends. They decided to form this group to get ahead with their businesses and their families. 

We will detail the activities that they carry out:
Mrs. Cruz del Carmen A. sells popular consumer goods from a small grocery store in her home.
Mrs. Alcida A. sells fruits and vegetables.
The young Yennifer C. sells clothes.

The loan will be used to buy groceries, fruits, vegetables and clothes. 

These women really want to move forward; their goals are to grow their businesses to give a better quality of life to their children.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, lard, oil, margarine, corn, flour, bread, sodas, juices, soups, pastas, toilet paper, toothpaste, vegetables, fruits, pork, beef and chicken, cosmetics, sandals and clothing.

loans.name: Sindi Tatiana

texts.es:
la Joven Sindi J. es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de mariscos, actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años, sindi distribuye su producto a varios negocios todas las semanas, sus mariscos son de buena calidad y los vende a buen precio. Sindi todos los dias se levanta bien temprano para ir a comprar el pescado y los camarones.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de pescado y camaron, su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y obtener mayores ganancias, las que necesita para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sindi J. is a young and hardworking woman engaging in selling seafood, an activity she has been running for 4 years. Every week, Sindi distributes her products to various shops: her seafood are of good quality and she sells them at a good price. Every day Sindi gets up very early to go shopping for fish and shrimps.
She will invest the loan in the purchase of fish and shrimps. Her goal is to make her activity grow and to consequently increase of her income, money that she needs in order to reasch a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish, dried fish, fish fillet and shrimps.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La Sra. Victoria G. es una mujer emprendedora y muy dedicada a su negocio el cual es la venta de pescado seco, Victoria distribuye su pescado a muchas personas de la ciudad de choluteca y Tegucigalpa, todas las semanas abastece a sus clientes de pescado. el producto que vende es de buena calidad, esto hace que su demanda sea mayor.
todos los dias se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para empezar a repartir su producto.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de pescado.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Victoria G. is an enterprising woman and very dedicated to her business of selling dried fish.  Victoria distributes her fish to many people in the cities of Choluteca and Tegucigalpa, and supplies her customers every week.  Since the quality of her products is good, they are in higher demand.

She plans to use the loan to buy fish.  With her earnings, she will cover household expenses.

loans.use: To buy dried fish

loans.name: Clemente Esteban

texts.es:
Clemente de 38 años, es un hombre trabajador que inspiras mucho en su trabajo que empezó su actividad hace 15 años en la ventas de hielo helados y varios víveres.

El labora de 10H00 am a 2H00 pm y de 4H00pm a 6H30pm el prepara los helado para venderlos, Esta casado y ella es empleada domestica. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar materiales de construcción como cemento piedras y otros para arreglar su vivienda. . El anhela algún día comprarse y vehículo y terminar de adecuar su casa para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Clemente, age 38, is a hard worker who is very much inspired by his work which he began 15 years ago.  He sells ice, ice cream and groceries for a living.

He works from 10:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m, and from 4:00 p.m. to 6:30 p.m. prepares the ice cream to be sold.  He is married and his wife is a house cleaner.  With the help of the loan he plans to buy construction materials such as cement, stone and other materials to renovate his house.  He hopes to one day be able to buy a car and finish upgrading his house so he can give his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy cement and blocks

loans.name: Mwanashabani

texts.en:
Mwanashabani is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanashabani faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and meeting her customers 'needs in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she is requesting she wants purchase bundles of cloth materials for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth materials for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David M. is married and has one child. For the past four years, he has operated a music producing business, selling as retail to musicians. David faces a major challenge of competition from other music producers in the market. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills. 

David is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES, which he will use to purchase software and CDs for music recording for sale. He joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase software and CDs for music recording

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Roberto le esta haciendo falta un cuarto que será para sus hijos.
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es block, cemento y varillas, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y terminar la recamara de sus hijos y así podrán tener su propio espacio en su casa. 
Pagara el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una fabrico.
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto's house is in need of an additional room for his children.  He is requesting a loan to buy materials such as blocks, cement and rods since he does not have the money himself right now.  He wants to finish his childfren's bedroom so they can have their own independent area in the house.

He will pay back the loan with part of the salary he receives as a factory worker.

loans.use: To finish a room

loans.name: Mergelyn

texts.en:
Mergelyn C. is 26 years old and married.  She works as a farmer in the town of Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. She started growing rice four years ago. Mergelyn and her husband work together to keep their farm productive. Her husband is also a driver. Mergelyn’s family relies on the farm. She hopes for their business to be stable.

Mergelyn is requesting a loan for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn E. is 31 years old, married, and has three children. She is engaged in farming and has been growing rice for five years. Roselyn earns just enough income for the family. She works hard to improve her income and save for her children’s future.

Roselyn is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizers, gasoline for the tractor, and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, gasoline for the tractor, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina M. is 55 years old,  married, and has three children.  She is from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. Catalina has been engaged in farming for 30 years. She primarily grows rice to sell. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizers and seeds. Catalina works hard to improve her business. She wants to be able to save for her children’s future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en: Hilaria B. is 63 years old and married. She lives n Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur with her family. Hilaria started her business of farming 10 years ago. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers for her farm.  Hilaria hopes to increase her earnings and have savings for the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia D. is a 49 years old and married. She lives in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur with her family.  Lydia started her farming business five years ago. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Lydia also put up a sari-sari store to help augment her income. She sells canned goods, shampoo, and soap to the people in her community. Lydia is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will to use to buy fertilizers and items to sell such as noodles and soft drinks. In the future, Lydia hopes for her business to grow. She would also like to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and items to sell such as noodles and soft drinks

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a farmer who tills a plot of land in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. He primarily grows rice crops to sell to the market. He plans to use his loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

Michael is married and has children. He works hard to provide for his family. In the future, he hopes to see his children finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hard-working mother to three children aged 8, 6 and 4. She is married to a farmer. Susan helps her husband till their land to grow rice crops. The farm gives them an income of 4000 PHP per month. Susan does her best to improve this income and save for her children’s future.

Susan’s loan will be used to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pig feed, and additional items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman from the town of Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. She is 42 years old and has five children. Her oldest child is 18 years old.

Imelda is in the business of farming and hog-raising. She tills a plot of land to grow rice crops. She grows pigs in their backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to the market. Imelda has requested a loan and will use it to buy feed, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Imelda hopes for her businesses to grow.

loans.use: to buy feed, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 33 years old and is a married woman with two young children. Her older child is 12 years old.

Jane is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him till their land to grow rice crops. She also helps sell their harvest at the market. Jane also grows pigs at their backyard. Jane plans to use her loan to buy pig feed, fertilizers and gasoline for the tractor.

In the future, Jane hopes for her family to have improved living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, fertilizers and gasoline for the tractor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers and additional items to sell such as soft drinks and noodles

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta C. is married and has two children. She is in the business of farming. She tills her own land where she grows rice crops. Violeta is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizers and gasoline for the tractor. Violeta works hard to sustain her family especially her children’s education. She hopes they will finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and gasoline for the tractor

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and is a married woman. She has two children aged 29 and 25.

Gloria started her farming business 25 years ago. She primarily grows rice to sell. Gloria earns 5000 PHP from this farming. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Gloria works hard to improve her earnings and support her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
50-year-old Loida works as a farmer in Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 20 years. She earns about 5000 PHP per month from doing this farming. Loida has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

Loida is married and has three children aged 19, 17 and 6. She hopes for her children to have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Melona

texts.en:
Melona is 30 years old and is a married woman. She has six children, the oldest of whom is 18 years old.

Melona is engaged in farming. She has been growing rice for 15 years. She plans to use her loan to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. Melona works hard to sustain her family. She hopes for her farming business to grow.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en: 39-year-old Sherly is a married woman with children. She lives in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She tills a plot of land where she grows rice crops. Sherly has been engaged in rice farming for 20 years. She has requested a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Sherly hopes to expand her farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Lyndil

texts.en:
Lyndil is an 18-year-old woman who lives in the town of Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She is still single. Lyndil helps her family cultivate their rice fields. Lyndil does her best to keep their farm productive. She wants to go back to school and finish college. She said that if she graduates and finds a job, she would still be able to support her family and their business.

Lyndil's loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda T. is 45 years old, married, and has four children. She runs a farming business. She has been growing rice for 20 years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and gasoline for her tractor. Rosalinda hopes for her next harvest to increase.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and gasoline for tractor

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 52 years old and is a married man. He has three children aged 23, 22 and 20. His wife works as a teacher. 

Romeo has been in the business of raising hogs for 20 years. He plans to use his loan to purchase pig feed, vitamins and other supplies. Romeo works hard to improve his business and earnings. He wants to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed, vitamins, and other supplies

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 38 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 9 years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Erlinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wood.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda works hard to support her family. Yolanda is married and has a cheese-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy some materials for her cheese-making business. She has been 20 years in this business.

In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and ingredients for her cheese-making business.

loans.name: Pandukht

texts.en:
Pandukht G. lives in Suser with his wife and four children. He works at the village hall as an accountant, but the salary is not enough to meet the family needs. So Pandukht is also engaged in agriculture. His farm includes 3 cows, 20 sheep, 1 pig and 2 turkeys. He grows 2 hectares of corn, 2 hectares of barley, and 1.77 hectares of alfalfa. The family receives its income from agriculture. 

Pandukht has applied to SEF to increase the livestock. With the requested loan he plans to develop the agriculture and ensure a prosperous life for his children.

loans.use: To pay for livestock.

loans.name: Mavuno Group

texts.en:
Rehema B. is in her early forties and married with three sons and one daughter.  She is a fishmonger.  She has been in this business since 2005. She works from 6.00am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rehema's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She wants a loan to buy more fish and start selling charcoal also. Her dream is to one day build her own house and also to send her children to higher education.

Rehema will share this loan with her loan group Mavuno which has a total of 19 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. 

In the picture, Rehema is 1st on the left in a brown dress.

loans.use: To buy more fish and start selling charcoal as well.

loans.name: Kamukamu Kasambya Group

texts.en: Senyonjo is 50 years old, married, and has seven children.  They live in Karuguuza Uganda. His a hard working father and the sole breadwinner of his family whose dream is to educate his children up to the university. He has a restaurant, which he has been operating for the past 12 years.  He has worked tirelessly in this restaurant to raise school fees for his children. Senyonjo is faced with a challenge of skyrocketing food prices.  He hopes in the future to construct his own modern restaurant. Senyonjo is requesting a loan to buy food  for his restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase food .

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a forty-year-old married woman with seven children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the tailoring business for twenty years. This has enabled her to educate her children, and two of them have now completed university. Her hardship is debtors and her vision is to start another business in addition to continuing to educate her children. Mariam needs the loan to buy cloth for making dresses.

loans.use: To buy cloth for dress making.

loans.name: White Group

texts.en:
M. A., is in his early forties and married with two children. He has been operating a general store for 13 years.  He works from 7.00am to 10.00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be M.'s 2nd "motisha" loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  A "Motisha" loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.  He used the previous loan to increase the general store inventory and has paid back his loan successfully.  He hopes for a loan to buy a plot of land. His dream is to one day start travelling upcountry and collect his shop inventory.

M. will share this loan with his loan group "White" which has a total of 16 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture,  M. is the 1st on the left, back row, in a blue shirt. (The photo might not be very clear because it was raining that day.)

loans.use: To buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is 43 years old, married, with five children aged 23 to 13, living in Karuguuza, Uganda. He is the sole breadwinner for the family and his desire is to have a self-sustaining family. For 21 years he has been running a butchery business and with the  income generated he has been able to buy land and build a house. He faces a challenge of high prices and hopes to start refrigerating meat in future. Vincent intends to use the loan to buy cows to sell as meat.

loans.use: To buy cows to sell their meat.

loans.name: Hefseba Group

texts.en:
Patricia M. is married with one son who is still at school.  She has been operating a general store  since 2008. She works from 6.30am to 10.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Patricia's second "motisha" loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  A "Motisha" loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She used the previous loan to increase the store's stock and has paid back her loan successfully.  She wants a loan to further increase the general store inventory. Her dream is to one day own a big store and sell at wholesale prices as well.

Patricia will share this loan with her loan group "Hefseba" which has a total of 11 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Patricia is 1st on the left just near the palm tree, in a white dress.

loans.use: To increase the shop inventory.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 53 years old, married with five children, and her spouse is a farmer. They live in their own house in  Karuguuza, Uganda. For 7 years she has been running a retail shop and she started it from savings she had got from farming. She faces a challenge of high commodity prices which tend to affect her cash flow and she hopes to become a wholesale trader. Esther needs the loan to buy maize flour, cooking oil and soap for sale.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, cooking oil and soap for sale.

loans.name: Goreti

texts.en: Goreti is a fifty-one-year-old married woman with six children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in clothes for ten years starting with capital of 400,000 shillings and she now has 2,000,000 shillings. Her hardships are price fluctuations and high taxes and her goal is wholesale business plus educating her children. Goreti needs the loan to buy clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 28 years old, married, and has three children.  They live in a house in Kasese Uganda.The responsibility of looking after the family solely rests on him and his desire is to educate his children up to university. He has had a retail shop for six years and it is still profitable in spite of the hardship of  high transport costs. In the future he would like a wholesale business and poultry farm. Robert is requesting a loan for 800,000 UGX, which he will use to buy sugar and cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and  cosmetics to sel

loans.name: Cyril

texts.en: Cyril is a thirty-six-year-old married man with two children and owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in beer for two years and his business is steadily growing. He started selling from a one-roomed house but he now owns a pub and his vision is a big depot for beer, being an agent, plus constructing a house in town. Cyril needs the loan to buy beers and sodas for resale.

loans.use: To buy beers and sodas for resale.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 66 years old and married with 10 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Letecia has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 7 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Letecia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marianita is 48 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Marianita has a food production business in the Philippines. Marianita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her food production business.

Marianita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Marianita would like to save enough money so she can build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.en:
Gumercinda is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gumercinda is 46 years old and has one child who is in school.

Gumercinda has a shell crafts business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her shell crafts business.

Gumercinda has been 19 years in this business.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can expand her shell crafts business.

loans.use: To buy materials for her shell crafts business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en:
Adelita is 53 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She buys and resells scrap in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional scrap to sell.

Adelita has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her scrap business for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending and farming sugarcane.

Adelita aspires to save money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: To purchase additional scrap to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita is 46 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like sugar, milk, groceries, etc. 

Chita has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening and rice retailing.

Chita aspires to save money to expand her business and able to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support two children. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her fishing business.

Letecia has been 6 years in this business. She earns additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz comes from Arifwala which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan and known for its dairy industry.  She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family for the past five years. She is a caring lady who manages her household responsibilities, staying at home. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

Her husband's name is S. M. and he operates a grocery store in a nearby market. He has a good reputation among his customer due to his good dealing and the good quality products he sells. 

Shahnaz is the mother of three children. Two of them are getting education from a local school. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. Through the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk quantity which will help him fulfill the basic needs of his customers and increase his profits. Shahnaz is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for her husband and will help him providing a better financial life to his family. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Elvisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elvisa works hard to support her family. She has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Elvisa is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to  buy raw materials for her abaca-weaving business.

Elvisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for abaca (natural fiber) weaving.

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en:
Edlyn is 32 years old and married with three children. Sge works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like milk, candies, groceries, etc. 

Edlyn has borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening and retailing gasoline.

Edlyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her general store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 65 years old and married with 2 children. With one child in school, Lucia works very hard to provide for them.

Lucia runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like sardines, cooking oil, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Lucia has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cream, sugar, and other miscellaneous goods. 

In the future, Lucia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 68 years old and married with 8 children.

Rosita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Rosita has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling nipa (palm leaves).

Rosita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 38 years old and married with 3 children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like milk, candies, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Mary Jane has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice grains.

Mary Jane aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 34 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Regina has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from the buying and selling of rice grains.

Regina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 43 years old and married with 6 children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like oil, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Rosemarie has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming and tricycle transport.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline K. is 41 years old and a widow. She sells meat and has been doing so for 10 years. Jacqueline works from 8 am until 6 pm every day. She is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more meat. With her profits, Jacqueline will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Bella works hard to support her family. 

She has a ready-to-wear (RTW) clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from the buying and selling of dried seahorse. Bella is borrowing 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stocks of clothing to sell for her RTW products business. 

Bella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more RTW products to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy equipment like fishing nets for her fishing business. 

Marina has been in this business for 36 years. Marina earns more income from fish vending. 

Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy equipment like fishing nets for her business

loans.name: Leilyn

texts.en:
Leilyn has a common-law husband with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Leilyn is 31 years old and has three children who are in school. 

Leilyn has a home product sales business in the Philippines. Leilyn requested a 10,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy personal accessories and home products to sell. 

Leilyn has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Leilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy personal accessories and home products to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elisa is 48 years old and has three children who are in school. 

Elisa has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Elisa requested a 17,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to purchase fish (tabagak) for her sun-dried fish business. 

Elisa has been in this business for five years. In the future, Elisa would like to save enough money so she canafford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish (tabagak) for her dried fish business

loans.name: Rowela

texts.en:
Rowela is 40 years old and married with three children. 

She earns a living by raising pigs, and is borrowing 29,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins. Rowela has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from food vending. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for hogs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. 

Gina has been in this business for 21 years. Gina earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 42 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are in school and Susan works very hard to provide for them.

Susan runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store like shampoo, groceries, etc. Susan has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cream, sugar and other miscellaneous goods. 

In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Marietta works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock.  Marietta is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like blouses, pants, sandals etc. for her clothing sales business.

Marietta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock blouses to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and earns additional income from rice retailing. Lolita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. 

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 44 years old and married with two children.

Elvira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling ginger in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ginger to sell.

Elvira has borrowed and paid back 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling of ginger business for four years and earns additional income from her general store.

Elvira aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ginger  to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hermogina

texts.en:
Hermogina works hard to support her family. Hermogina is married and has a shoe repair business in the Philippines.

Hermogina requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional equipment like needles, threads, etc for her shoe repair business.

Hermogina has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Hermogina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy needles, thread and other equipment for her shoe repair business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing materials and repair her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Felomina has been in this business for 20 years. Felomina earns more income from fish vending.

Felomina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment and repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 39-year-old married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lucy has a bakery business in the Philippines. Lucy requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her bakery business.

Lucy has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lucy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her bakery business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 58 years old and single.

She earns a living by engaging in buying and selling of vegetables and fruits in the Philippines. Nelly is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits & vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Nelly has been doing this business for six years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is 28 years old and married. She has a clothing business where she sells various types of clothes in the market. She has had the business for over five years. Amalia is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy additional clothes to sell in the market. Each month, Amalia earns about PHP 15,000 per month doing this type of business. Growing of her business is her desire to continue sending her children to school to receive their education.

loans.use: to buy additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 36 years old and is married with two children who are ages 9 and 16. Her business is well-organized. She sells beers such as minzing, primus and so on. Clementine has four years of experience. She is working from 8 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day.

Clementine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more beer to sell, like minzing, primus and so on. With the profits, Clementine will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more beer to sell, like minzing, primus and so on.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida lives in a city called Arifwala, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its dairy industry. She is married to P. who has a business selling fruit. He sells fruit on different streets of the city by visiting with his four-wheeled cart. He purchases fruit from the fruit market and starts going to sell them early in the morning. Shahida is a housewife who manages her household work by staying at home. She also helps her husband by arranging the fruit on his cart so he can easily sell them.  

Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruit to sell and earn better profits. Shahida is hopeful that this investment will help him improve his business further. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahida.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 34 years old and married.  She has three children between the ages of three and nine. Her business is well-organized. She employs one person to help her. Seraphine has one year of experience and works from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day.

Seraphine has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more bananas to sell. Seraphine will invest the loan in her business and save the extra income to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.ru: Elshan M. 28 let. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Elshan projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Elshan uje 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji jenskix ukrashniy, zakolok i t.d. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye dlya toqo chtobi pomeshat bolshe tovarov. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo druqa kotoriy  pomoq yemu otkrit etoto magazin.
texts.en: Elshan M. is 28 years old.  He is single and childless.  Elshan lives in the Absheron region with his family. Elshan has been selling cosmetics, barrettes, etc. for four years.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to expand his shop to make room for more goods.  He started this business with his friend who helped him open the store.

loans.use: to expand his shop

loans.name: Stepane

texts.en:
Stepane G. lives in Vale, in the Samtskhe Javakheti district. He is 43 years old and married. Stepane lives with his wife Manana and two sons (17 and 15 years old). Both of them go to school. 

Stepane is leading the agricultural farm of the family. They have a 1. 5-hectare plot of land where they grow different types of vegetables, in particular cabbage, cauliflower, beets and some others as well. The harvested vegetables are sold locally. Manana works as a baker in a bakery. Her monthly salary is 250 Georgian Laris. 

With the requested loan amount, Stepane and Manana plan to renovate their house because it is old and is in bad condition. The renovation will create better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to renovate his house

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 35 years old and married. She runs a general store where she sells items such as soap, lotion, cooking oil, and rice. Her business is solid. She employs two people to help her. Speciose has three years of experience. Her store is open from 6 a.m. until 11 p.m. every day.

Speciose has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more goods to sell in her store. With the profit, Speciose will build her own house and save for her family's future needs.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Shahida Tabbasum

texts.en:
Shahida tabbasum lives in Lahore with her husband and three children. She has been living there in the area of Mughalpura for the past 20 years. Lahore is Pakistan’s second largest city, known for its history and culture. Professionally, she is a midwife. She earns a reasonable amount of income from her work, which allows her to pay utilities and other household expenses. 

Her eldest son works in a private organization and supports his family financially from the earnings. Her daughter is 22 years old and got her education until intermediate school. Now she stays at home and manages the household responsibilities. 
 
Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because she wants to buy some medical equipment and medicine for the further expansion of her business. This will help her provide better health facilities to her patients and increase her income. She has 10 years of experience in her work and is hopeful that a loan will bring more profit and allow her to treat her patients better. She has a plan to marry her daughter soon and she is sure that the increased loan profits will help her to make her plan possible.

loans.use: To buy medical equipment and medicine

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 31 years old and married, with two children aged 9 and 11. She runs a supermarket where she sells items like water, juice, milk, breads, and eggs. Her business is well organized. She employs three people to help her. Alphonsine has 12 years of experience and her store is open from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day.

Alphonsine has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more products to sell. She will invest the extra income into her business and save money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more food products to sell.

loans.name: Alovsat

texts.ru: Alovsat jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas prosjivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy jenoy i rebonkom. Alovsat M. 52 qoda. On uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva molochnix produktov kotorix on prodayet v maqazini. Yeqo produkti shitayutsya ochen kachestvennimi i poeotmu imeyut bolshuyu potrebnost.
texts.en: Alovsat is married and has one child.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his beloved wife and child. Alovsat M. is 52 years old.  He has been a herdsman for nine years.  Now he needs 2300 AZN to buy cows to increase milk production and the quantity of dairy products he sells in stores.  His milk products are considered very high quality and have a large following.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Zamir

texts.ru: Zamir H. 25 let. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Absheron reginone vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Zamir ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On uje 3 qoda kak zanimayetsya pochinkoy mashin. Etoy rabote on nauchilsya u svoyeqo dyadi kotoriy toje yavlyayetsya masterom po pochinkie mashin. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye zapchasti i instrumenti dlya pochinki mashin.
texts.en: Zamir H. is 25 years old.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Absheron region with his parents.  Zamir is single and childless.  He has been working as a mechanic for three years.  He started this business with his uncle who is also a mechanic.  Now he needs 2300 AZN to buy spare parts and tools to repair cars.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is 56 years old and married with 3 children. Ana Maria works very hard to provide for her family.

Ana Maria runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Ana Maria has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, bread, and soft drinks. 

In the future Ana Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Beatha

texts.en:
Beatha is 46 years old and married, with two children aged 10 and 20. She sells onions in her market. Her business is well-organized. She employs two people to help her. Beatha has five years of experience and she works from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day.

Beatha has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more onions. With the profits, Beatha will pay her children's school fees and save money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more onions to sell.

loans.name: Merhamat

texts.ru:
Marhamat yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey smeyoy. Marhamat jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. Marhamat B. 26 let. 
On uje 4 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uludsheniya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Marhamat is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. Marhamat is married and has one child.  Marhamat B. is 26 years old. 
He has been working as a herdsman for four years.  He started this business with his father.  Now he needs 2300 AZN to buy cows to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: C4910 Urigwiro Group

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is 36 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 1 and 12 years old.  His business is clean and well-organized.  Jean De Dieu is a businessman selling fruits and cakes and this business is fruitful for him.

Jean De Dieu is also the leader of this group which is called Urugwiro.  The group contains one woman and five men; most of them are in the business of selling foodstuffs.  Jean De Dieu is the first person on the left side.

Jean De Dieu and his group has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses to purchase more fruit.  Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Seymur

texts.ru: Seymur G. 31 qoda. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Seymur yavlyayetsya IDP resonom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoim bratom. On seychas nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye instrumenti materiali i t.d dlya remonta domov. Seymur uje 8 let kak rabotayet masterom domov. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u dvoyurodnoqo brata.
texts.en: Seymur G. is 31 years old.  He is single and childless.  Seymur is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Absheron region with his brother. He now needs 2300 AZN to buy tools and materials necessary for remodeling homes. Seymur has ben a home builder for eight years.  He started this business with his cousin.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: C4908 Isangano Group

texts.en:
Laurence is 36 years old and she is married.  She is the representative of a group called "Isangano" in the local language.  Laurence is the first person on the left in the picture.  She owns a small shop that sells soft drinks like traditional beer.  She has five year's of experience. 

Laurence and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more soft drinks like traditional beer. With the profits, they will build a comfortable house. They also needs a refrigerator which will allow them to sell cold soft drinks.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks like traditional beer.

loans.name: Beylar

texts.ru: Beylar B. 38 let. On jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. Beylar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on preselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmetse so svoyey jenoy i rebonkom. Beylar uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov, ranshe on razvodil ovec no potom on nachal razvodit korov. seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uvelicheniya molochnix produktov. Beylar prodayet u sebya doma yogurt, kefir kotoriye delayet sam i moloko.
texts.en: Beylar B. is 38 years old.  He is married and has one child. Beylar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his wife and child.  Beylar has worked as a herdsman for seven years.  Before that, he was a shepherd.  Now he needs 2300 AZN to buy cows to increase his milk production.  Beylar sells milk and homemade yogurt and kefir from his home.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Perusi

texts.en:
Perusi is 56 years old and is married with 8 children between the ages 10 and 22 years old. Her business is well organized. She employees two people in her business. Her business is open from 6am until 8pm every day and she has ten years of experience.
 
Perusi has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more clothes to sell. With this loan, Perusi will build her own house and save for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sabukhi

texts.ru: Sabukhi H. 31 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye yesho ne xodat v shkolu. Sabukhi jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoimi lubimimi detmi i jenoy. On uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji tetradi knishki i druqiye shkolniye potrebnosti dlya detey. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo druqa kotoriy i pomoq yemu otkrit etoot magazin. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye tetradi knishki i druqiye shkolniye potrebnosti dlya detey.
texts.en: Sabukhi H. is 31 years old. He is married and has two preschool children. Sabukhi lives in Baku with his beloved children and wife.  He has been selling school supplies such as books and notebooks for five years.  He started this business with his friend who helped him open the shop.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy notebooks, books and other school supplies.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, books and other school supplies.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 25 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 1 and 4 years old.  Beatrice sells rice,sugar,cooking oil,soap and so on.  Her business is well-organized.  She employs three people to help her.  Her business hours are from 8 am until 9 pm every day and she has five year's of experience.

Beatrice has requested a loan from kiva lender in order to purchase more product like rice,sugar,cooking oil,soap and so on.  With the profits, Beatrice will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more product like rice,sugar,cooking oil,soap and so on.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en: Sauda, a  41-year-old married mother of a two-year-old, has been selling beer for three years, She is assisted in this well-organized business by two employees and operates from 6 am until 12 pm everyday.  Sauda has requested a loan from Kiva to purchase more beer to sell including Skol, Primus, Redbrul, etc. With the additional profits, she will renovate her house and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more beer to sell such as Skol, Primus, Redbrul, etc.

loans.name: Ikhtiyar

texts.ru: Ikhtiyar G. 53 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey 2 iz kotorix uje okonchili shkolu. Ikhtiyar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. On uje 11 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Skotovodstvu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo dedushki kotoriy toje zanimalsya etim. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupi korovi dlya uluchsheniya svoyeqo biznessa a takje dlya uvelicheniya molochnoqo produkta, tak kak iz moloka on delayet sir i prodayet etoot sir v magazini.
texts.en: Ikhtiyar G. is 53 years old.  He is married and has three children who have finished school.  Ikhtiyar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his loving family.  He has been a herdsman for eleven years already.  He started tending cattle with his grandfather who worked doing that.  Now he needs 2300 AZN to buy cows to improve his business and increase milk production.  He makes cheese from this milk and sells it in stores.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: C4821 Ejohazaza Group

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 32 years old and is married. He is the president of this group, called "Ejohazaza" in the local language, and is the first person on the left side. He has been a motorbike taxi driver for five years. His group contains five members, all men who are also involved in the motorbike transportation business.

Jean Damascene has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more materials for his motorcycle, such as tires. With this profits, Jean Damascene will save for his family and to build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for his motorcycle like tires

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira T. is 54 years old. She is married and lives in the village of Manglisi in the Kartli Region. Naira’s family consists of five members: her husband Jimsheri, a 24-year-old son, a daughter-in-law, her 84-year-old mother-in-law and herself. 

Jimsheri leads the family’s farming activities. They have three milk cows. Cheese is produced and sold locally. Also, Jimsheri cultivates the plot of the land owned by the family and grows different types of vegetables. Vegetables are consumed by the family as well as sold in a grocery store run by Naira. The store is located in a neighbor village. Naira goes there every day and sells the grocery products. 

The biggest part of the loan will be used to purchase stock-in-trade for the store. It will positively impact the income of the store. The other part of the loan will be used to renovate the house. The profit earned from the store will be used for further expansion of the family's rural activities.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her grocery store and materials for house renovation

loans.name: C4820 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Pelagie is 44 years old and is married with one child who is a year old. She sells clothes and is the president of the Abishyizehamwe Group. Others in the group also have businesses selling clothes at the local market. Pelagie employs one person in her business and has five years of experience. She is the person on the far right in the photo.

Pelagie and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more styles of clothing to sell. Pelagie and her team will use the profits they earn to reinvest in their businesses and satisfy the basic needs of their families.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en:
Pierre is 29 years old and is married with two children, aged 3 and 5. He runs a butcher shop and employs two people to help him. He has three years of experience, and his business is open from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day.

Pierre has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more meat. He will use the profits to reinvest in his business and to build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: C4913 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Evariste is 45 years old. He is married with three children between the ages  4 and 9 years old. Evariste works hard in order to provide all that is needed for his children. Evariste  is a businessman from 6 am until 9 pm every day. Evariste sells beans, Irish potatoes etc. He is the group representative of the "Tuzamurane" Group, which consists of seven members (three women and four men). Each member has the same  business. 

Evariste and his group have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more Irish potatoes, bananas, sorghum and beans. With this profits, Evariste and his group will be able to reinvest in their business and to save money for their family.

loans.use: To purchase more products like  beans, Irish potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 29 years old and is married with two children, who are 2 and 5 years old. She sells food in her restaurant. She started this business three years ago and she employs four people to help her. Seraphine works from 6 am until 10 pm every day.

Seraphine has requested her first loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to buy new materials like plates, forks, and tables for her restaurant. With her profits, Seraphine will reinvest in her business and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy new materials like plates, forks, and tables  for her restaurant.

loans.name: Isaie

texts.en:
Isaie is 31 years old and married with two children, aged 2 and 5. He has a store selling foodstuffs such as tomatoes, rice, beans, and cassava flour.  His business is well organized, and he employs one person to help him. He has five years of experience and is open from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day.

Isaie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more foodstuffs. He will reinvest the profits in his business.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs such as tomatoes, rice, beans, and cassava flour.

loans.name: Ancille

texts.en:
Ancille is 43 years old and is married with five children between the ages of 10 and 17. She earns a living by sewing different styles of clothing. Her business is well organized, and she is in her fourth successful year. She works from 8 a.m until 5 p.m every day, and she employs one person to help her.

Ancille has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more cloth for sewing clothes. By expanding her business and adding more equipment and workers, she hopes to increase her profits so she can save for her future and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Egidia

texts.en:
Egidia is 50 years old and married with three children between the ages 7 and 23 years old. She works in her general store from 8am until 8pm every day and has five year's of experience. Egidia sells water, juice, breads, cooking oil, rice and so on.

Egidia has requested a loan from Kiva lender to purchase more beans, sugar, water, juice, bread, cooking oil and so on. With the profits, Egidia will pay school fees for her children and save money.

loans.use: To purchase beans, sugar, water, juice, bread, cooking oil, rice and so on.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is 30 years old and is married with two children between the ages 2 and 8 years old. She sells meat. She employes two people to help her run the business. Her business is opening from 7am until 6pm every day and she has three years of experience.

Nadia has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more meat to sell. With this profits, Nadia will reinvest in her business and to pay children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more meat to sell.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 23 years old and is married with a child who is 2 years old. Francine sells bananas and Irish potatoes. Her business is clear and well- organized. She employees one person in her business. Francine stats from 6 am until 8 pm every day and three years of experience.

Francine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more bananas and Irish potatoes. With the profits, Francine will reinvest in her business and build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 47 years old and married with four children between the ages 10 and 20 years old. Her business is well-organized. She employees five person to help her. Immaculee starts from 6 am until 11 pm every day and three years of experience. Immaculee operates a restaurant..

Immaculee has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy new materials for her restaurant. With the increased profit from the loan, she hopes to reinvest in the business and save for her future.

loans.use: to buy a new material for her restaurant

loans.name: Jose Marcos

texts.es:
José, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, tiene casa propia y se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, vive solo con su esposa ya que sus hijos tienen sus propios hogares. 
Actualmente inicia el proceso para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, por lo que José solicita un préstamo para comprar los materiales agrícolas que le ayuden para tener una buena siembra y posteriormente una buena cosecha, él comprara fertilizantes y abono.
Sus proyecciones son que a través del esfuerzo diario que realiza, poder sacar a su familia adelante, mejorando sus condiciones de vida y brindándoles lo necesario para el futuro.
texts.en:
José lives in "El Transito" in the department of San Miguel.  He has his own home where he lives with his wife, and his business in growing corn and beans.  His children live in their own homes.

He is in the process of planting corn and beans and is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies, such as fertilizer, to grow a better crop and achieve a good harvest.  

By working hard everyday, his goal is to make a good living for his family, improve their lifestyle and give them all they need for the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Gricelda

texts.es:
Griselda, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de mariscos, vive con su esposo y una hija de 15 años de edad, Griselda vende mariscos y tortillas, tiene experiencia en el manejo del negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mariscos y maíz, con esta inversión piensa mantenerse en el negocio y dar abasto a la demanda.
Su aspiración es tener mejores ventas, ganar más dinero, cubrir todas las necesidades básicas y apoyar a su hija para que culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Griselda lives in "El Transito" in the department of San Miguel with her husband and 15-year-old daughter.

Griselda sells seafood and tortillas and has a lot of experience running the business.

She is requesting a loan to buy seafood and corn to maintain her business and keep up with demand.   Her goal is to increase sales and earn money so she can cover basic needs and help her daughter finish her education.

loans.use: To buy seafood and corn

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is 29 years old and is married with one child who is 7 years old. Her business is well-organized. He employees three person for help him. Jean De Dieu works from 7 am until 7 pm every day and has six years of experience.

Jean De Dieu has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more bread, juice and water. With these profits, Jean De Dieu will reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy more bread, juice, and water.

loans.name: Jaime Arturo

texts.es:
Jaime, reside en San Miguel, vive con su familia, tiene tres hijos de 18, 17 y 23 años de edad, él posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, es negocio familiar y lo ejerce desde hace 20 años, lo aprendió de su padre y hoy día es el que permite tener una fuente de ingreso.
El necesita comprar materiales para realizar unos trabajos, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar hierro de diferentes medidas, esta inversión le ayudara a solventar la falta de materiales y poder realizar los trabajos de los clientes.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio grande, de doble función, tener una mejor estabilidad y ayudar a sus hijos a superarse.
texts.en:
Jaime lives in San Miguel with his family. He has three children ages 18,17 and 23. He owns a workshop that builds metal structures. It is a family business that he has run for 20 years; he learned from his father and now it is his income source.

He needs to buy materials for some jobs, so he has asked for a loan to buy rebar of different sizes. The loan will help him to cover the lack of materials and be able to finish the jobs for his customers.

His dream is to have a big business with dual-purpose, to have greater stability and to help his children to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy rebar.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva, tiene 49 años, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos de 24, 20, 18 y 15 años de edad. Antonia comprará pollos vivos de la granja QUISPE, por mayor y los llevara a la selva de Pichari donde los vende con la ayuda de sus hijos, parte del préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de pollos vivos y la otra parte en la compra de arroz, aceite y papas.
Antonia también tiene una carreta donde vende pollos broaster, arroz chaufa, en la Alameda del Cementerio de lunes a domingo por las noches. 
Está en Finca Perú hace tres ciclos, ingreso por la invitación de una amiga, le gusta porque pasa momentos gratos con sus compañeras de banco y puede ahorrar.
Con sus ahorros pudo comprarse su carreta y servicios, Ahora está ahorrando para incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the “Agua Viva” (Living Water) Community Bank. She is 49 years old, and a single mother of four children ages 24, 20,18 and 15. Antonia buys live chickens from the QUISPE farm for wholesale prices and brings them to the Pichari jungle where she sells them with the help of her children. Part of this loan will be used to buy live chickens and the other part will be used to buy rice, oil and potatoes.
Antonia also has a small cart from which she sells roasted chicken, fried rice mixed with vegetables and potatoes. She sells this food on Cemetery Avenue from Monday to Friday in the evenings.
She has had three loan cycles with FINCA Perú. She was invited to join by her friend. She likes the group as she has pleasurable moments with her companions at the bank and she can save money there. With her savings she will buy a cart and services. She is saving in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy live chickens, rice, oil and potatoes at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, resiD. en Yoloaiquin departamento D. Morazán, tiene 38 años, es casada, vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 21, 20 y 15 años D. edad, hace 13 años posee una tienda donD. ofrece diversidad D. productos (dulces, galletas, boquitas, azúcar, arroz, pan, bebidas), lo atienD. todos los días D. la semana a tiempo completo.
