Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería: jabón, aceite, frijol, arroz, azúcar, sal, entre otras, ya que estos productos son demandados por los clientes, permitiéndole estar preparada para atenderles D. la mejor manera.
Este préstamo le ayudara a potenciar el negocio y a fortalecer sus aspiraciones D. ayudar a sus hijos en el crecimiento profesional y que el negocio sea mayor.
texts.en:
Sandra lives in Yoloaiquin, in Morazán department.  She is 38 years old, married, and lives with her husband and three children aged 21, 20 and 15.  Sandra has owned a store for 13 years where she offers a range of products (sweet treats, cookies, snacks, sugar, rice, bread and drinks).  She serves in her store full time, every day of the week.

Sandra is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as soap, oil, beans, rice, sugar, salt, etc. since her customers request these products.  This will allow her to be better equipped to serve them.

This loan will help Sandra to boost her business and strengthen her aspirations of helping her children to grow professionally and helping her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy merchandise including soap, oil, beans, rice, sugar and salt

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.es:
Erasmo, reside en Osicala departamento de Morazán, se dedica a  la siembra de granos básicos maíz, frijol y maicillo, él tiene 59 años de edad, vive con su esposa y un nieto de 16 años de edad, Don Erasmo siembra tres manzanas de terreno, todos los años prepara la tierra para la época de invierno.
Él invertirá en fertilizantes, semilla y equipo de sistema de riego, para esto solicita un préstamo que cubra el gasto y le permita realizar el trabajo, esta inversión le ayudara para aumentar la producción.
Su aspiración es instalar en su propiedad, un sistema de riego para tener una mejor condición en su producción y en un futuro trabajar con dinero propio, ser independiente.
texts.en:
Erasmo lives in Osicala, in Morazán department.  He grows basic grains, corn, beans and sorghum.  He is 59 years old and lives with his wife and a 16 year-old grandson.  Erasmo sows three 'manzanas' of land (one manzana = 1.68 acres).  Every year he prepares his land for the winter season.

Erasmo will invest in fertilizers, seeds and irrigation equipment.  He is requesting a loan that will cover this expense and allow him to carry out his work.  This investment will help him to increase his production.

Erasmo's dream is to set up an irrigation system on his property so that he has better conditions for his production.  In the future, he would like to work with his own money and be independent.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizers, seeds and irrigation equipment

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva, tiene 54 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos. Julia se dedica a la venta de flores. Julia compra: claveles, gladiolos, pompos en Uchuypampa y los vende en su puesto de flores en el mercado Nery García, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de flores variadas.
Julia ingreso a FINCA Perú, por la invitación de una socia, le gusta las reuniones de su Banco Comunal por los ahorros. Con sus ahorros está construyendo su casa y tambien ahorra para la educación de sus hijos.
Su sueño es llegar a ser mayorista y que sus hijos sean profesionales
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Agua Viva community bank.  She is 54 years old, married, and has 7 children.  Julia sells flowers.  She buys carnations, gladioli and 'pompos' in Uchuypampa and sells them on her flower stall in Nery García market.  She is requesting a loan to invest in buying a variety of flowers.

Julia joined FINCA Peru through an invitation from an existing member.  She enjoys her community bank meetings because of the savings.  She is building a house with her savings and also saving for her children's education.

Julia's dream is to become a wholesaler and for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy flowers

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
José, reside en Delicias de Concepción, departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 21 años de edad, él se dedica a la apicultura, que es el manejo de las abejas en sus colmenas, lleva 30 años dedicándose a este trabajo,  su hijo le ayuda al manejo del apiario.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales para producir las colmenas, como marcos, fondos, tapadera y cajas.  Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar el apiario y con todos estos materiales completos aumentaran sus ingresos ya que contara con una mejor producción.
Su aspiración es tener un apiario de 60 que tiene capacidad para tener hasta 200 colmenas.
texts.en:
Jose resides in Delicias de Concepción, department of Morazán, where he lives with his wife and 21 year old son. He dedicates himself to apiculture, which is the management of bees in their beehives. He has been carrying out this work for 30 years; his son also helps manage the apiary.

He is requesting a loan to purchase materials to build the beehives, such as frames, bottoms, lids, and boxes. This investment will help him expand the apiary, and with all these materials complete his income will increase given that he will be able to count on an improved production.

His dream is to have an apiary of 60, which has the capacity to hold up to 200 beehives.

loans.use: To purchase materials to build beehives, such as frames, bottoms, lids, and boxes.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva, tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene 6 hijos. Se dedica a la siembra y venta de F. y verduras, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de semillas para la siembra. Paulina siembra F. y verduras en Uchuypampa y los vende a sus caceras por mayor. Los días domingos vende en la Feria del Mercado de las Américas.
Está en FINCA Perú hace 2 años, ingreso por la invitación de la promotora, le gusta porque le facilitan los créditos para trabajar y puede ahorrar con sus ahorros compró artefactos para su casa. Su sueño es que su negocio siga prosperando y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Communal Bank Agua Viva, she is 40 years old, married, and has 6 children. She dedicates herself to planting and selling flowers and vegetables. The loan that she requests will be invested in the purchase of seeds for planting. Paulina plants flowers and vegetables in Uchuypampa and sells them wholesale to neighborhood stores. On Sundays she sells at the las Américas Market.

She has been with FINCA Perú for 2 years after being invited to join by the loan officer. She likes FINCA Perú because it facilitates loans so that she can work and save; with her savings she has bought household items. Her dream is that her business continues to prosper and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: purchase seeds to plant flowers.

loans.name: Las Malinches Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Malinches, está localizado en la comunidad de Tétela del Volcán, en el estado de Morelos, México, está integrado por las señoras Adelaida y Raquel ellas van a comprar con su crédito jabón, azúcar, refrescos, aceite, leche, etc. Para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, las señoras Herminia y Genoveva van a comprar abono e insecticida para fumigar y darle mantenimiento a sus huertas y produzcan más fruta, la señora Anastacia va a comprar Durazno y aguacate, la señora Consuelo va a comprar alimento para criar sus cerdos, la señora Adelaida tiene 66 años de edad, ella tiene 10 hijos todos son mayores de edad ya se casaron y ya trabajan, ellas son Ofelia de 48 años de edad, Raquel de 47 años de edad, Roberto de 46 años de edad, Albertico de 44 años de edad, Evelia de 42 años de edad, Victoria de 40 años de edad, Ismael de 38 años de edad, Fidencio de 36 años de edad, Delfina tiene 34 años de edad y Edgar de 32 años de edad, ella tiene su tienda de abarrotes y sus huertas de aguacate, ella solicito su crédito para comprar mercancía jabón, aceite, refrescos, jugos, sabritas, Gamesa, maíz, huevo, papel higiénico, sardinas, atún, pañales, veladoras, dulces, pan, etc. Para tener surtida su tienda de abarrotes, ella inicio su negocio hace 8 años su hija le dio dinero y pensó en poner su negocio compro la mercancía para su tienda, ella también tiene su huerta de aguacate cuando hay que trabajar en las huertas contrata a un peón para que trabaje en las huertas abonando o cortando la fruta. Su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos para comer, para los gastos y para cuando se enferma, ella está muy emocionada con este préstamo porque va a surtir su tienda para que se vea bonita y tenga mercancía para ofrecerles a sus clientes, ella quisiera que tenga salud, que sus hijos estén felices y que estén bien. Las integrantes quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “Estamos agradecidas con ustedes que nos apoyan para crecer nuestros negocios”. Tétela del Volcán es fresco, hay árboles frutales, duraznos, aguacate, pera, capulín, tejocote, ciruela, cuajinicuil.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called Las Malinches. It is located in the Tétela del Volcán community, in the state of Marelos, Mexico. 

To stock their store, group members Adelaida and Raquel will use their loan to purchase soap, sugar, beverages, oil, milk, etc. Herminia and Genoveva will purchase fertilizer and insecticide to fumigate and treat their orchards so that they produce more fruit.  Anastacia will purchase peaches and avocados. Consuelo will purchase feed to raise her pigs.

Adelaida is 66 years old, and has 10 older children that are married and working; they are as follows: Ofelia who is 48 years old, Raquel who is 47 years old, Roberto who is 46 years old, Albertico who is 44 years old, Evelia who is 42 years old, Victoria who is 40 years old, Ismael who is 38 years old, Fidencio who is 36 years old, Delfina who is 34 years old, and Edgar who is 32 years old.  She has a small grocery store and an avocado orchard. She is requesting a loan to stock her store by purchasing merchandise, such as soap, oil, beverages, juices, snacks, corn, eggs, toilet paper, sardines, tuna, diapers, candles, candies, bread, etc.  She thought to start this business 8 years ago, after her daughter gave her money which she used to purchase merchandise for her store. She also has an avocado orchard. When it is time to work in the orchard, she hires a laborer to fertilize and cut fruit. Her business is important because it allows her to earn income to eat, pay for expenses, and for when she falls ill. She is very excited about this loan because it will allow her to stock her store so that it looks nice and so that she has merchandise to offer her clients. She wishes to be in good health and that her children are happy and well. 

The group members would like to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad that, “we are very grateful to you for supporting us so that we can grow our businesses.” 

The Tétela del Volcán area is cool, and there are many peach, avocado, pear, wild cherry, hawthorn, plum, and cuajinicuil fruit trees.

loans.use: purchase oil, beverages, juices, snacks, corn, eggs, toilet paper, sardines, tuna, diapers, candles, candies, bread, etc, to stock her small grocery store.

loans.name: Yasmery Magaly

texts.es:
Yasmery, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, es comerciante de ropa, es madre soltera, vive con sus padres y tiene una hija de cinco años de edad, Yasmery tiene un año de dedicarse al negocio, trabaja de lunes a sábado.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo, comprando más prendas de vestir como blusas, faldas, camisetas y pantalones.
Esta inversión le ayudara a tener más ingresos y a tener una mejor solvencia para cubrir los gastos familiares, ella aspira avanzar en su negocio, terminar sus estudios, ayudar a su hija en sus estudios y algún día comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Yasmery lives in San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazán. She sells clothes for a living and is a single mother. She lives with her parents and has a 5 year old daughter. Yasmery has been running her business for one year and works from Monday through Saturday.

Currently, she is requesting a loan to increase her capital by buying more clothing articles such as blouses, skirts and pants. This investment will will help her to earn more income and to have a better solvency to cover the family's expenses. She aspires to move forward with her business, finish her studies, help her daughter with her studies and one day buy her own house.

loans.use: to buy clothing articles: blouses, skirts, shirts and pants.

loans.name: Santo Tomas Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Santo Tomas se encuentra localizado en Popotlan, Temoac, en el estado de Morelos, México, esta conformado por Anita va a comprar cacerolas y recaudos para surtir su negocio, Eloisa va a comprar ropa interior por mayoreo, Leticia va a comprar zapatos y catálogos para surtir su negocio, Enrique va a comprar maíz para sembrar, Marcelina va a comprar refrescos, aceite, azúcar, huevo, jabón, cloro, papel higiénico, veladoras etc. para su tienda de abarrotes. La señora Anita es la representante del grupo, ella tiene 56 años de edad vive en unión libre, tiene 7 hijos Susana de 36 años de edad, Surey tiene 33 años de edad, Omar de 28 años de edad, José Francisco y José Augusto de 24 años de edad, Patricia de 23 años de edad y Luis Ángel de 15  años de edad, ella tiene su negocio de venta de comida, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar utensilios para preparar la comida como son vaporeras, cacerolas, cuchara cafetera y vasos chicos para yogurt ya que en la Telesecundaria donde vende los alimentos a los alumnos y maestros le prohibieron utilizar productos desechables, ella inicio su negocio hace 4 años, ella aprendió en su trabajo estuvo mucho tiempo trabajando en restaurante, ella ofrece a sus clientes picaditas, tlacoyos, tacos de arroz, taquitos de suadero, flautas, dobladas de pollo, enchiladas, tostadas, pozole, tacos dorados, les va cambiando el menú, su negocio es importante porque le gusta cocinar, apoyar a los niños de la Telesecundaria y tiene su fuente de trabajo. Ella está muy contenta con este préstamo porque va a comprar sus utensilios para la cocina para preparar sus alimentos con mejor calidad y se vea bonita su cocina. Sus sueños y esperanzas son crecer en su negocio, tener buena salud y fuerzas para trabajar también que sus hijos tengan un buen trabajo y su hijo el chico tenga una profesión. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos su confianza que nos dan, gracias a ustedes podemos salir adelante, para que nuestros negocios crezcan y tengan fuerza”.

loans.use: to buy steamers, pans, spoons, and small glasses for yogurt

loans.name: Las Piedras Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Las Piedras, se encuentra localizado en San Vicente de Juárez, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos México, está conformado por las señoras Olegaria y Maribel van a comprar con su crédito masa, tortillas, carne para preparar su comida, el Señor Macedonio va a comprar zapato de dama, caballero y niño, la señora Edilia va a comprar refrescos, leche, huevos, azúcar para surtir su negocio, la señora Oliva va a comprar teleras, jamón, queso, verduras, salchichas para preparar tortas. La señora Oliva tiene 26 años de edad es madre soltera tiene 2 niñas Lalis de 5 años de edad y Emily de 3 años de edad están viviendo con sus papas, ella tiene su negocio de ventas por catalogo de perfumes, cosméticos de Jafra y Avon y colchas por catalogo, ella solicito su préstamo para invertir en perfumes, cosméticos y colchas y tener mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes, su negocio es ambulante, sale a ofrecer sus productos de casa en casa, ella inicio su negocio hace 1 año la invito su prima y le pareció bien, lo aprendió ella sola, mete sus pedidos y le dan crédito de un mes, ella está muy contenta con el préstamo que le van a dar lo va a invertir en su negocio para ofrecerles a sus clientes y tener en existencia. Ella tiene la esperanza de hacer un cuartito si Dios quiere para vivir ahí con sus niñas y progresar, también que sus niñas estudien y tengan una carrera. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos su interés de ayudarnos en nuestros negocios y que Dios lo Bendiga, gracias”
texts.en:
This community bank is called 'Las Piedras'.  It is located in San Vicente de Juárez, Ayala, in the State of Morelos, Mexico.  It is made up of Olegaria and Maribel, who will use their loan to buy dough, tortillas and meat for preparing their meals; Macedonio, who will buy men's women's and children's shoes; Edilia, who will buy soft drinks, milk, eggs and sugar to stock her business and Oliva, who will buy rolls, ham, cheese, vegetables and sausages to make sandwiches.

Oliva is 26 years old.  She is a single mother and has two daughters: 5 year-old Lalis and 3 year-old Emily.  They are living with her parents.  Oliva has a business selling Avon and Jafra perfumes and cosmetics, and bedspreads through catalogs.  She requested her loan to invest in perfumes, cosmetics and bedspreads so that she would have merchandise to offer her customers.  She does not sell from a fixed sales location.  She goes door to door to sell her products.  Oliva started this business one year ago.  Her cousin invited her to do it and it seemed a good idea.  She learned the business herself.  She places her orders and they give her one month's credit.  She is very happy with the loan that she is going to be given.  She will invest it in her business so that she can offer the products to her customers and have them in stock.

Oliva hopes to build a room, if God so wishes, so that she can live there with her daughters and make progress.  She also wants her daughters to study and have a career.

The members of this group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "We thank you for your interest in helping us with our businesses.  God bless you.  Thank you".

loans.use: to buy perfume, cosmetics and bedspreads

location.town: San Vicente de Juarez, Ayala, Mor.

loans.name: C4824 Tunezeranwe Group

texts.en:
Beathe is 26 years old with one child who is 2 years old..She is pictured above on the right. For three years, she has owned a small shop which sells various products such as rice, sugar, cosmetics, and so on. Her business is open from 6 am until 7 pm every day. Beathe and her business are well known in the region, which is the reason why she is the leader of the group called “Tunezeranwe” in the local language. Her group consists of two women and three men.

Beathe and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products like rice, sugar, cosmetics, and so on for their businesses. Beathe especially needs this loan in order to expand her product offering and to satisfy the demands of her customers. If this satisfaction is reached, Beathe and the other group members hope to earn more profits. With these profits, she expects to save money for her future and to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more product to sell like rice ,sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the introduction of potable water in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and hire workers to start preparing the land.

loans.name: Altagracia

texts.es:
Altagracia, resiD. en Chilanga departamento D. Morazán, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, uno le ayuda en el negocio y el otro estudia séptimo grado, ella se dedica a la venta D. comida, trabajando en un comedor en el mercado municipal D. Gotera, este negocio tiene mucho tiempo D. existir y los oficios los inicia en la mañana.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar los alimentos, como carnes, aceite, arroz, frijoles, queso entre otros, esta inversión le ayudara a tener la disponibilidad D. productos necesarios para la elaboración D. los menús.
Los sueños D. ella es que sus hijos sean profesionales y que su negocio crezca para mantener en óptimas condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Altagracia lives in Chilanga, Morazán Department, with her husband and children.  One of them helps her in her business and the other is in 7th graD..  She sells food working in an eatery in the Gotera Municipal Market.  The business has been in operation for a long time and she starts work in the morning.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy food preparation ingredients like meats, oil, rice, beans and cheese, among others.  This investment will help her have products available that she needs to prepare her meals.

Her dreams are that her children become professionals and that her business grows to keep her family in the best possible living conditions.

loans.use: to buy meats, oil, rice, beans and cheese, among others.

loans.name: C4823 Abizeranye Group

texts.en:
Olive is 27 years old and is married with one child who is 3 years old. She is the presidente of a group called “Abizeranye” and she sells clothes. This is her one successful year in this business, which she runs from 8 am until 5 pm every day.

Olive and her team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of increasing the quantity of clothes. With this expansion, she really hopes that the earned profits will increase. With these profits, she will be able to satisfy the basic needs of her family and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elvin Nahun

texts.es:
Elvin, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de refrescos, vive con su madre, es soltero y trabaja para ayudar a sus padres en la estabilidad del hogar, vende refrescos naturales y sodas.
Él inicio este negocio con el propósito de ayudar a sus padres, hasta el momento el negocio ha sido rentable y solo necesita estar invirtiéndole continuamente en recursos necesarios para los refrescos naturales.
Necesita un préstamo para la compra de frutas como melón, manzanas, piña, azúcar y sodas, esta inversión le ayudara a producir siempre los refrescos naturales.
Sus sueños son crecer en el negocio como microempresario hasta tener un negocio bien establecido.
texts.en:
Elvin lives in San Francisco Gotera in Morazán Department.  He sells beverages.  He’s single living with his mother and works to help his parents with household costs.  He sells natural beverages and soft drinks.

He started this business with the aim of helping his parents.  To date, the business has been profitable and he only has to continuously invest the necessary resources in it for the natural beverages.

He needs a loan to buy fruit like melon, apples and pineapple and to buy sugar and soft drinks.  This investment will help him to produce natural beverages always.

His dream is to continue growing in his business as a micro businessman until achieving a well established business.

loans.use: to buy fruit like melon, apples and pineapple and to buy sugar and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ingrid Jasmin

texts.es:
Ingrid, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, tiene 22 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus suegros, es comerciante de ropa, tiene un año y medio de dedicarse al negocio, ella visita a los clientes en sus viviendas, este trabajo surgió por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingreso para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de camisas, ropa interior y blusas, esta compra le ayudara a surtir el negocio y a recibir un mejor precio en la compra por docenas.
Ingrid aspira un día poder tener un local propio, donde  no tenga que recorrer lugares para ofrecer la mercadería, también tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ingrid lives in San Francisco Gotera, Morazán Department.  She is 22 years old and lives with her husband and in-laws.  She is clothing merchant. She’s been in the business a year and a half.  She visits customers in their homes.  This work arose from the need to have a source of income to cover household expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy shirts, underwear and blouses.  This purchase will help her stock her business and to get a better price when buying by the dozen.

Ingrid hopes someday to have a locale of her own so as not to have to wander from place to place to offer her merchandise and also to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses and underwear.

loans.name: Soraida

texts.es:
Soraida López V., casada con el señor Floricel Rojas Pérez, en cual procrearon tres hijos varones, el primero es Braulio de catorce años, Rubicel de doce en primero de secundaria y el ultimo es Marco Jareth de cinco años y comenta que el mayor ya está fuera de su responsabilidad.

    Se dedica a la compra y venta de zapatos de  marca Andrea, terra y pardo, en donde lleva nueve años   cuatro mese y nos comenta que le va bien ya que con ellos está logrando incrementar su solvencia económica.

   Su por esta actividad comenzó  ya que también  quiere apoyar a su  con los ingresos  de su humilde hogar, para así los dos aportar y darle un bienestar a sus hijos que están creciendo y estudiando.

   Su más grande deseo es que logre a que negocio crezca, para que con el tiempo pueda tener su propia zapatería y a poyar a sus hijos que  quiere que terminen una carrera.
texts.en:
Soraida López V. is married to Mr. Floricel Rojas Pérez and they are the parents of three boys: Braulio, 14, Rubicel, 12, in 7th grade, and the youngest is Marco Jareth, 5. She comments that the oldest is no longer in her care.

She sells shoes of the Andrea, Terra and Pardo brands.  She’s been in this line of work for nine years and four months and she comments that she does well because they are helping her increase her economic solvency.

She started in the business because she wants to contribute her income to the support of her humble home so that both of them can contribute and provide wellbeing for their children who are growing and going to school.

Her greatest wish is that her business grows so that she can have her own shoe store in time to support her children because she wants them to finish a career.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
María  Estela López  M., es casada con el señor Jorge Amín López Velasco, con quien procreo  dos hijos Víctor Lenin  de doce años en sexto de primaria y Jennifer Jacqueline de  diez años en quinto de primaria.

      Ella solcito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de cosmético  de la marca  avon, en esta actividad lleva dos años  y seis meses, lo que nos comenta que le va bien ya que con ello también puede comprar materiales que la ayudan a elaborar piñatas ya que es con las dos actividades con laque se apoya para tener ingresos en su hogar.

      Su motivación a esta actividad es por la necesidad que hay en la economía de los gastos y desea apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos  a un que su familia es pequeña desea darle lo mejor.

      Su más grande deseo es que con sus dos actividades  sus ingresos sean cada día mas mejor, para apoyar a sus hijos en su educación y con ánimo puedan terminar una carrera.
texts.en:
María  Estela López  M. is married to Mr. Jorge Amín López Velasco with whom she has two children: Victor Lenin, 12 and in 6th grade and Jennifer Jacqueline, 10, in fifth grade.

She asked for the loan to invest in the purchase of Avon brand cosmetics.  She’s been in this line of work for two years and six months.  What she comments to us is that she does well because with it she can also buy supplies that help her make piñatas.  It is with both of these activities that she supports herself to have income for her home.

She was motivated into this activity because of economic need to cover expenses and she wants to help her husband with income.  Even though her family is small, she wants to give it the best.

Her greatest wish is that income from her two activities will be greater each day to support her children in their schooling with the aim of their finishing a career.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to resell in her community.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora María del Carmen  V. García, vive el barrio de san francisco, de Copainala Chiapas, ella es cada  con el seños Adán López Hernández, y con quien procreo  cinco  hijos  quienes cuatro  ya están casados y una está a su responsabilidad, Jorge Amín,  Soraida, Irma, Jesús Antonio,  y la más pequeña es Laura patricia de  diesi nueva años  quien trabaja como instructora de conafe.

     Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos de granja  para liego venderlo  aliñado en el misma  barrio, es esta actividad comenta que le va bien ya que le ha estado dejando buenos ingresos que le han hecho comprar más pollos para que  no esté limitada y le ofrezca un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

     Su motivo a este trabajo es para tener su propio dinero y solicito el préstamo para apoyarse con sus gastos que realiza en la compra de los pollos por reja.

     Su más grande deseo es que Dios le siga prestando vida, para seguir trabajando para ahorrar y así apoyar a su última hija que desea seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Mrs. María del Carmen V. García lives in the San Francisco neighborhood of Copainalá, Chiapas.  She’s married to Mr. Adán López Hernández with whom she had five children four of whom are married and one is still in her care: Jorge Amín, Soraida, Irma, Jesús Antonio and the youngest, Laura Patricia, 19, who works as a Conafe instructor.

She buys free range chickens that she then butchers and sells in her neighborhood.  She comments that she does well with this activity since it’s been producing good income that has made it possible to buy more chickens so that her supply isn’t limited and she can offer better customer service.

The reason behind this work is to have her own money and she asked for the loan to cover expenses incurred in buying crates of chickens.

Her greatest wish is that God will continue providing her with life so that she can continue to work to save up and support her youngest daughter who wants to continue studying.

loans.use: to buy crates of chickens to butcher and sell.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
MARIA TERESA P. L.
La señora María Teresa P. López  se dedica a la venta de perfumería , ropa  típica y joyería  desde hace 12 años ella tiene 5 hijos   dos de ellos  son menores de edad  y los otros  tres son mayores de edad   la señora a salido adelante  con la ayuda de sus  hijos   ya que desde hace  6 años  murió su esposo por ese motivo  necesita su nuevo refinanciamiento  en crédito para poder surtir mas sus ventas   en cosmeticos en perfumeria  es la que más vende  y otra parte para ropa típica   por ser en este mes abril que se tiene la semana santa  y  a tenido muchos pedidos de ropa   su mayor deseo es seguir trabajando para poder sostener su negocio y a sus hijos y así mismo poder contratar a alguna persona  para poder  vender mas.
texts.en:
María Teresa P. López has been selling perfume, typical clothing, and jewelry for 12 years.  She has five children.  Two of them are minors, and the other three are adults.   Since her husband died six years ago, she has gotten ahead with the help of her children

That is why she needs a new loan to be able to be better stocked for her cosmetic and perfume sales.  That is what she sells the most.  She will use part of the loan for typical clothing because Holy Week is in April, and she has had many clothing orders.

Her greatest wish is to continue working to be able to sustain her business and support her children.  Also, she would like to be able to hire someone in order to be able to sell more.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and typical clothing

loans.name: Claribel

texts.es:
La señora Claribel Gómez Pérez, vive en el barrio de san fráncico, ella  es casada con el señor Gabriel Ángel Sánchez Jiménez, con quien procreo  tres hijos: Gabriela Lizbeth de quince años, Brianda Itzel  de de siete años y las mas pequeña es kely claribel de once meses de edad.

    Ella se dedica a la venta de cosmético  de la marca  avon, en donde lleva seis meses,  y nos cometa que  se inspiro en esta actividad para apoyar asu esposo con los ingresos de su hogar y así tener como sacar adelante a su pequeña  familia.


    Cometa que para dedicarse a este pequeño negocio la animo a una vecina quien tambien se dedica a  distribuir  los productos de avon,   y la invito  que  se asocien  y trabajen juntas así tener como obener sus propio dinero.

  Lo que mas desea es que con esta actividad lo tener sus propios a  horros para que  con ello tenga su  propio negocio y  así  apoyar a sus hijos que están estudiando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Claribel Gómez Pérez lives in the San Francisco neighborhood.  She’s married to Mr. Gabriel Ángel Sánchez Jiménez with whom she had three children: Gabriela Lizbeth, 15, Brianda Itzel, 7 and the youngest, Kely Claribel, 11 months.

She has been selling Avon brand cosmetics for the last six months and she comments to us that she was inspired to go into this business in order to help her husband meet household expenses and be able to raise their small family.

She comments that a neighbor who also sells Avon products encouraged her to go into this small business.  She invited her to be her partner and to work together to have a way to earn their own money.

What she’d like to accomplish the most with this activity is to have her own savings to set up a business of her own and support her children who are studying.

loans.use: to buy Avon brand cosmetics to resell in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase milk, cheese, biscuits and drinks.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada San Miguel Soyaltepec esta comunidad tiene una laguna muy grande que da mucha pesca y trabajo cada año, tambien es conocida porque ahi se ubica la presa hidroele electrica Cerro de Oro.En esta comunidad vive la señora Ana isabel que tiene la edad de 33 años, estudio hasta el tercer grado de secundaria y esta casada con el señor Enrique con el cual tiene tres hijos, ellos asisten a la primaria de la comunidad.

Doña ana nos platica que su esposo es topografo pero algunas veces lo que el gana no alcansa ya que cada dia ls cosas suben mas de precio, asi que dicidio iniciar  a trabajar en su propio negocio para aydarlo un poco con los gastos del hogar y los estudioa de sus pequeños hijos

ella nos dice que vende zapatos por catalogo para dama y caballero,  casa por casa, con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, primero lleva los catalagos con sus clientes para mostrar sus productos, levanta un pedido, lo encarga con sus proveedores, cuando llegan los zapatos los entrega a sus clientes y  recibe su pago por sus productos.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de Catalagos y zapatos para realizar su venta.
 Doña Ana quiere que con este credito hacer crecer su negocio para poder darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y en un futuro poder pagarles una carrera. ella envia un saludo a las personas que hacen posibles estos prestamos y  a la fundacion por darle su confiansa.
texts.en:
There is a community in the state of Oaxaca called San Miguel Soyaltepec.  This community has a very large lagoon that produces much fishing and work each year.  It is also known because the Cerro de Oro Hydroelectric Dam is located there. 

Ana Isabel, 33, lives here.  She finished 9th grade and is married to Enrique with whom she has three children who attend the local elementary school.
Ana tells us that her husband is a Topographer but what he earns is sometimes not enough because prices rise every day.  She, therefore, decided to start to work in a business of own to help him a little with household expenses and educational costs for their small children.

She tells us that she sells women's and men’s shoes by catalogue, door to door, among her friends and neighbors in the community.  She first takes the catalogues around to her customers to show the products, then takes orders which she delivers to her suppliers.  When the shoes arrive she delivers them to her customers and collects payment for them.

She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of catalogues and shoes to sell.  She wants to use the loan to enlarge her business in order to provide her children with a better quality of life and in the future pay for them to study a career.

Ana sends a greeting to the people who make these loans possible and to the Fundación for trusting her.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada San Miguel Soyaltepec esta comunidad tiene una laguna muy grande que da mucha pesca y trabajo cada año, tambien es conocida porque ahi se ubica la presa hidroele electrica Cerro de Oro.En esta comunidad vive la señora Guadalupe J. que tiene la edad de 33 años, estudio hasta el segundo grado de primaria ya que sus padres no tenian los recursos para darle mas estudios, esta casada y tiene dos hijos que asisten a la escuela en su cominidad.

Doña guadalupe nos platica que que hace un poco mas de dos años decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos, ella nos platica que vende refrescos en su casa con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ella nos platica que la venta es buena ya que "no sabemos comer sin un refresco en la mesa", ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de refrescos para resurtir su credito. ella desea en un futuro poder construir un pequeño local en el cual vendera sus refrescos y espera poder invertir un poco en abarrotes para hacer crecer su negocio.
ella se encuentra muy agradecida con la fundacion ya que con este credito podra hacer crecer su negocio y darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca, there is a community called San Miguel Soyaltepec which has a very large lake that provides a lot of fish and work every year.  It is also well known because the Cerro de Oro hydroelectric dam is located there.  Guadalupe J. lives in this community.  Guadalupe is 33 years old and only studied up to the second year of elementary school since her parents didn't have enough money to pay for any further studies.  She is married and has two children who are attending elementary school in her community. 

Guadalupe tells us that a little over two years ago she decided to start working in her own business so that she could help her husband with their household expenses and pay for their children's education.  She tells us that she sells soft drinks from her home.  She sells to her friends and neighbors in the community.  She says that her sales are good because "we don't know how to eat without a soft drink on the table".  Guadalupe needs this loan to invest in buying soft drinks to restock her business.  In the future, she would like to build a small sales location where she could sell her soft drinks and she hopes to invest a little in groceries so that she can grow her business.

Guadalupe is very grateful to Fundación Realidad since this loan will enable her to grow her business and provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to sell soft drinks

loans.name: Jose Omar

texts.es:
José, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la crianza de pollos, tiene 24 años y es soltero, vive con sus padres y tiene 2 años y medio de dedicarse al negocio, sus padres le enseñaron el manejo de la granja y hoy día vende sus productos en su propia casa.
Actualmente quiere invertir en la compra de 250 pollos de engorde y compra de concentrado, esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar la granja y tener mayor disponibilidad de pollos para atender la demanda.
Los sueños actuales son crecer en el negocio y comprar un lote donde poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
José lives in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán department.  His business is raising chickens.  He is 24 years old, single, and lives with his parents.  He has been in his business for two and a half years.  His parents taught him how to run his farm and he sells his products from home.

José would currently like to invest in buying 250 chicks to fatten.  He would also like to buy concentrated feed.  This investment will help him to expand his farm and have more chickens available so that he can meet demand.

José's current dreams are to grow in his business and to buy a plot of land where he can build his own home.

loans.use: to invest in buying 250 chicks to raise and to buy concentrated feed

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada San Miguel Soyaltepec esta comunidad tiene una laguna muy grande que da mucha pesca y trabajo cada año, tambien es conocida porque ahi se ubica la presa hidroele electrica Cerro de Oro.En esta comunidad vive la señora Teresa de Jesus J., ella tiene la edad de 28 años, estudio hasta el tercer grado de secundaria y esta casada con el señor juanque trabaja en el campo de jornalero, ellos tienen dos hijos los cuales asisten a la primaria de la comunidad.

Doña teresa nos platica que hace un poco mas de dos años y medio decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos.
ella vende antojitos mexicanos(tostadas, gorditas, empanadas, tacos, chiles rellenos) en su casa los dias sabados por la noche, y el resto de la semana vende cosmeticos y perfumeria con sus amigas y vecinas de la cominidad. ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de jitomates, chiles, cebolla, carne, tortillas, maiz, frijol, platanos, huevos aceite y gas para la preparacion de sus antojitos y catalogos, cosmeticos y perfumeria.
ella espera que con esta invercion su negocio prospere ya que desea darle una mejor calidad vida a sus hijos y en un futo poder poder pagar su universidad.
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca, there is a community called San Miguel Soyaltepec which has a very large lake that provides a lot of fish and work every year.  It is also well known because the Cerro de Oro hydroelectric dam is located there.  Teresa de Jesus J. lives in this community.  She is 28 years old, studied up to the third year of high school, and is married to Juan who works in the fields as a day laborer.  They have two children who attend a local elementary school.

Teresa tells us that, a little over two and a half years ago, she decided to start working in her own business so that she could help her husband with their household expenses and pay for their children's education.

Teresa sells Mexican snacks (tostadas, gorditas, empanadas, tacos and stuffed chili peppers) from her home on Saturday evenings.  The rest of the week she sells cosmetics and perfumes to her friends and neighbors in the community.  She needs this loan to invest in buying tomatoes, chili peppers, onion, meat, tortillas, corn, beans, plantains, eggs, oil and gas for making her snacks.  She also needs to buy catalogs, cosmetics and perfumes.

Teresa hopes that, with this investment, her business will prosper since she would like to provide her children with a better quality of life and, in the future, she would like to be able to pay for their university studies.

loans.use: to sell perfumes, cosmetics and Mexican snacks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables and to buy flowers

loans.name: Maria Leonilda

texts.es:
María, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera departamento D. Morazán, se dedica a la crianza D. cerdos y la venta D. especias, ella tiene 35 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y tienen ocho hijos D. las edades D. 17, 14, 11, 10, 7, 5, 3 y 1 año respectivamente, María se dedica desD. hace cinco años al negocio D. las especias, tiene un puesto en una calle muy transitada D. la ciudad, el horario D. venta es D. 7:00am a 1:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. especias y hiervas como: manzanilla, pimienta, canela entre otros, este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar el negocio y así mejorar la atención a los clientes.
Sus aspiraciones es ver a sus hijos crecer y poder tener una fuente D. ingreso que le permita darle una vida digna a sus hijos, ya que son muchos y debe esforzarse más para alcanzar a cubrir las necesidades primordiales.
texts.en:
María lives in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán department.  Her business is raising pigs and selling spices.  She is 35 years old and lives with her husband.  They have eight children aged 17, 14, 11, 10, 7, 5, 3 and 1.  María has been selling spices for five years.  She has a sales location in a very busy street in the city.  She makes her sales from 7.00am to 1.00pm.

María is currently requesting a loan to buy spices and herbs including camomile, pepper and cinnamon.  This loan will help her to increase her business and thereby improve her customer service.

María's wish is to see her children grow up and to be able to have a source of income that allows her to proviD. her children with a decent life as there are a lot of them and she must work harder in order to cover their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy spices and herbs such as camomile, pepper, cinnamon, etc.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo Chávez C., tiene la edad de 59 años, está casado  y vive con su señora esposa. El pretende con el préstamo realizar la siembra de maíz y frijol y su posterior asistencia.  El cuenta con el terreno con una parte sembrada y quiere sembrar otra parte más y asistir los dos cultivos con sus insumos  y todo lo necesario para su cosecha. El cuenta con la experiencia desde hace mucho tiempo atrás y quiere llegar a generar ganancias para el sustento de él y su esposa. También pretende con esta asistencia que le hará que sea mayor la producción  de sus cultivos y seguir creciendo como agricultor de la zona sin dejar de proyecto de los granos básicos. 
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gerardo Chávez C., age 59, is married and lives with his wife.  He plans to use the loan to plant corn and beans and for the crops’ subsequent care.  He has a piece of land, which is partially sown.  He wants to plant on another part of the land.  He also wants to tend to the two crops with his supplies and everything that is needed for the harvest.

He has many years of experience.  He wants to generate income to support himself and his wife.  He also intends to use this help to increase the production of his crops.  He intends to keep growing as a farmer in the zone without giving up the basic grains plan.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDESCOSUR.  He has not had any other loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better terms, and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to plant corn and beans and for the crops’ subsequent care.

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
Américo, reside en San Miguel  vive  junto a su esposa y se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 5 años, trabaja todos los días de 4:00am a 3:00pm, el aprendió de sus padres y hasta el momento no tiene problemas en el negocio.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollo, carnes, arroz, aceite, vegetales y condimentos, este préstamo le ayudara a mantener todos los ingredientes necesarios para elaborar los menús necesarios para ofrecer a los clientes, y atenderles de la mejora manera.
Su aspiración es mantenerse en el negocio, fortalecerlo y atraer nuevos clientes, así mismo ayudar a su esposa y juntos trabajar por mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Américo lives with his wife in San Miguel.  He has been selling food for five years.  He works every day from 4:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.   He learned this business from his parents, and so far he has not had any problems.

He is requesting a loan to buy chicken, meat, rice, oil, vegetables, and condiments.  This loan will help him to keep on hand all of the ingredients he needs to make the catered meals for his customers.  It will also help him tend to his customers better.

His goal is to stay in the business and to strengthen it.  His goal is also to help his wife so that they can work together to improve their financial situation.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, rice, oil, vegetables, and condiments.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 36 year-old Aminata from Kissy in Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 15 and 20. All of Aminata’s children attend school. They also take care of seven relatives.

Aminata runs a local produce (food stuff) store. She sells groundnut, rice, and palm oil. She has been running this business for 10 years. Aminata has requested a loan in order to purchase more local product. The extra income from this loan will allow her to rent a big store. In the future, she plans to be a supplier to other business partners.

loans.use: to purchase groundnut, beans and palm oil.

loans.name: Roaldo

texts.es: Don Roaldo: es de 44 años casado tiene una hija que estudia el se dedica a vender productos de usos domesticos como ponchos,chamarras,cortinas,etc el nombre de su comercial es KENDY el nos cuenta que solo vende por las mañanas porque por las tardes ocupa su tiempo en cobrar el sueño de el es ampliar su negocio y abrir otro local para aumentar sus ventas para darle un mejor futuro a su esposa y a su hija, el credito lo solicita para la compra de productos de usos domesticos para la venta.
texts.en:
Roaldo is 44 years old and married.  He has a daughter who goes to school.

He sells domestic products like ponchos, jackets, and curtains, etc.  The name of his business is Kendy.  He tells us that he only sells in the mornings.  In the afternoons he uses his time to achieve his dream of expanding his business and opening another location.  He will do this to increase sales in order to give his wife and daughter a better future.

He will use the requested loan to buy domestic products to sell.

loans.use: to buy domestic use products.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio, reside en San Miguel, es comerciante de frutas y verduras, vive con su esposa  y sus hijos de 3 años de edad y el otro recién nacido. Él negocio de Lucio es la venta de frutas y verduras de forma ambulante, se traslada en una bicicleta de carga.
Él quiere trabajar fuerte en este negocio, por lo que busca invertir a través de un préstamo en frutas de temporada como: melones, mangos, también verduras como papas y zanahorias. Esta será una gran ayuda para él, ya que tendrá mayor disponibilidad de productos para ofrecer a los clientes lo que le permitirá obtener más ventas.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuerte para progresar con el negocio, crecer en mercadería para algún día comprarse un vehículo y en el transportarse con la mercadería.
texts.en:
Lucio lives in San Miguel. He is a fruit and vegetable vendor. He lives with his wife and his children, a three-year-old and a newborn baby. Lucio's business is selling fruits and vegetables as a mobile vendor. He uses a bicycle cart for transportation. 

He would like to work hard in this business, and he is looking to invest in it through a loan to buy seasonal fruits such as melons and mangos, as well as vegetables such as potatoes and carrots. This will be a great help for him, since he will have a greater availability of products to offer his customers, allowing him to increase his sales. 

His goal is to work hard to make progress wtih his business and to expand his merchandise so that someday he can buy a vehicle to transport himself and his products.

loans.use: to buy melons, mangos and vegetables such as potatoes and carrots.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Álvaro E. Pérez, tiene la edad de 57 años, está casado  y vive con su señora esposa y un nieto. El pretende con el préstamo la comprar  los insumos necesarios para la asistencia del maíz. El cuenta con el terreno ya sembrado de este cultivo y lo quiere asistir con los insumos necesarios para una mejor cosecha tanto en cantidad  como calidad. Sus metas son varias como llegar a generar ingresos para el mejoramiento de su calidad de vida de su familia y poder seguir ofreciéndole a su nieto el estudio para que llegue a ser un profesional algún día. Otra de sus aspiraciones es ser un gran agricultor de granos básicos de la zona y seguir creciendo en la zona para  impulsar a mas personas a sembrar para que mejoren su economía. 
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Álvaro E. Pérez, 57, is married living with his wife and a grandson.  He intends to use the loan to buy needed farming supplies for his corn crops.  He has a field already planted with this crop and he wants to help it along with the necessary supplies that will produce a harvest that is better both in quality and quantity.

His goals are several: to generate income sufficient to improve his family’s quality of life and to continue providing his grandson with an education so that he will become a professional someday.  Another one of his hopes is to become a large farmer of basic grains in the zone and to continue growing in the zone to encourage others to plant so that they can improve their economies.

This is his first loan received from FUDECOSUR.  He hadn’t had any previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Rugiatu from Kissy in Sierra Leone. She is married with 2 children, ages 11 and 20. Both of Rugiatu’s children attend school. They also take care of three relatives.

Rugiatu runs a general merchandise store. She sells rice, drinks, television, and DVDs. She has been running this business for six years. Rugiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase rice and cement. The extra income from this loan will allow her to rent a big store. In the future, she plans to be a supplier to other business partners.

loans.use: to purchase rice, drinks and cement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock groceries and thread for her traditional textiles.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es:
Mary, reside en San Miguel se dedica a la venta de tortillas, pan dulce y elabora bolsos, vive con su madre y un sobrino, ella comercializa tortillas, vende pan y también elabora bolsos artesanales, todo para ayudar a su madre y poder mantener el hogar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, pan dulce y materia prima para la elaboración de bolsos como hilo, ciper, broches y más, esta compra le ayudara a tener mercadería en abundancia para confeccionar pedidos y así tener mayor estabilidad con el negocio.
Ella espera que al tener estos tres productos a la venta, disminuya el riesgo por la baja rentabilidad de alguno, y garantiza trabajo para largo plazo.
texts.en:
Mary lives in San Miguel and works selling tortillas [flatbreads], pastries and handmade bags.  She lives with her mother and a nephew and works to help them and maintain the home.

She is currently seeking a loan for the purchase of corn, wood, fresh bread and raw materials for making handbags such as thread, zippers, pins etc.  This purchase would allow her to have plenty of merchandise to complete sales orders and make her business more stable.

She hopes that having these 3 items for sale [tortillas, pastries and bags],will reduce the risk of low sales and guarantee work in the long term.

loans.use: to purchase corn, wood, sweet bread, thread, zippers, brooches and more.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo S. A., tiene la edad de 37 años, está casado, vive con su señora esposa y 2 hijos. El con el dinero pretende la compra de los insumos necesarios para siembra y asistencia de maíz. El alquila el terreno para producir este cultivo y tiene experiencia en los cultivos hace años por lo cual quiere realizar esta siembra.  También el espera que con esta siembra y su asistencia llegar a tener mejor producción para así generar más ingresos para su bienestar y la de su familia y así poder ofrecerles el estudio a sus hijos.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gerardo S. A., 37, is married living with his wife and two children.  He intends to use the money to buy farming supplies for his corn crops.  He leases the fields to produce this crop and has years of farming experience so he wants to carry out this planting.  He also hopes that through the planting and its care he will have better production to generate more income for his and his family’s welfare and to be able to provide his children with schooling.

This is the first loan he’s gotten from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn’t had previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has provided a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Royer

texts.es:
Royer tiene 19 años de edad es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres. Esta familia reside en el distrito de Tambogrande en Piura, en la parte rural de este y lamentablemente no cuenta con los servicios básicos.


El padre de Royer es agricultor y su madre tiene un negocio de bar picantería, que consiste en un pequeño restaurante donde venden comida marina, comida típica del norte del Perú. 


Por las tardes Royer se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su moto lineal, la cual es propia y en las mañanas trabaja en un fundo de banano orgánico como jornalero.


Royer es un nuevo cliente en Edpyme  Alternativa y solicita un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para comprarle llantas a su motocicleta y así poder repararla para seguir contribuyendo con los gastos básicos de su casa 
 

La familia de Royer es una familia muy emprendedora y a pesar de las dificultades que tienen, gozan de muy buenas referencias respecto a sus pagos.
texts.en:
Royer is 19 years old, single and lives in his parents’ house. His family lives in a rural area of Tambogrande, a district in Piuru. Unfortunately they do not have basic services.

Royer’s father is a farmer and his mother has a bar/picantería, a small restaurant serving coastal Peruvian foods, typical foods from the north of Perú.

In the afternoons, Royer transports passengers on his own motorcycle. In the mornings, he works on a large organic banana farm as a laborer. 

Royer is a new client with Edpyme Alternativa. He is requesting a loan for 1500 Nuevos Soles in order to purchase tires for his motorcycle. With that purchase, he can repair the motorcycle and continue helping with the basic expenses in his house.

Royer’s family is very enterprising and in spite of all of their difficulties, they have many good references for their payment history.

loans.use: repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Nelson Ovidio

texts.es:
Nelson, reside en San Miguel, es empleado y en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la sastrería, vive con su familia.
El aprendió el trabajo con su madre y en base a eso gano experiencia y hoy día atiende la sastrería en sus ratos libres, actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales como telas, hilos, botones, esta inversión le ayudara a tener la materia prima necesaria para realizar los trabajos en ropa.
Para Nelson su objetivo es tener ingresos extras, no depender únicamente de su empleo, crecer con la sastrería y al mismo tiempo bordado.
texts.en:
Nelson lives in San Miguel and is employed.  In his spare time he does tailoring.  He lives with his family.

He learned these skills from his mother and based on that he gained experience and today tends to his tailor shop in his free time.  He is asking for a loan to buy supplies like fabric, thread and buttons.  This investment will help him have raw materials available to do work on clothes.

For Nelson, his objective is to earn extra income and not depend solely on his employment, to grow with the tailor shop as well as with embroidery.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fabric, thread and buttons.

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es: Herlinda es socia del Banco Comunal Yana Ñawy, tiene 26 años es soltera. Herlinda vende comida en la Avenida Los Incas Distrito de Jesús Nazareno, solicita un préstamo para la compra de abarrotes para la preparación de alimentos. A Herlinda le gusta FINCA Perú, por la facilidad con la que obtiene los créditos y puede ahorrar, está hace un año y medio con sus ahorros, con ello está pagando su educación en la Universidad Privada Los Ángeles de Chimbote. Su sueño es tener un restaurante y terminar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Herlinda is a member of the Yana Ñawy communal bank.  She is 26 years old and single.  Herlinda sells food on Jesús Nazareno District’s Los Incas Avenue.  She is asking for a loan to buy groceries to prepare her dishes.

Herlinda likes FINCA Perú because of the ease in getting loans and because she can save up.  She’s been saving for a year and a half and she’s using that to pay for her education at the Los Ángeles de Chimbote Private University.  Her dream is to own a restaurant ant to finish her college education.

loans.use: to buy groceries to prepare her dishes.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.en:
Yawa is 45 years old and married with 4 children between 18 and 30 years old. She runs a store at Grassfield in Sierra Leone.

Yawa has been in her business for 12 years, and sells clothing and drinks at her store. She says that the main challenges to her business are weather conditions and price control.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more clothing. Yawa says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to develop her business more.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase food products and used clothing.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, vive con esposo, tres hijos de 15 años, dos y medio y dos meses, tienen un negocio de fabricación de cocinas industriales,  residen en San Miguel, inicio el negocio por sus padres quienes se lo heredaron, no tiene un horario fijo para trabajar porque depende de la demanda.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar rines de carros, tubos de hierro, hierro, laminas, estos materiales son los que utiliza para elaborar las cocinas, por lo tanto espera con esta inversión aumentar la producción.
Su objetivo es tener siempre materiales para fabricar las cocinas, ya que este es el negocio que cubre con sus ingresos los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and three children aged fifteen, two and a half and two months.  They live in San Miguel and have a business making industrial stoves.  Ana inherited the business from her parents.  She doesn't work fixed hours because everything depends on demand.  She is requesting a loan to buy car wheel rims, iron tubes, iron and metal sheets.  These materials are what she uses to make her stoves.  She hopes that with this investment she will increase her production.

Ana's goal is to always have materials available to make stoves since this is the business that covers her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy car wheel rims, iron tubes, iron and metal sheets

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is 35 years old and married with an 11-year-old child. He runs a store at Grassfield in Sierra Leone.

Issa has been in this business for 10 years and sells rice, beans and flour at his store. He also earns income from renting a house. He says that the main challenges to his business are weather and prince control.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more goods. Issa says that the extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his child. In the future, he would like to develop his business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans and flour.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 41 years old and married with 3 children, ages between 3 and 7. He runs a store at Lumley in Sierra Leone.

Mohamed has been in this business for 10 years and sells milk, drinks, ovaltine, and biscuits at his store. His business is the only source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is inflation.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more provision items. Mohamed says that the extra income from this loan will help him expand his business. In the future, he would like to run a super market.

loans.use: To purchase milk, drinks, Ovaltine and biscuits.

loans.name: Doris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doris, reside en San Miguel, es comerciante de Ropa, vive con su familia, aun no tiene hijos; el negocio lo distribuye en los municipios cercanos, y decidió dedicarse al negocio por la necesidad de trabajar y tener una fuente de ingreso.
Actualmente quiere compra ropa, blusas, faldas, pantalones y ropa interior, para esto solicita un préstamo el cual espera fortalezca el negocio y sus ingresos.
Su objetivo es trabajar por mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Doris lives in San Miguel and sells clothes.  She lives with her family and doesn't have any children yet.  She carries out her business in nearby towns and decided to start her business because she needed to work and have a source of income.

Doris would currently like to buy clothes: blouses, skirts, pants and underwear.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan which she hopes will strengthen her business and her income.

Doris' goal is to work to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes (blouses, skirts, pants and underwear)
